Name: Diamondmask
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021
Review Content: This Paperwhite is a revelation as my first kindle. Its so light and easy to read with, especially in bed. I am a convert - this is my first ever kindle and there is no going back. Teamed with Kindle Unlimited - its totally brilliant. Just plug it in to charge and way you go. A Goodreads account is offered - I already had one but it took ages to connect to my Kindle, but the first time round while the Kindle is waking up may just be a one-off. The bookmark is also a little sluggish but I think I'm used to the quick response of my laptop so I may be spoiled.

Name: Penelope A. Wythes
Review Title: Loved my last one, love this one too
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 June 2020
Review Content: Only criticism is that I was replacing an exactly similar Kindle only 18 months old.My previous Kindles have lasted much longer - in fact I still have them and they work. I replaced them for newer models with facets that that appealed. My previous Paperwhite however just died suddenly for no apparent reason - working fine one evening, low on charge so left on charge overnight - next day simply wouldn't work. Tried all sorts but it wouldn't resuscitate. Rapidly mobilised an old one, ordered a new one as I do like the Paperwhite. I'll see how this one lasts.

Name: STUART MOSS
Review Title: Very good - better for right handed people though!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 August 2019
Review Content: First the bad:A) Unlike my old Kindle (with the keyboard that I got in 2011 ish) the books seem harder to organise. It seems impossible to now group them all in a ‘file’ (by author) so that the ones you have read are not in the main menu, thus keeping the unread ones separate.B) If you are left handed, you might (like me) find it bloody annoying that you can’t swap round the areas of the touch screen where you turn the page. I hold my books in my left hand and want to use that same hand to turn the page, not have to use my other hand. Yes, yes, I know... ‘first world problems’! Ha! Ha!The Good:A) It is lighter than my old one.B) Love the back lit screen.C) Once you have gotten used to the touch screen (that is a little bit slow) and remembered what every part of the screen does, it is actually an improvement on my old Kindle.

Name: Lilly
Review Title: Worked perfect for 12 months - now forever frozen!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 March 2021
Review Content: I really loved my kindle! Key word, ‘loved’ as in past tense. I bought it 13 months ago and out of the blue it has stopped working! Literally a week after the warranty expired the screen froze and has not unfrozen since. I have tried everything! I’m not sure what is wrong with it but I was so surprised when I googled the problem and hundreds of people experienced the same thing! Most of these consumers had to go and buy new kindles, which I am just not willing to do. £120 for something that is only going to last a year is absurd. Im really disappointed as I loved my kindle, used it often, always treated it right, never dropped it, etc. I have received no help from Amazon concerning advice to fix it, and at this point do not plan on buying a new one. It’s really upsetting and I really think everyone should be aware of this “faulty feature” of the kindles. Not sure what is causing it, but amazon should be taking initiative to fix it, and aren’t.

Name: Chas-Street
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2019
Review Content: I've been using an iPad for 5 years to read my kindle books. My iPad generally runs for around 10 hours on a full charge, so I thought I'd treat myself to a Kindle -  I'm an avid reader and thought the battery would last significantly longer. Unfortunately the battery life is nothing like as good as advertised. I get around 48 hours reading from a full charge. So while the battery does last longer than my iPad, if you read a lot it won't last the equivalent of a week from a full charge. Also I turned it off completely for a few days and the charge still dropped from 94% to 86% without even being used. My advice - if you're going on holiday for more than 2 or 3 days always make sure you have  your charger & lead with you. Finally having read other reviews I do switch it to "Airplane mode" to conserve power while I'm reading, also I keep the backlight off when reading in daylight. So I'm rather disappointed with it's performance.The good points: it was quick and easy to download my book collection, the text is easy to read, and of course it's much smaller and lighter than my iPad to tote around.

Name: Jules C. May
Review Title: Up-to-date version of this classic product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 January 2020
Review Content: I asked Santa for one of these after my cleaner trod on my old 3rd gen (keyboard-style) kindle and broke the screen.Initial impressions are very good.  It feels much smaller to hold (even though the screen is exactly the same size), and the image is much clearer.  I like having just a touch of backlight - it helps the page look whiter - but in the evenings, it's great.  Screen refresh is quick, and battery life is impressive.Only gripe I've got is: this model understands collections differently to the way the apps and other Kindle devices do.  I was very confused to begin with (as I know other people have been). Now I understand what's happening, but I still find it more clumsy than the old way.  I don't understand why the software developers would have changed this, and I wish they'd change it back.Other than that: very happy indeed.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Disappointing quality not as good as older versions
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 November 2019
Review Content: I replaced my 6th generation kindle (2014) with latest paperwhite after dropping in the bath for second time and was glad to replace with a waterproof version  with larger storage. I bought from John Lewis as I had vouchers to use. The back light is poor and I have to increase to near maximum to improve clarity for reading.  The battery is no better than my older kindle and lasts a few days only. It's slow to download books and I have to keep repeating the process and it can have problems syncing.  I've tried to get use to it's failings but I'm not sure if I have a dud one? I plan to contact John Lewis to see if I can get a replacement as I've not had it 12 months yet.

Name: Bedesman
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 September 2020
Review Content: My attempt to register my new Kindle was blocked my a person unknown who claimed there was  a problem with  IP Address Encryption which could not be corrected by Amazon. To prove his identity as an Amazon employee he said this was my third Kindle, that I had a library of 40 books and displayed the first page of my Kindle library on my screen. I was telephoned my BestAdvisors who required payment to correct the IP problem on behalf of Amazon. I foolishly agreed to pay. I later received a second telephone call  to say the problem had been corrected and my Kindle was now fully functional.  This proved to be correct. I now feel certain this was a fraudulent activity carried out against both myself and Amazon. BEWARE.

Name: K. Woodhead
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 January 2019
Review Content: It has been a few weeks since I purchased the Kindle.  It is quite responsive to touch, maybe a bit too much.  I find that when you are holding it, it turns the page as you are a bit close to the screen.  It is a bit too sensitive to touch and I am forever having to go back.  I much prefer the older version, where there was a distinction between the screen and the frame.  I wouldn’t upgrade unless like me you dropped your previous kindle in the bath.Update - Just over a month old an issue occurred with the power, reset the kindle and it lasted just over a month again - now being replaced.

Name: AniaKass
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 October 2019
Review Content: I love my new Paperwhite Kindle. I love that I can pack around SO MANY books! I will say, I have never been a fan of touch screens though (I actually love my old Kindle better b/c it's NOT touch screen, and I feel it is easier to navigate, but that may be b/c I'm used to it). I do wish there was an easier way to freeze and unfreeze the screen on the new paperwhite. But I do really like that I can change the brightness of the built-in-light, font, font size, layout, and see page number or % read. I recommend to anyone who is thinking about getting one of these devices to do so, especially if you're the kind of person to pack books around. It is amazing and wonderful how many books you can have, including getting ebooks from the library and whatnot.

Name: Don. G.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 October 2019
Review Content: I bought one of these today. SPENT OVER 2 HOURS TRYING TO GET IT TO CONNECT MY WI-FI AND A FURTHER 1HOUR AND 4 MINS WITH MY INTERNET PROVIDER BEFORE IT WOULD CONNECT! This necessitated changing the existing wifi network settings and wifi password!! WHY???? Never had any problems connecting devices to my wifi before! Then I tried to connect to my very long-standing Amazon account. Again problems. Password-verified as correct-constantly rejected necessitating a complete password reset! The keyboards to enter data in were also awful. That is far as I have got. I will return it tomorrow as I am far from satisfied and do not fancy any more problems in trying to download a book to it!

Name: Michael Evans
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2020
Review Content: Originally the Kindle was great, it had ample storage and combined with the fact books dont take up a huge amount of room anyway, it looked like it was going to be a way for me to get back into reading. It was easy to use and bright enough.Unfortunately this was short lived as after having charged it fully twice, when the battery died, it would no longer turn on or function at all. Instead was a screen that said "Battery condition critical" with a large battery symbol and an exclamation mark in the centre.Of course the first thing anyone would do would be to consult Google and search for any ways to get it working again (resets and etc), but unfortunately all that came up was that it is apparently a common fault that if you do not charge a Kindle in its "low battery" state then you run the risk of having the battery go flat, and unlike other devices where you can just charge it up again, there's a large chance that the Kindle wont charge at all and be stuck in this state. Leaving it completely useless.I have used the Kindle approximately 10-15 times since I bought it, had it in a hard case, and it hadn't been in any way conditions etc, therefore in no way should it be failing that miserably already.So, dont let the battery drain completely!Edit:After contacting Amazon to solve the issue, I was offered to purchase a new device due to being a few days out of my warranty. The operator was polite and tried his best to help me get the device working, but to no avail.I am gutted that there's no option for repair or replacenent, as I was really looking forward to using it on my honeymoon in 6 weeks time. To provide a £120 device with a battery that cant hold reserve charge is beyond stupid, even £10 phones from Tesco have this function.Dissapointed in Amazon.

Name: Kathryn Nicholl
Review Title: This is the best reader yet!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 May 2019
Review Content: I already had a Paperwhite but I had stupidly let something fall on it and it had created a small "hole" which let light through so asked my family for this one for Christmas. Transferring the e-books from the old one was a piece of cake and loading on my audiobooks from Audible was equally easy. Headphones connect via Bluetooth, so a whole entertainment experience in one small, very easily readable - even in the brightest sunlight - and adjustable package. It is also incredibly light and fits easily into a patch pocket or small shoulder bag. Oh, and right now it has 998 e-books and 31 audiobooks on it plus some PDFs, and I still have nearly 22 gb free! Battery life is brilliant too and you get plenty of warning when a re-charge is needed. Wouldn't be without it!

Name: S. J. Pritchard
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2021
Review Content: The ereader itself is a very good product as attested to by the multiple 5 star reviews. However, should it develop a fault out of warranty then don't expect any offer of repair. There is no such thing. Just an offer to buy a discounted replacement. Not exactly environmentally friendly. After two years of moderate use mine was left uncharged whilst I read a paper book. After finishing the book I picked up the Kindle to start an ebook only to see the dreaded empty battery/exclamation mark symbol. Worse still, when plugged in to charge, no orange/green light. Taking to the internet to find a solution, none were apparent. All tutorials and Amazon's own help guide all needed at least the light to show. The online support chat finally ended with sorry but out of warranty, can't send a new one. Here's 15% discount to buy a new one. No offer of paid for repair just throw away and buy a new one. I don't want to spend £120 every two years on an ereader. So a bit more research and a YouTube video later, the back was off. It's interesting to see all connectors glued down. Makes it difficult to repair. Even the battery is glued in. Not to be deterred, the battery connector was lifted from the glue and then reconnected and voila! The light came on. 20 minutes work and £120 saved. The battery/exclamation mark seems to be a common one if left to completely drain of charge so lesson learned. Keep it charged. But this seems to be a bit of a design fault. So, before forking out for a new one and it's out of warranty, be brave and take the back off. If you're not willing to do it, try a mobile repair shop first. Not sure how waterproof it will be after the back has been off so I wouldn't take it in the bath!!

Name: Cadajota
Review Title: Much easier than using a heavy tablet
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 January 2020
Review Content: I originally owned the old version of a kindle for many years - eventually upgrading to a tablet and giving my original kindle to my bookworm of a daughter. I soon regretted getting rid as although my tablet is all singing and dancing it is nowhere near as portable as a kindle - and no where near as lightweight. The back light on this Kindle paper white and the ease of use makes this as portable as a phone but easier to read. I strongly recommend getting a case for it as protection. It makes reading in bed better too - don't have to have a light on keeping hubby awake. Works a treat. Thoroughly recommend this little gem.

Name: KPF
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 January 2021
Review Content: Worst product I have ever bought.... DO NOT BUY THIS!!! If you still feel tempted at least keep it charged.... the batteries are notoriously terrible. Had mine 1 year and a month and read 2 books on it... left in a draw for 6 months... it was immaculate... took it out to a critical battery error and it never worked again. Now have a refurbished one as a replacement... it works when it feels like it! Terrible bit of kit... massively disappointed my previous kindle lasted me 10+ years and was awesome. Will never buy another kindle.

Name: FODI Attila
Review Title: A new era of reading begun for me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 November 2020
Review Content: This is my first e-book reader ever, so I had to get used to it, which means I have nothing to compare it with.The reason I bought it was simply to reduce the weight of my rucksack when I go trekking.First of all, it is lightweight and easy to hold (with the case I bought it). I am a bibliophile, so I still miss the smell of the ink, but it seems to be a good and lightweight book-alternative during the evenings in a tent or on my way from A to B, on a bus, train or airplane.All the books I downloaded are working fine, I even sent a pdf version of my own work to it to check how it can be read on the screen and I am satisfied with the result.There is only one thing which could make it even better, the colours (I like the illustrated editions of books, but everything is B&W).

Name: Andrew Warn
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2019
Review Content: Well made and easy to use. I can’t give it 5 star for two reasons. One is that it is very unresponsive when using it to browse for new books and such. You tap something like search and it takes a few seconds to be ready to type. When you start to type it can’t keep up and you have to wait for what you have typed to appear. The second thing is the price. I paid £119 for this and in my opinion it is more like an £80 product. At £119 it should be much more responsive. The pro’s are that is is well made, slim, easy to use and as reasonable battery life. Though I should mention that the battery is not as good has they say it is. If you read for 30 mins or less a day then I expect the battery life will last the weeks they mention but I went through 50% battery in about 5 days. I was reading for about 60 mins per day

Name: KP
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 March 2020
Review Content: I am pleased with my new kindle. The back light is really good as I am able to read last thing at night or first thing in the morning without disturbing anyone by having to put on a light.The battery lasts at least 2 weeks before it needs recharging. It might be even longer.However I don't find the touchscreen as easy as my previous kindle to navigate books and find pages. Also I didn't realise that I would not be able to use audiobooks so for the price I paid that was disappointing.I do like the kindle but I do think it is overpriced for the media provided.

Name: Gwill
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 August 2019
Review Content: Very disappointed. Firstly, battery lasts for weeks my backside. I fully charged it and after less than an hour reading with the kindle light on half way the battery was on 89%. Secondly, my old kindle would have a slight glow to the screen even before turning the light on. Decided the other night to have a read but couldn’t see a thing from the new kindle. Had to turn on lamp so I could read the screen and find the light setting. Lastly, I wish this option of with/without special offers was more understandable. I now know that if I turn them off I will be billed £10. Never saw that on the Amazon listing. ☹️☹️Update 21st October 2020The screen now greys out at random times and when I’m in the kindle store I’m unable to swipe up.Very, very unhappy. ☹️☹️

Name: Pauline Lee
Review Title: A great kindle with built in light
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 January 2020
Review Content: Having one of the original kindles which is over 10 years old, I felt it was time for an updated model.  The paperwhite is much lighter in weight, smaller, easier to read - especially in the dark and I like it.  What  disappointed me - although my long list of books purchased over the years have been dowloaded and, my folders are visible, when I have finished a book & moved it to a folded, on rhe paper white, it does not remove the read books in folders from my current list of books to read & I find this very frustrating.  If anyone has any ideas on how to move them without deleting them, I would love to hear how to do this.

Name: Alexa Clark
Review Title: Massive book lover - CONVERTED TO KINDLE!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 May 2020
Review Content: *Detailed review ahead BUT I hope this helps*:I’ve always been one of those people who would never order a Kindle because they prefer an actual book. However, thought I’d treat myself to one for lockdown and try it out, if only to save a hell of a lot of money on books with all the extra reading I’ve been doing with this spare time!And... I LOVE IT. It doesn’t really feel like you are reading off a device as the screen is not like a smartphone glare. I also like it as I can read outside and the screen is still perfect in the sun just like paper, also don’t have the annoyance of wind blowing pages all over. It’s waterproof so you can also read in the bath without worry! The built in LED means you can read on a night before bed without getting eye strain which is perfect for me as I have always enjoyed reading a quick chapter or two to wind down before bed.The discounts available on the kindle store make this well worth the money and switch to a kindle if you are tempted but not sure if you’ll like it compared to an actual book. I’ve found I haven’t really noticed a difference, if anything I’m reading the books even quicker. I have saved as much as around 85% off the price of some books I have wanted for a long time by getting them on the kindle store. For example, as I’m a massive fan of The Last Kingdom on Netflix, I got the first 6 books in the series on the kindle store for about £6.99, as opposed to the usual retail price for the physical set of books being anything around £50-£60!!Finally, another side of the Paperwhite I like is that you can highlight and comment on quotes, you can also hold on a word and it will bring up either translations (if another language) or general info from the internet (e.g. a historical figure). I have found this particularly useful as I am going into Secondary Teaching so have highlighted a few passages which are now saved on the kindle, which I can use as thinking points/part of activities in lessons.I was torn between this and the earlier model. The earlier is cheaper, but I have found the Paperwhite is still great value for money and I believe you are getting more features to make it a better reading experience (e.g. LED, flush screen, waterproof). And I just wanted to have a newer model, I always prefer this when ordering new devices so it’s more up-to-date for any future updates.So, overall (apologies this has been very long but I have written it with people like myself in mind, who may have toyed with the idea of a kindle for years but not sure if they will like it compared to a usual book):*great value for money*haven’t missed reading a physical book. If anything I’m now reading books faster*unbelievable discounts available on kindle store - you are saving a HELL of a lot of money compared to physical books*great features - LED and waterproof*other perks e.g. highlighting and saving passages/quotes to your device

Name: Vee
Review Title: Fabulous and better than the normal kindle by far
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 September 2020
Review Content: So much better and worth the extra money over the normal kindle.I was sceptical about the light setting but it is really good. The dark mode is also better for my eyes.  The best thing about this however, is that I can lock the font settings which have driven me crazy for 6 years with my other 2 normal kindles I have had.  Hooray!!The bonus is that it is water resistant and  as I am very clumsy it is a good idea.Extremely happy and reading again for hours with no issues.Battery power is no problem as long as wifi is off and I'm not using audible,  which I dont.

Name: tfoxon
Review Title: Beware of buying a Kindle with Special Offers.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 July 2019
Review Content: I have had a kindle and loved it for many years and have bought and read a number of books over the years. It is probably the technology that i have used the most. The most annoying thing for me and that is why I have only given it 3 stars is the the special offers adverts on it. I didn’t know what that meant when I bought it. I thought buying meant I would receive something in the box with special offers but no it is adverts on the home screen and on the screensaver which for me ruins the whole design and feel of the product. If it wasn’t for the adverts I would have given the kindle 5 stars as i do love it. Please be warned if you buy a kindle with special offers it does mean you will get adverts. I would rather have paid the extra if i had know.

Name: Kevin Mansell
Review Title: Best ereader I have tried so far
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2019
Review Content: Light & easy to read with lots of storage space.  The Kindle Paperwhite is simply very easy to get along with as the menu system makes it a doddle to change settings such as font size, spacing, etc.My only real criticism so far is that the reading screen itself could be bigger if the edges around the screen were not so large.  Other than this the only niggle is through my own clumsiness as several times I have opened up the menu's unintentionally when trying to turn the page, though I'm sure that once I am better familiarised/practiced with it this will no longer be a problem.  Overall I find it better than my previous Kobo e-reader (though that is now several years old).

Name: RJ
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 August 2020
Review Content: I love the kindle paperwhite. I have had one for the last four years, but unfortunately lost my last one. I use it daily so bought this as a replacement very quickly.It is easy to fit in a pocket or handbag. It is very lightweight, easy to hold. I love the flexibility of the e-reader to change the font size. When I'm tired, it's easy to make the font slightly larger. I have come to prefer the kindle to physical books. I love to read different books depending on my mood, so having that flexibility is brilliant for me. The great advantage if this version of the paperwhite is that it's waterproof. A definite bonus for when at the beach, pool or simply relaxing in the bath.

Name: gg
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 August 2019
Review Content: Firstly I have to say we are massive book fans and could not really decide to make the transition to Kindle for travelling for ages - the physical feel of a book is just different. However I have to say we now love the Kindle (I bought 2 outright and am glad I did or else my husband might have stolen mine off me. :)The menu takes some getting used to - it's not as intuitive/user friendly as many other electronic products I use, so reading the user guide makes sense, but once you work it out it is brilliant and both my husband and I used it very successfully on our holiday this year. It is brilliant for travel & for reading in bed when your partner wants to sleep already.We LOVE our new Kindles and would definitely recommend it.

Name: Welsh Cath
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 March 2020
Review Content: After two weeks of daily use, I’m very happy with my purchase. It’s lightweight and easy to use. The battery life is superb and the touch screen is good, although a little slow at times. I’ve used the kindle commuting, to read in bed and in the bath. The fact that it has tolerance to water makes me a bit more comfortable about bath time reading!The built in light is effective without being intrusive; I can read in bed at night without waking up my husband.It’s easy to access your library of books and quick to download.Overall an excellent Kindle and I thoroughly recommended.

Name: Sean Barker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 June 2020
Review Content: Pretty much useless.I had the previous paperwhite which was excellent but this models battery life is so poor that unless its fully charged every couple of days its dead.I have it on airplane mode, wifi off, bluetooth off and there is no indexing going on. I also have the back-light completely off.Very very dissapointed*****UPDATE*****I have since returned this and had it replaced with a new one.The replacement works perfectly and has the sort of battery life you would expect.My original was clearly faulty.If you do end uo with one that has a battery that only lasts a couple of days return it.It could be thst mine eas a one off or maybe there is a bad batch out there.I have now adjusted the star rating from one to four

Name: Maggie
Review Title: Received incorrect order- Misleading and very disappointed customer.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 November 2020
Review Content: I ordered x2 Kindles on Amazon Prime day, one was a Sage colour and the other Twilight Blue. Amazon were offering a cover and charger as part of a bundle deal. I decided to purchase the bundle deal for both of the Kindles. I noticed that the colour of the Kindle had reverted to black so I cancelled the order and got in touch with customer service. I was assured that I would in fact receive the colour I ordered and not to worry. I have since received both Kindles and they were in fact not the colours I ordered but the black coloured Kindle.I have been in touch with Customer service numerous times about this issue and I thought I had resolved it yesterday but the Amazon Representative made a replacement with the exact same black coloured kindle instead of the Sage and Twilight Blue one. I am after spending over 3hrs back and forth over chat to finally be told that as part of the offer you do not have the option of choosing a coloured kindle and that you can only have the black one. If I was aware of this on the day of purchase I would have not purchased the bundle deal.Very disappointed with the lack of customer service and confusion regarding this. It seemed very straight forward to me that you could just replace the Kindle with a different colour. I am a Prime Member customer also and was waiting almost a month to receive one of the kindles. Extremely disappointed with the entire service.

Name: Greycynic
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 July 2020
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: J. Malcolm
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 June 2020
Review Content: I had initially left a lower rated review due to what appeared to be a battery failure one day after my Replacement Window closed. I am retracting that and giving it a four star rating insteadThe device has been great for the year that I've used it apart from the recent battery scare. The device gave me a low battery warning while using it in bed. No problem. I plugged it into a USB cable going into a wall adaptor. What I didn't realise is that either the cable or the wall charger had failed. Next day the battery was completely flat. Battery icon with exclamation point. I tried ever combination of USB cable and charger I could find to no avail. What you have to do is hold in the power button for something like 40 seconds. Then plug it into a USB charger that can supply decent power. Not just your laptop or whatever. Either a decent working wall charger or a powered USB hub and leave it until fully charged.One niggle I did find when using it was it was sometimes possible to accidentally turn the screen off while reading, just from changing grip on it.

Name: ceejaysteady
Review Title: Waste of money changing from 2014 model
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2018
Review Content: This is the 3rd Kindle I have had and I realised immediately that I had probably wasted my money in buying it. Right at the start having transferred my current library onto it I found that I was unable to turn the pages to see the book list content in my  library without inadvertently opening a title. The menu navigation was a bit difficult on my last model but this takes it to a new height. I also see that I get a note of the page I am at in a book but no longer get the "Page... of ...." display. Added to that my mistake of getting the sharp cornered and uncomfortable fabric cover and I am at the stage of returning both.I will give it a couple of days and then decide

Name: Emma G
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 November 2020
Review Content: Can hold all my books, the audiobook with bluetooth headphones in the car, a pleasure to read on and the light doesn't glare. Bed reading doesn't disturb my partner.Always have a next book to hand, charge lasts weeks, one handed reading (read and eat = no reading time lost at work lunchtime) and takes up the space of a very thin novella.I love my Kindle and go everywhere with it. I read so much more with the Kindle and find it easier than holding paper books especially since a vast majority of the books I read are 400+ pages.

Name: MaoMao13
Review Title: The never-ending font size pop up box that obscures your reading
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 March 2019
Review Content: I bought this model for my 50th birthday, after my old Kindle Voyage finally died. Very soon after buying this Kindle, it became impossible to read due to the font adjustment box appearing at the top of the page and refusing to disappear. This happened at the beginning of EVERY chapter in EVERY book. A forty minute call to Amazon resulted only in a factory reset, which only temporarily sorted the issue. The same problem is now back, Amazon haven't sorted it, and I feel ripped off. I've used Kindle e-readers for years and have been very loyal to the brand, but this one is impossible!I really miss my old Kindle Voyage. This device is not a patch on it

Name: Brummie Sue
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 July 2019
Review Content: This must be the 4th Kindle I've had and ordered it because it was advertised as having a long battery life and my current kindle is needing charging more and more frequently.  First one arrived and it wouldn't synchronise with my library on Amazon.  Spent ages on chat and speaking to the helpline, restarting it resetting it and getting nowhere.  They decided I needed a replacement so send me another kindle.  Same problem again.  I decided to manually download just the books I hadn't read but then noticed the battery was running down really quickly.  I spent more time speaking to the helpline being asked to reset, restart it and eventually decided I didn't want to spend anymore time trying to get it fixed so returned the lot (kindle, cover and charger) for a refund.  I'm back to using my old kindle.  I've only given it 1 star because I couldn't give it a zero.  Hopefully the new model when its released will be much better!

Name: Rar89
Review Title: A brilliant solution for my overflowing book collection
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2020
Review Content: I bought this with my Christmas money so I suppose you can say that it was a present. I got a Kindle when they first came out eons ago which I loved and when I lost that I got a Kindle Fire which I wasn't too fond of.I absolutely love the Kindle Paperwhite. I've had it about two weeks and I've already got through three books. I love knowing that I've got a tonne of books with me on the go and I never have to worry about battery life. Also, it is very quick and easy to buy more books. This is ideal for those who love to take a book with them wherever they go and for those whose book shelves are slightly overfilled.

Name: minajarrow
Review Title: Not impressed as has many bad points compared to my kindle voyage.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2021
Review Content: I bought this to replace a kindle voyage and wish I had not bothered. It has glitches. It takes a longer time to wake up than my old one. It freezes frequently and is not responsive when trying to reboot. Trying to touch the screen to go back a page is very hit and miss and sometimes the screen scrambles. The voyage was a far better device.

Name: Amanda Kemp
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 August 2020
Review Content: I had a first generation kindle and loved it at first but then just liked the feel of a book and knowing how much longer you had in a chapter before you turned the light off at 2am!  Now I have arthritis in my hands and holding a book is now painful after reading for a while.  So I decided to get a new kindle.  I love it! Can’t stop reading it, the best thing is the light.  You can read in bed without struggling to see and read in the garden with no reflections.  It’s light to hold and can even read with one hand and a dog on your lap.

Name: SP
Review Title: Good Product at the Right Price
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2019
Review Content: This isn't my first Kindle reader.  I have been impressed in the past and this current model is no exception.  For those opting for the cheaper model I would say that it will deliver, but you will miss the built-in light which allows reading at night or in reduced light situations.  For those who fear keeping sleeping partners awake by reading late at night the Paperwhite should allay their fears.  The 8GB version is fine for me as I tend to remove books from the reader when I have finished them.  For those who like to keep their whole collection downloaded they may want a bigger capacity.  I find my readers excellent for holidays.  They are light, compact and easily stored.  I would recommend.

Name: Oleg Afanasyev
Review Title: Usability is inferior compared to non touch devices
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 August 2020
Review Content: Kindle is barely usable for anything other than linear fiction reads while holding it in right hand.UI is very slow making touch interface a PITA to use.- selecting more than a single word is annoying, you have to do it slowly as display update lags seconds- navigating few pages back or forth is bad as it remembers number of strokes/touches made and keeps scrolling at 1 page/sec pace. you have to painfully wait for page to flip before doing next gesture so not to overshoot- you can't wipe a dust or a hair from the screen because it would flip the page :D- you can't maintain a solid grip and flip pages with the same hand unless you have a large hand, so forget about reading it in transport while holding handrailsAll those problems didn't exist in button operated readers.The only advantage this kindle has is backlight which is the reason i have to use it to read at night.

Name: JCG
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 September 2019
Review Content: As I read in the bath and my last Kindle ended up in the sea when I fell down some harbour steps, I decided on the waterproof version.  This is my 4th Kindle and the most disappointing one to date.  It's very slow to react when turned on and I really do not like the fact that there is no raised frame to protect the screen.  This means that I often go backwards by mistake whilst reading and have to be very careful to hold it on its edges.I love Kindles and would never be without one, and I am sure that the "no edges" design is part of the waterproofing, but this is not my favourite.

Name: Mr Pete Panesar
Review Title: Migrated from Kobo but have only one issue
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 November 2018
Review Content: After having used Kobo devices for the last few years, I finally moved across to the new 2018 waterproof Kindle.. Absolutely brilliant.. However there is one thing which keeps catching me out.. each time I stand the device upright and place it on a desk to read, it power off!  This is due to the main power button being located at the bottom... this could work it it was a sliding switch as per the Kobe or it they reposition the on/off button to the side or top of the Kindle..Only a minor note, other than that it is worth the dollar and the backlight is great.I would like to think that there may be some feedback from amazon on perhaps a rethink on the power button?

Name: Anna W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2021
Review Content: I wish I hadn't bought it - have spent two days struggling with this and now it seems to have turned itself permanently.  My old Kindle is a very basic one (probably 8 years old) but so much better;  the only problem with it was that the battery wasn't holding a charge for very long.  It's impossible to navigate this new version, impossible to delete unwanted books which transferred (I had to log into my  Amazon account to do this).  Frustrating and unresponsive,  not user-friendly.  The supposed leather cover feels like cheap plastic.  How do I return the Kindle and cover now I have downloaded all my books?

Name: brummielass
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 June 2019
Review Content: Finally decided to change from my original Kindle of 2012 to the new Kindle Paper White. Whilst it is lovely to read it is heavier to hold than my previous Kindle now that I have put the plastic cover on!The transfer of my vast library of books did happen but unfortunately as many of the books were held in different folders and they transferred into my library on mass into one very large group of books,  I am having trouble finding an individual book at the moment. I had hoped that the books would be transferred into the folders that I created on my old kindle but this was not to be.The new paperwhite lay out is taking some getting used to but with perseverance I am sure I will eventually get things sorted.

Name: Steven Underdown
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2018
Review Content: Disappointed. I was looking forward to getting this. I pushed the boat out and ordered one with large memory and no advertising ‘extras’. ... I’ve had it a few weeks. ... It’s ok, but nothing more. I'd been drawn in when I heard that it would work, not just with Kindle books, but with Audible files too. It does play audio, but only via Bluetooth headphones or a Bluetooth speaker, not with plug-in devices. And very disappointinglpy (for me) it doesn’t allow for ‘immersive’ reading, ie, for following the text on-screen while listening to the audio. Apparently the processor is not up to doing this.Yes, It’s light-weight and tiny. But all in all, I’d have been better getting a kindle tablet and using that for dedicated reading (and which would have allowed immersive reading too).  As it is, I find myself ignoring the paperwhite and using my iPad for books and Audible - just as I had been doing. By the way, the cover is very expensive for what it is. It’s a Poundland item at a premium price.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Love being able to listen on my bluetooth speaker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 January 2020
Review Content: In general an improvement on my old Paperwhite Kindle, especially the fact that it can be linked to a bluetooth speaker to allow the book to be listened to instead of read.  The waterproof is good too, although I have been reading my kindle in the bath for the last 10 years and have only dropped it in once.My knocking off of one star is because the on/off button is proud of the kindle which means it keeps switching on and off accidently, especially if being used resting on a shelf.  I have solved the inconvenience by buying a back-only case; I just wish that hadn't been necessary.

Name: TeriK
Review Title: The adjustable light is good for night reading
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2020
Review Content: The light is a really good feature for me. The unit is smaller than my old kindle, the screen is the same size, it just doesn't have the buttons as it's touch screen. I do not find it is any easier than my old one as you need to hit the screen to turn the page as well as balance the unit. Also there seems to be no definite spot to hit to turn forward or back and I often go the wrong way. Having said that it has some nice easy features on the pull down menu, I just wish it were a bit easier to operate one handed as advertised.

Name: A Wilkins
Review Title: Don’t get the one with Adverts!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 April 2020
Review Content: I bought this to update my old kindle which I loved. I didn’t realise the full impact of the adverts.They made it slow to start, drained the battery much more quickly and took longer to charge.I don’t really feel inclined to pay extra in order to not be inundated with adverts, but it was only £10, so I paid up.Amazon responded to my review and suggested turning off the wi-fi, which I do by turning on airplane mode, not sure if there is another way..These things seem so obvious when you get told them.Anyway, I feel a bit of an idiot, and Im much happier with it now, so thanks Amazon :)

Name: andy60chemist
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 December 2020
Review Content: If, like me, you are replacing a kindle that has stopped working, it is reassuringly familiar. setting up hit only one glitch - when I indicated I didn't want it to provide an app for my mobile. The screen froze and I had no option other than restart. Once inside it linked quickly and restored my library and all the settings and movements aer the same as my previous touch screen kindle. Hope it lasts longer.the delivery date on the order was surprisingly long (almost a month, but it has arrived 7-10 days early. good psychology??

Name: William G
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 March 2020
Review Content: The new kindle white replaces a kindle paper white that I  bought in 2013 and had no problems until the other day the motherboard faulted for no reason whatsoever and means that I have had to dispose off an immaculately kept kindle through no fault of my own.Although I have now replaced the dead kindle ( amazon did give me a 15% reduction off list price) with the latest model which as a previous a reviewer had posted said ignore all sales Schmuk on start up which I did and the reader is still displaying adverts on start up which is highly annoying and very frustrating to view each time I open the reader.Amazon you need to learn customer choice. This type of marketing only makes me want to shop elsewhere in future PLEASE REMOVE THIS UNCALLED FOR  ADVERTISING POSTE HASTEA disgruntled reviewer but more than happy kindle user

Name: Josh
Review Title: Has it's issues, but would still recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 January 2020
Review Content: Was bought due to swiftly running out of room for physical books. Although, I have to admit, I was very against kindles in the beginning as I preferred owning the physical copy. But I have to admit that it is a useful little gadget, not only is it easy to travel with - due to it being slim and compact - but it also has a handy for work, as I read a lot if PDFs I was able to email them to myself and read whenever travelling.The screen adjusts to your environment, which I find to be a handy feature as you can remain invested in a book even when lighting changes in the room or vehicle you may be travelling in.The battery life is quite standard, it lasts for as long as you could need. But as with anything, the more it is used, the more it needs to be charged.The downside of the kindle is that it appears to be fairly glitchy and there is a slight delay in response time with the touchscreen. Although this isn't something that has effected it greatly, as it still does its job - and does so very well I might add.All-in-all, it is a handy gadget. One that I'd recommend to those who are running out of space on their bookshelves - and like me don't like to give away their books. It has its issues, but I believe you'd struggle finding anything that doesn't.

Name: weasley figbat
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2019
Review Content: Overall, there’s a lot to like. I bought this to replace my venerable 4th gen Kindle (which still works perfectly but was gifted to my daughter).  The backlight is great as I can now read at night without having a lamp on so not disturbing anybody else.  The touchscreen works fine but is less engaging than page turn buttons, and means you can’t read it one-handed as well (example, holding it in your left hand means you can’t turn the page without using your other hand).Battery life is proving to be great, even using the light at a low level. It is easy to use standalone in terms of finding and downloading books. It is also reassuringly solid to hold, with a surprising but welcome weight to it.

Name: Vik
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2018
Review Content: After the very sad demise of my 1st gen Kindle keyboard, night reading is now a breeze. No more fumbling for a torch or crimes against my husband when turning my bedside lamp on! So while it does mean I'm happier to greet my insomnia so I can pick up my kindle it does mean I'm more tired during the day!I am also making great use of its waterproof feature by reading in the bath. It feels very indulgent.So what is all this reading foing to the battery? After 2 weeks of ownership and s couple of hours reading a day the battery is currently at 43%.Are there any downsides? Well I loved the home screen interface of my beloved kindle keyboard and don't much like the confused mess of this one. I tend to look for and buy books on my phone and download then!Finally a positive for Amazon ive now subscribed to unlimited and I'm looking forward to trying out its audible features as soon as I find my headphones...

Name: Bonnie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2019
Review Content: This is my third kindle paperwhite  - doesn’t seem very different at all. Thought it might be a bit faster being an upgrade but don’t see much difference. it does the job and I only got a new one because I needed more storage. Battery life seems okay so far, but I only read about an hour at night using low light. Pleased to get the option of black screen with white text. Seamless and very quick sync of books and docs from my account. Very easy setup. Thinner than my last kindle. Bought an Amazon cloth-style case - looks great and very sleek. Will fit easier into my pocket. It’s a kindle - it’s not offering a new experience just reassuringly the same.

Name: Tom
Review Title: Good product, but annoying that they discount it just after I bought it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 February 2021
Review Content: Annoyed that just a couple of weeks after I bought it they decided to knock £20 off the price. Also annoyed that despite paying £120 for something, Amazon still think it's acceptable to plaster adverts all of it.The product is good, but not great. It's light and easy to hold and has nice features like a built in dictionary. It is quite slow and unresponsive but seeing as you are mainly just using it to read, that isnt the end of the world.The waterproof model makes out that you can just read care free in the bath and that if you were drop it in then you could just get it out and carry on reading but according to the manual, that is not the case. You would need to turn it off and allow it to dry fully.Overall it does what it says. I would probably not bother getting the more expensive waterproof version. The fact you can choose a colour is quite nice though.

Name: Gary G
Review Title: Nice device, so far, so good.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 January 2020
Review Content: Got this for my birthday, together with the Amazon-branded case, which didn't fit the device (although both boxes clearly stated 10th generation, very frustrating).. The case had to be returned and instead, I got a different brand (Foxwood) for a fiver less. So, apart from the case size issue, all good regarding the device itself. very small and easy to handle, with an excellent battery life which I was grateful for on a transatlantic trip last week.Not tried all of the features yet (e.g. audiobooks and BlueTooth connections), but so far the device does everything I need it to.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 September 2020
Review Content: Not impressed with the battery life my old one the battery lasted  longer just on reading stupid adds waste battery and unnecessary. The adverts for book irrelevant as far as i am concerned. Something I do not require or want. Books  I wish to read I look up. Why put it on them charge if customer wants it removed. A money spinner for Amazon either way they cannot lose out Bluetooth ideal for audio books. Apart from that not much better than my old model which i only changed as it developed a fault not worth the extra money

Name: sarah aldred
Review Title: this kindle has lasted me from May to January and has now died completely
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 February 2020
Review Content: this is my 4th kindle and I was originally very pleased with my new kindle, bought it in November and put it away for a few months waiting for my old one to die first so started using from MAY 2019, Last weekend decided to finally add more books onto it to take it to half way on the memory, since then it has become completely unusable, holds no charge at all constantly restarting after trying to read 1 page, and then it puts you back to the main front page and doesn't remember where you got to in the book.i have factory reset 4 times and its getting worse trying to do anything with it at all, laptop won't recognise it, when you do connect when disconnecting just gives errors and reboots and reboots continually until the battery dies, within 1 hr today went from fully charged to flat and I wasn't even using it, considering it costs £150 I'm gutted to say the least that I'll have to replace this yet again.

Name: anne Bull
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2018
Review Content: It’s my 3rd kindle. My most favourite was my 1st. It was the one with key pad at bottom and page turners.  Whilst I do love my new one it’s the new water proof version I purchased it on Black Friday so good deal. The one I really really wanted is the oasis as it has page turning buttons I like them currently I don’t have this kindle in a case so very often turn pages when not wanting too. Especially when I’m falling asleep.  It’s much quicker than my previous kindle not sure if that’s the kindle or my last one was getting sluggish as it was getting on. Apart from that I’m not sure there is any difference. Would have been nice to get the oasis but could not justify the hick in money.  Pity  I would recommend this kindle to anyone looking or thinking about getting one as price is good.  Guess it would be perfect if it had buttons to turn page 😘

Name: Marie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 February 2020
Review Content: I have been using kindle on my phone and expected it to work much the same.  Its software and library functions aren't the same and isn't as nice to use.  I really wish it worked more like my phone.  When reading the book it works well and is light enough.  Another thing is that the sales blurb says it is audible compatible and that was of interest to me.  I knew I couldn't connect it to my Sonos but I suppose I will have to buy a Amazon speaker, despite the fact I don't want most of its functions.  Either that or buy some bluetooth headphones but I haven't got that far yet.

Name: spindles
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 August 2020
Review Content: I was used to reading books on my kindle fire which was okay until I went in the sun.  During covid-19 I have increased my reading time and as have had lots of sunshine have been in the garden, well trying.  The kindle fire isn't up to the job in the sun.  So I decided to treat myself to a kindle paperwhite and with an offer on a purchase was made.  I am so pleased with my paperwhite, it was easy to set up, light to hold even with a case.  Fantastic in the sun, can even read in the sun with sunglasses on. Best decision  I made

Name: Paula
Review Title: holds the charge for ages and easy to use
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 February 2020
Review Content: Even though the info says holds a charge for weeks,mine doesn't but only because I am constantly downloading books from kindle and unlimited,but it still lasts just over a week with constant use on the way to work at breaks and in the evening,I was someone who only bought it because I am going abroad and my books are normally quite heavy but I didn't expect to be quite so addicted to it,I haven't been able to put it down yet and I have downloaded over 10 pages of book listings and barely touched the kindles capacity so takes literally hundreds to fill at this rate,very happy with it and so easy to use even though I'm not especially techy!!!! Doesn't take long to charge either!!!!

Name: Marianne Harry
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 May 2020
Review Content: This is my 4th Kindle and I have to say my original kindle, which had no internal light, was better than this one. As my library is 2000+ books and documents and my existing paperwhite kindle was struggling, I up-graded to a new 32GB paperwhite. Well it arrived on Monday and it is now Saturday and I’m still trying to get my books downloaded. Not only do you have to download each book/document separately but it has now decided partway through that the reminder of my library cannot download. Battery is also considerably worse than previous models. I have to have mine charging at all times whilst trying to download my library. Goodness knows what it will be like when I manage to be able to read a book! I don’t know what is wrong with this model but if you cannot cope with stressful conditions DON’T buy this Kindle.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: I wish I'd never bought it. It's much more complicated than my first Kindle
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 August 2020
Review Content: I wish I'd never bought it. My old Kindle was losing battery very quickly so it needed replacing. However my old Kindle was very easy to navigate and this one is anything but.On my old Kindle when I'd finished reading a book it was very simple to archive it.  This one makes everything complicated and doesn't appear to have 'archive' as an option, only a read list. When I go to the 'unread' list it includes the 'read' books.On my old Kindle it was very easy to see what books haven't yet been read and on this one.......I don't need the light ever so have no comments.

Name: Russem
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 October 2020
Review Content: I love reading and have always said that I didn’t believe I could ever ‘go’ for an e-reader, always preferring to hold and turn the pages of ‘real’ books.Until this year.For the last few months the idea of getting a Kindle kept on growing, partly for convenience during this year of the virus restrictions but also with a view to getting back out for holidays once again and travelling light, packing a Kindle loaded with umpteen books instead of heavy paperbacks.So, I treated myself, and wow, it really is brilliant.

Name: AltonBob
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 February 2020
Review Content: I bought this to replace my existing paperwhite as I wanted to use audible via bluetooth headphones. Unfortunately it fails to connect most of the time and so is not fit for purpose. On researching on the internet this seems to be a common problem.

Name: Uncle Toby
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 August 2020
Review Content: This is now my third Kindle. When the screen broke (after several years) on No.2 I did consider looking at other devices but decided to stick with Kindle because a) I have built up quite a library of Kindle books, and b) there is absolutely nothing wrong with the Kindle as a way of carrying around and reading books in any setting. I have particularly valued having a French dictionary downloaded - the ability to tap on an unfamiliar word and find the meaning (and often the idiom) has made reading in French a far easier experience.

Name: Enchanted England - sarahNet
Review Title: Neat Kit for an online library
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 December 2020
Review Content: This kindle was ordered to replace a previous early version and to avoid having to use the kindle app on an I-pad where its not so straightforward to buy and download books.Possibly I should have spent more and gone for the colour version - this has a monochrome display that destroys jewel-like book covers.More importantly I find the the touch screen is not that accurate - which has surprised this reader as the earlier kindle was excellent. Still - the screen is clear and bright without glare and the Kindle is excellent place to store tomes such as dictionaries, thesaurus etc that would otherwise take up valuable shelf space at home or work.

Name: Jax
Review Title: make It easier to get going
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 May 2019
Review Content: I’ve had other eReaders but this is my first Kindle. Surprised at how small it is but display looks clear. Tapping left side of screen doesn’t go back a page despite instructions saying it should, but swiping seems to do it.No instruction book enclosed (why?) but did find it online.Shame it seems to have been written by someone who is a Kindle expert as it’s pitched way above beginner level - took me ages to work out how to buy a book as I just assumed it was linked to my Amazon account.Come on guys - a lot of the stuff that’s in there is not going to be used by many readers - I don’t want magazines etc, but I’ll use the WiFi to download books so why not do a guide that has the basics to get going at the start, then the more advanced stuff later.

Name: Gary H
Review Title: Poor design and really needs improving
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 March 2020
Review Content: I upgraded from my 6 year old kindle as I wanted one with a light.  I'm happy with the new kindle in this respect, light can be adjusted easily and it is inoffensive and "soft"However, three really annoying things for me are:1) No USB-C!!!!  Sick of this. Why are Amazon still using a micro usb?  I would have refunded but didnt have an opportunity on this occasion.2) My old kindle has the same issue as this. If you drop it in bed or something brushes the screen when it is on, the font size decreases. Every single time. I wish there was a way to lock the font size and settings.3) Why why why put the power button at the bottom? Where your hand and fingers often rest, or the device itself sits when being used? Why not have it on top or a switch or something else? It is so so easy to turn off by mistake.It is OK.I definitely do not recommend this if you're upgrading. But I do if it is your first kindle

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Died just outside the guarantee.  Update - came back to life a day later after several resets!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2019
Review Content: Made it to a year and a couple of days so just outside the replacement window and then died.  Wouldn't charge.  None of the fixes I googled worked.  Save your money and try something else.  Can't recommend.After several google searches and recharging, resetting, recharging, resetting several times, a day later it burst back to life.  Had a message from Kindle Support offering help - they called the wrong number rather than the one set up as my default but at least they tried - but emailed with instructions of how to contact them so am impressed with their customer service as they just did it off my recommendation.  Have changed my rating to 4 stars from the 1 I had given it. It is a good product, when it is working.  Bought for my 87 year old mother who is totally non technical and it is intuitive enough that she is just about coping with it!

Name: john davies
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 February 2021
Review Content: Bought this as a replacement for an ageing (and damaged) Kindle 4 and I have to say I’m really impressed . If you’re familiar with an IPad or similar device , then you will appreciate the swipe screen compared to the older Kindle 4 . In addition , the functionality is great with the bonus of really good battery life.I really can’t fault this purchase and whilst a lot more expensive than the older models , you get what you pay for.Go for the with-ads version as it’s slightly cheaper and the ads themselves are only on the Home Screen when starting up and they are simply Amazon marketing messages. No big deal

Name: Linda J
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 September 2020
Review Content: I am really disappointed that this version does not ‘go to sleep/wake up’ when I close/open the cover,  like my original (6 years) paper white did. I have to turn it off/on each time, and swipe to wake screen 😤 and the battery doesn’t last as long!!There is no ‘picture’ on screen at wake up, just adverts on the screen!!The only good bit is the storage capacity.I only purchased a new one as my original no longer connects to the WiFi, hubby’s does (his is same age) so internet is working.Couldn’t find anywhere on Amazon site to see if I could get it repaired ☹️

Name: Chris&Cath
Review Title: Amazing product. Get it without ads!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 March 2021
Review Content: What a game changer. I’ve never been much of a reader. Truly only ever read homework and such. Never read anything for fun. Got the Harry Potter books for Christmas and got very into reading. After book 5 I waited for this to be on sale and read the rest on the kindle. Now I spend less money on books, my wrist don’t hurt, I can find a comfortable reading position which don’t exist with a physical book AND I can read in the bath, on the beach, train or plane. When it dies I’ll buy a new one. What a time to be alive!

Name: mrs alison jeffrey
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2019
Review Content: Gift to replace my 2 year old Paperwhite of which I had “dinked” the screen slightly: still useable but irritated me!This one is even lighter and slightly smaller : I had to buy a new magnetic cover to fit but that was t really an issue as my old one was some years old and quite battered and loose.I love the Paperwhite with the built in light: so convenient. Battery life seems good. Change of font sizes and styles is great, esprcially when your eyes are a bit tired at night. This edition is supposedly waterproof but I’ve yet to try it and also audible is easier by headphones.....again not yet tried.  I’m confident they both will though!Don’t be put put off by “special offers”: there are no interruptions to your reading, simply a related Kindle advert on opening the gadget, that’s it.Highly recommend for any reader.

Name: Zippo
Review Title: Check it doesn’t lose charge quickly
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 February 2019
Review Content: This is the third one. First two lost charge very quicklyLots of hassle and pretty poor customer service for second return.So far third one is OK. Bit annoying that can’t just get the original one anymore. Also felt the “with offers” is misleading and a rip off.

Name: Julie C H
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 December 2020
Review Content: I bought this to go on holiday with and I wasn't disappointed.  It holds loads of books, I must have about 40 on there at the min.  Stays charged for ages, its only been charged 3 times since I've had it and I used it pretty much every day.  I went for the waterproof one and I'm glad I did as the screen is flat so no areas for sand to get stuck in and its east to wipe clean with a sanitizing wipe.

Name: Joanne Thomas
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 October 2020
Review Content: Decided to buy this after downloading a load of books for a recent holiday to my Amazon Fire tablet, only to discover the glare on the screen made it impossible to read them.  It's fabulous!  A really nice size and very lightweight.  Got the Plum colour which I love !  Still getting to grips a little with the functions as it's so different from any other devices I have, but I'm going to be doing a lot more reading now that I have this wonderful device!  (I already have hundreds of books, so switching to a Kindle was long overdue.)The only thing is, I'm struggling to work out which case to buy to go with it - don't want to spend  a fortune on the leather one, but it doesn't seem clear at all which ones will fit this.  Any advice most welcome !

Name: Mrs Deborah-Ann Kerr
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 May 2019
Review Content: I have been using a Kindle for many, many years now and due to my previous device taking a long time to charge, I decided to buy a new Kindle.  I was going to buy the Oasis but really could not warrant the price so opted for the Paperwhite.  It's fine but, to be honest, I prefer my old one.  Yes it's light, yes it's got an in-built light but I really liked the page turn buttons on the the edge of the device (which was the only reason I really wanted the Oasis).  It is so easy to turn more than one page at a time, not easy to go back a page and really annoying when you lay your Kindle down for a second and if you touch the screen when you pick it up again you have no idea how many pages it's jumped forward because you have accidentally touched the screen.  I'm happy enough with the Paperwhite, i'd just like to go back to turning the page with a button!

Name: Angus
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 January 2020
Review Content: The reading experience is good. The screen and backlight are miles ahead if my old kindle keyboard.However I do have a couple of problems.It won't talk to my pc. It's the only usb device that won't and that irks me. Tried all the troubleshooting to no avail.The power button is exactly where my pinkie naturally sits while holding the device and so I either hold it with mild discomfort or switch it off accidentally.The touchscreen is a gimmick. It's unresponsive and serves very little practicable usage. I'd rather have buttons.Overall it's good. Honestly. I'm  being picky but slightly disappointed overall. If my kindle keyboard was still available  and had the backlight I'd buy it before this.

Name: Mike Wedge
Review Title: At last I can read in the dark or in the spa!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 January 2020
Review Content: I love my Kindle, always have. It feels like a book but is so much easier to use and to read. This is my second, the first was an early model with no back light and absolutely no water protection. Now I can read wherever I am, and as always finishing a book makes me search for another straight away.The only reason it loses one star for me is that I have to tap the screen on the right-hand side to go to the next page. Scenario: when using it one-handed with my left hand (the right being occupied with a glass of suitable refreshment), I can't turn the page, unlike the ancient model which had a button on each side. But on the scale of life it's hardly a train crash. Love it

Name: Christa
Review Title: Great device, but opt out of special offers!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 February 2019
Review Content: I received a new Kindle Paperwhite as a birthday present after my old device broke. The new version is really nice, though I don't understand why tabs have to be moved around - and why is there no way to see all unread books?However, I LOATHED the "special offers": in return for saving £10 on the initial price, you are forced to view whatever latest offers Amazon proffers to you - books, Kindle accessories, etc. The offers are on the screensaver, AND on the initial screen you get before you can enter your Kindle. So annoying! After one month of alternating offers of books I would never read and accessories I didn't need, I figured out how to opt out of this invasive "service". Pay £10, and the unwanted ads cease. I'm looking forward to getting a small bit of privacy back.

Name: Neal
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 November 2018
Review Content: Love the new model though.  My two previous Kindles performed admirably, however the increased capacity and being waterproof tempted me into an update. Roll on the holiday and reading by the pool without worry.

Name: Emily Clifford
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2019
Review Content: I love my new kindle.I’ve stopped watching tv and I now read instead. I get through 1-2 books a week and with them ranging from 6-10£ (Hard copy) per book it gets expensive.Kindle is a cheaper, more sustainable way to be able to read a book. No delivery time when waiting for the book as it gets “delivered” right away to your kindle for download.The books on kindle are cheaper than hard copies saving ££.Free reading samples.Great suggestions.Only downside is the button, it’s in the exact spot where I put my baby finger to support whilst reading, so it sometimes locks me out.I probably wouldn’t pay the full price for the item, but that’s due to me getting it for an amazing price on prime day! I also don’t think the battery lasts as long as they say but that could be due to my excessive reading habits.

Name: Em
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2020
Review Content: I am ashamed to say that even though I am a dedicated real book lover, I am a convert to what I thought was the dark arts of the kindle. It is lightweight, fits in my bag with no trouble and is as easy to read as a real book. I can zoom in to make the print bigger if I need to and it is clear regardless of the light conditions and I don't need to worry about losing my bookmark.  Despite what some reviews said, they battery life is more than enough for my heavy reading habit. The only negative I can find so far is that it doesn't smell like a real book.

Name: Sue
Review Title: So hard to remove a book from the device and the covers do not download.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2021
Review Content: My old kindle let me remove a book from it without deleting it from the cloud. This only give me the option of deleting it permanently with a warning that if I want to re-read it I'll have to buy it again!!!It also is very bad at downloading the books cover so I'm left with just the books name and the author's name.It has frozen so many times that I've had to return it to factory settings then start the whole process of setting it up again so that I have now given up on it completely.

Name: LUCY P.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 August 2019
Review Content: Truthfully, I was almost put off by some of the negative reviews but I can honestly say - I'm so glad I wasn't. I have argued with myself time and time again about switching to an e-reader because my love for paperback was so strong, I wasn't sure if anything could live up to the expectation.This does. By a mile. It's sleek, it's easy to hold for long periods of time, the five LED lights make it super easy to change the lighting to suit your eyes and the import of my library was quick and efficient. Although I will note that I have a very small library so I couldn't comment on the import of a larger volume of books.Overall, if you're thinking about making the switch, this is the model I would say to go for. The waterproofing features give you a wider range of reading opportunities and it is just a pleasure to hold and read on.

Name: Mrs L
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 August 2020
Review Content: If I am honest not quite a good as my last paperwhite but I needed an update. It is still very good but a few issues e.g. accidentally turning the page due to the screen been completely flat, the light just doesn't seem as natural as it did on my previous model and I am trying to get to grips with the library and home page. I also thought it would be a bit speedier when accessing the store etc but it seems to be the same as the old model and sometimes lags when selecting titles or waking up the kindle etc.  I have only had for a month so I am hoping that a bit of practice will help me get used to it.

Name: pinkmouse
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2019
Review Content: It took a little while to adapt to my snazzy new kindle as my old (v.old) model was steam driven. It even had a dinky keyboard at the bottom of the screen and no built in light.... So you can tell how ancient it is, possibly one of the first ones on the market and I cried when it died. The new one is so light, in all ways! The built back light is excellent and easy to adjust. The navigation is intuitive and easy to navigate even for a non geek like me, so what’s not to love. Plus it is mega-lightweight so easy to pop in a pocket or bag without being weighed down. Best of all it seems to have a long battery life, to the extent I occasionally forget to charge it up.The set-up is easy to customise to your own particular taste and easy to change should you change your mind.

Name: Plan134
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 September 2020
Review Content: Unfortunately, I dropped my Kindle Paperwhite of 7 years, in the bath!  I immediately ordered a new, waterproof version and can't fault the seamless switch of my library from old to new device.  Set up was perfect.  However, when I switched my old Kindle on I got a screensaver of pencils which I loved.  Now, I get bombarded by adverts for new book releases and, try as I might, I can't switch this setting off.  I absolutely hate being advertised to every time I pick up to read but, as far as the Kindle itself goes, it's perfect.

Name: Ann Pen
Review Title: If you have dyslexia, go for it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 March 2019
Review Content: I’m new to reading for leisure. I’m dyslexic and have never found ready pleasurable. But a couple of years ago I found a book that I wanted to read and was not to difficult (no complicated plots) and it grew from there, now I really enjoy reading. However, taking books and holiday and storing books has got a bit inconvenient for space. I  Avoided a kindle previously as thought it would be difficult to read from as I find computer screens problematic but I needent of worried. It is light, easy to ready in all lights. You can adjust font size to the right one for you. You can even change the font types. I can’t compare to other kindles as this is my first but I am really happy with it and traveling with books no longer takes up essential make up space lol.

Name: film mad fan
Review Title: Dont buy a paperwhite  , and retrain staff to say same thing........
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 January 2020
Review Content: Worst item ever father in law bought  my daughter one .two days later tried to st up would not connect to wifi, so I ordered  a replacement  same thing happened  again. So rang up to sort out explained  that father in law  had bought it and could I return  second one. After the first person had said no problem to return original one the customer service said the account holder had to sort it, even though first person said no problem. So  instructions  need to be updated and retraining. They actually said there has been problems with not connecting.  So not fit for use . Waiting for in laws to tell me they have been refunded . So an expensive item that was supposed  to be a nice surprise for my daughter....... not happy

Name: Mrs. P. M. Roberts
Review Title: Not my favourite kindle by a long way!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 March 2020
Review Content: I can’t find books I’ve ordered, the first page of library doesn’t have latest purchases on it?
