Can’t remember then what I’ve ordered, so have to go on amazon to find what the books are called, there doesn’t seem to be any order to the books! Battery life is worse than my last 3 kindles, one of the reasons I bought a new reader! Not very happy at all with it!

Name: Woozlebear
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 November 2020
Review Content: Purchased to replace an older model for my wife. The touch screen is quite sensative and if touched in the wrong place can be problamatic. Difficult to find the current book you are reading at times because when you close the device it does not always return to the last page read when reopened. Will take some getting used to. Would have liked a paper guide instead of the on device guide to save having to go back and forth on the device when learning how to use a feature. Nice clear easy to read print and the light is great.

Name: Daniel Nicholls
Review Title: A nice E-Reader with some confusing design choices...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 January 2020
Review Content: The overall reader is fine when you're actually in a book but navigating the menus is one of the most tedious tasks there is. You can't search for a book in your library so instead you must swipe through endless pages to find what you want. Add to this the fact it's an e-ink display and you're left with one of the slowest tasks possible on a digital device. And that's when it works. Half the time it thinks me swiping to the next page is me asking to open a book!The power button on the bottom of the device is just idiotic. I'm sure that Amazon didn't consider that people hold their devices down there because more than once I've switched the thing off whilst trying to change my grip.The device is fine but lacklustre with some truly mind boggling design choices.

Name: Blue Yonder
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 February 2020
Review Content: I bought this to replace my 2013 purchase, which sadly gave up the ghost. Not much difference, but there are subtle updates. Suffice to say I am a confirmed Kindle lover. Can’t understand anyone wanting to go back to hardback or paperback versions.Advantages are: 1) The ability to carry a a whole library of books around in something not much larger than a passport. 2) Not having to carry a load of books in your luggage when going on holiday. 3) Being able to read in the middle of the night without turning on the light.

Name: Ailish
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 April 2020
Review Content: I always loved holding a book but was getting a bit sick of straining my eyes in the dark and having a house full of books. The built in light is amazing for and the battery lasts absolutely ages! It seems a bit slow when you’re looking through the store on it so I normally pick my books out on my phone. I’ve never got it out my hand I love it.

Name: Bee
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 March 2019
Review Content: Bought this as a gift for a cousin who loves to read. She has been a kindle subscriber for many years but used her iPad to read. I thought I would treat her to this for her birthday as recently she’s been unable to read more than a few minutes on her iPad as she gets terribly dry eyes from the screen. Once she got this she hasn’t put it down. She tells me that the reading experience is much better than anything other than a physical book, she loves the way the text looks, she’s loves that it’s lighter and easier to hold than an iPad mini, she loves that the battery lasts for ages and ages, but most of all she isn’t getting the eye problems while using it. She told me it’s the best gift she’s been given in many many years!!

Name: Andrew
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 August 2019
Review Content: I have been using a Nook e-reader for several years but, as it was showing its age, decided to take advantage of the Prime offer and purchased a Kindle Paperwhite. I will not list the various features, Amazon are more than capable of promoting the product themselves, but thought it may be of interest to some to highlight the features I like compared to the Nook, and oneI don’t.Plus points:Thinner and lighterBacklit screen displayWaterproof (I read in the bath)Synch with Kindle installed on my phoneNegative points:Does not read epub. OK, I know I can convert them but I consider this a serious omission.

Name: Danny Warrick
Review Title: The battery sucks - more literally the device sucks power oh, so fast!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 July 2019
Review Content: Had the early version, but screen was starting to breakdown. Great to hold, light and a good size. The touch screen works well, which I had been worried about, as I'd used an early version of a friend's, which seemed overly sensitive. This screen sensitivity is good. I  have two issues with the device, one I was prepared for as there are quite a few comments online about the poor battery performance and the other is listening to books. The charge ran out after 4 days of me reading it for an hour or so at night! I found a site online that tells you how to maximise its battery (the fact this advice exists tells you a lot), which basically is reduce the devices functionality, unless you expressly need to use it, but reduce it immediately after! My other issue is audible books, I'm read slowly,so listen to a great deal of books and have quite an extensive library that I've bought over the years, the majority being mp3, so I can listen in the car. These I can't use on the Kindle because it will only store Audible books - come on Amazon aren't you making enough money? Oh, and pay the extra £10 for the non-special version or your device is another way of Amazon drowning you in adverts!

Name: Bookworm
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2020
Review Content: This Kindle is a compact size and is easy to hold.  There is a built in light which is very handy.  On the negative, it took a while to set-up, even though I linked it to my Amazon account.  It sometimes jumps pages and does not show all the notes or highlights that I have made; even though I have followed the instructions.  I made about 30 notes and highlights and when I went to view them, only one note appeared.  This meant that I had to physically flick through all the pages to find them.

Name: Spookella
Review Title: OK if you have no option other than to upgrade.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 March 2021
Review Content: Happy with my new Kindle but I don't like it as much a much as my old style one. Since my old one couldn't connect via my new high speed broadband I had no option but to upgrade.  The battery length isn't as good as my old one even though that had a light built into the cover. The touch screen is annoying as I can't use it one handed like my old one.  All in all, it is a good product but it takes a bit of getting used to navigating the screens.  I can also see my husband's purchases which I don't like.

Name: Anne Walker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2020
Review Content: Upgraded my kindle to this one. Just as good as the old one (which I loved) the store is a little easier to access and I like the addition of the link to the next book in the series.  My only gripe which has cost one star as I relied on it whilst reading in bed is that the clock has disappeared at the top of the page.  I can get so engrossed in reading sometimes I can read into the early hours, the clock on the old one was invaluable to stop me reading through the night. I've looked through the settings and cant find anywhere to put the time back at the top of the page.  Amazon, please fix this with a software update.

Name: Wayne Loftus
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 April 2020
Review Content: I resisted getting a Kindle for years. I love reading, and always wanted to have a real book in my hands. I'm so glad I made the switch, though. It's like reading a real book, but I can do it with the lights off. Battery life is fantastic, even when using it very regularly.The only problem I have with the product overall is that the touchscreen is a bit slow, and when you're reading a book it normally turns the page when you are trying to bring down the options menu.I have the 8GB version, and I've about 140 books on it with plenty of room to spare. Unless you need to have a few thousand technical manuals, work documents, etc, the 8GB is probably all you'll need.

Name: Derek O
Review Title: Read in the dark, or in bright sunlight!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2018
Review Content: This my 4th Kindle (6th in the family) and I would be lost without it. My previous Kindle Paperwhite lasted for 5 years before it started developing faults, which could not be repaired. The storage is fantastic, ideal for holidays, you don’t have to carry your weight in books if you are an avid reader like me. I haven’t had occasion to check the claim that it is waterproof, and probably never will. The main advantages of the Paperwhite are, 1) the ability to read it in bed, 2) easily held in one hand, 3) page turning by touching the screen, 4) no need to have a light on which could disturb anyone else. The reason I only gave 4 stars is because there was s fault on one of the functions which took a few weeks to resolve, it is now working exactly as it should and I am hoping that this one (10th generation) lasts as long as my previous Kindle (6th generation).

Name: Mikehtc
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 October 2019
Review Content: I have used a Kindle Keyboard for over 7 years and been delighted with it. The Paperwhite is poor in comparison because the touch-screen is nowhere near as good as the buttons. To turn the page forward you tap the right-hand side of the screen but sometimes it takes a light touch and other times it takes two or three harder touches. To go back a page you are supposed to touch the left-hand side of the screen but that just does not work. Rather you have to swipe from right to left. If my Kindle Keyboard was still working I would use that and send the Paperwhite back!

Name: MamaMaz
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 September 2020
Review Content: I’ve had the same Kindle Paperwhite since 2013 and being an avid reader found it to be a great little piece of technology. Recently it started to develop a few niggles so I decided to purchase a new one.  Unfortunately after 7 years of happy reading on my old device, I find the latest Paperwhite disappointing.The screen is creamy-white which I find glaring and prefer the clear whiteness of my original model.Page-turning seems to be slower and navigation takes longer.I don’t read in the bath or pool and therefore find no benefit from it being waterproof.Although easy to hold, when encased in the compatible leather cover I find the power switch awkward to locate. Irritatingly the cover moves when turned back during reading due to its flimsiness.If I didn’t have to change my original device, I definitely wouldn’t have bothered to upgrade to the 10th Generation Kindle Paperwhite.

Name: Allan conway
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 July 2020
Review Content: When I first set up the paper white it couldn't find any bluetooth devices to pair with, despite having my apple iPhone, air pods and macbook pro next to it. I eventually got through to a technician who for some 45 minutes, had me doing various things including restarting, updating, turning bluetooth on/off etc.Eventually he decided it should be replaced. I next day phoned another technician ( not trusting the first). He said the paper white didn't have bluetooth!). I then went to no less than 5 Hermes stations to send the paper white back. The first wouldn't accept this size of parcel, the second couldn't get their mobile to work, the third had stopped taking Hermes, the fourth didn't recognise the QR code. The fifth had run out of blue receipt slips, but agreed to take it anyway. I then got a new paper white. Same problem with bluetooth. Finally spoke to a knowledgeable technician who said the bluetooth would only synch with car audio, speakers or headphones, but not air pods as they had a speaker. So in fact the first paper white was fine. WHY don't amazon explain the bluetooth function? The forum has others with same problem.The case for paper white is not as good as old hard case which could fold in the middle making holding easier.

Name: Bill K
Review Title: A good device, but take the adverts about its water resistance with a pinch of salt.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 January 2019
Review Content: Delivery was quick and trouble free (I used Amazon Locker). The dictionary works differently from my previous Kindle (a 4th generation with scroll buttons). I remember that it took a long time to get comfortable with that one, so I guess I'll get used to this one. I use my Kindle mainly for reading French books and the dictionary is very important to me. The translation feature is a nice enhancement, but it's annoying that it keeps forgetting what languages I'm using.It now supports Dutch dictionaries properly, which is a great improvement.The one criticism is that it is not as waterproof as the advertisements lead you to believe. Far from reading in the pool or on the beach as the pictures show, the instructions that actually come with the Kindle say that it can withstand brief accidental dips in fresh water and that it should be kept away from salt or chlorinated water, and that if it is accidentally immersed, it should be switched off and stood on end to dry.  I feel that the adverts were somewhat misleading.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 November 2020
Review Content: I bought this to replace my second Oasis.  I am not a lover of touch screen and the oasis was waterproof and had touch screen or buttons.  My best kindle was the original which lasted far longer than the newer models and only had button controls.  This is a nice model and I have given up on the hope of Amazon making a cheap button control model again so this time went for paperwhite.  It is good, does exactly what is advertised, in particular it is light weight and I suspect I will grow to love it.

Name: Priyanka Singh
Review Title: BUILT TO LAST - ONLY TILL ITS 1YR WARRANTY PERIOD
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 February 2021
Review Content: My old kindle was well used and well loved for 10yrs till it was lost.The new kindle didn't function very well from the start. The page back function often landed at random pages. Now, after very little use (only 4 books read) it simply stopped charging, literally 3 months past it's 12 months warranty!!Unsurprisingly there is no 'BUILD QUALITY'category in the review to grade. Need less to say from me it would be a ZERO.

Name: M. Baker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 February 2019
Review Content: Beware the new waterproof version of kindle. It's definitely not an upgrade! The touch screen is slow and often fails, the battery won't even last 2 weeks of 2 hr daily usage (the first one lasted a week between charges, so got a replacement which is only marginally better!) my old one would last about a month. The processes (like adding a book to a collection) take over 30 seconds and even just turning it on seems to take an extra 10 seconds to "warm up" my precious 2 year old kindle didn't need this warm up time! Genuinely disappointed that it's the worst version of kindle so far. Topped off by utterly useless customer service. Amazon are heading downhill.

Name: T. Harland
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 February 2019
Review Content: I loved my Kindle Paperwhite. I suffer from carpel tunnel syndrome and it is much less painful to hold than a normal book. However, after just a few month's use, I didn't use us for a while (3 months) and a battery symbol with an exclamation mark appeared on the screen. On attempting all the advice found on Google (lengthy charging then holding button for 40 seconds, then 5, numerous times; buying a new charge plug and lead) nothing had changed and it still wouldn't start up. My only conclusion that the battery had discharged so much that it could not be revived. I found a local technician who said he could replace the battery for £60 (hardly worth it as the sell for £99. So I researched replacing it myself which, from youTube, appeared to be fairly straight forward. However, to order the battery I would have to know which version Paperwhite, but all I could find was that this information (even on Wiki) was confusing and conflicting. I decided to brave it and take my Paperwhite apart to actually see what battery was inside only to find, following much more research, a replacement for this battery is NOT sold by Amazon and indeed, I could only find one supplier through eBay that sold this item in Taiwan and that it was out of stock. WHY, OH WHY, AMAZON, DO YOU SELL SOMETHING THAT IS ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE TO GET REPAIRED – EVEN WITH SOMETHING AS SIMPLE AS A BATTERY???? I AM INSENSED BY THE STUPIDITY OF THIS!!!

Name: Dawn
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 June 2020
Review Content: I have had nothing but trouble with my second paperwhite.  It re-boots several times a day for no apparent reason.  You have to filter now to put things into collections and often when you add a book into a collection it doesn’t stay there.  As this is how I separate books I have read from those I have not, it is frustrating.  When turning the over sensitive pages, you often end up opening a book (which then makes it appear under the recents filter just because you opened it).  Holding with fingers at the bottom often results in turning the whole thing off.  Never had these issues with the previous paperwhite so so called improvements are not improvements at all.

Name: Skophel
Review Title: Not compatible with all kindle books
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 May 2020
Review Content: I bought this for my daughter, but will be returning it, as it's a pointless waste of money. The first book I bought for it continually produced an error message (something that 90 mins of Amazon Customer Service assistance couldn't rectify), the book I bought for her as a replacement for the first disappointment isn't compatible with the Paperwhite. That's right, though sold as a Kindle book, it is incompatible with a Kindle.Books listed by Amazon as paperback and hardback have a dropdown menu with info on what versions of those formats are available, but the Kindle line doesn't. So it's all too easy to buy a book (especially with 1-click), only to discover it can't be read on your device.

Name: Michelle
Review Title: First time buyer and not exactly as I expected
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 May 2020
Review Content: This is the first time I bought a Kindle after wanting one for a long time, I thought I would opt for one of the latest models. The fact that you have thousands of books at your fingertips is great as I am an avid reader, and it is very portable and easy to hold. However I was disappointed with how it functions, it is slower to respond than I expected and the transitions between pages are glitchy. I thought it would be seamless but as I said I am a new user so I assume this is the norm. I'm sure I will get on with it, but for the price I expected a more seamless experience.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: So happy I finally bought it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 September 2020
Review Content: I love to read and at the start of lockdown I finished my books and it was difficult to get new ones so I took the plunge and bought a kindle. I am annoyed I didn't do it sooner. I always thought I would miss a physical book but I really don't. The easy and convenience of a kindle is incredible. I can search so many books in an instance, I get book suggestions based on my recent reads and I can sample a book before buying it to see if its the perfect book for me. I have read so many new books because of it. The battery lasts for weeks, it is so light and easy to use. I would suggest buying a cover to protect it and offers a little more grip. Its like having a protective cover on your phone. I am really am so happy I bought it.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Title: Very light and visible in bright sunlight
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 August 2019
Review Content: I bought this for the visibility in all light conditions and for the battery life. When first loading it with books I was a bit disappointed with the battery life but now it is loaded it retains charge for days if used for reading books only. It can be used to listen to audio books via a Bluetooth earphone but this did seem to use the battery quickly. The display is black and white, easily visible but for general use I prefer my kindle fire as some books contain illustrations that show better on the fire. Much lighter to carry the paper white and ideal for waiting rooms. The touchscreen needs more pressure than my other kindles which took a bit of getting used to.

Name: Tony Addyman
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 May 2019
Review Content: After reading some less than favourable reviews I was uncertain about getting a Kindle. I had been using a Web browser or Android KIndle app successfully for years. However, I am very pleased with my Kindle. The battery life is good. I have it in aeroplane mode most of the time, and have read 6 Faith Martin books and only used about 50% of the battery. I have not really been aware of the built in light. In poor light the page has a "glow", so you can read easily, but you are not aware of the source of the light. At least, I am not. I found that there was a bit of a lag when using the touch screen during the original setup, but it hasn't been a problem when using the Kindle to read books, which is why I bought it after all. Having said that, I have found sending documents to my Kindle via email to be very easy, so it may find use as a store for electronic documents that I want to have easily accessible.

Name: NEIL-A
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 April 2019
Review Content: I had trouble setting it up and it can be quite confusing talking through things on the phone (as there are many devices under Paperwhite) I had to get help registering,it would not work when following instructions to register(the lady did sort it on her end.much of my problems (with PDF transfer) were down to lack of personal knowledge ---Although without help I could not send via the Email@kindle, I ended up using the USB and managed it that way.In all, it pays to persevere. As far as my reading experience-I am happy)I find the black background with white fonts is good on the eyes... something for all tastes and needs. It takes a while to get used to the format(taps rather than presses to turn pages etc. Also, I bought the leather ''Amazon cover'' second hand''. People complain of easy marking but it is easy to resurface it by rubbing with a rough cloth, tee shirt, on the carpet,etc, brings it back to a new matt finish

Name: David F.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 April 2019
Review Content: Love the kindle paperwhite. Screen is basically the same as model before but has no raised surround so really easy to wipe clean. Now waterproof which means I don't have to worry when reading while soaking in the bath. Plus now twice the storage and will Bluetooth connect to another device if you listen to audio books. The only thing that let's it down is the charging port, the lead amazon sends just does not fit properly or work as I tried a couple but I found that if I used a Samsung charger it worked great and Amazon sent me a new Samsung charger at my request so problem solved. I would still highly recommend the latest kindle paperwhite as it is still an amazing e-reader. Thanks

Name: Jacqui
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 August 2019
Review Content: This is my third kindle and replaces my much used, and loved, kindle keyboard, which had a failing battery. However I am very pleased with this new device. It is smaller and lighter even than my 2 year old paperwhite, and the light is wonderful, very clear text in all lighting situations, from darkness through twilight to bright sunshine. There is no shading at all.  I bought the device with “special offers” and don’t find the constant recommendations particularly troublesome. The touchscreen is rather sensitive, I really would prefer page turn buttons, but couldn’t justify the cost of a kindle voyage. Overall though, I do like it very much and would definitely recommend this new paperwhite.

Name: watanabe43
Review Title: A fantastic upgrade on an original Kindle.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 December 2018
Review Content: I bought this during Black Friday to replace my aging Kindle 4.0 and it has been a revelation. The backlight makes reading so much more pleasurable both in daylight and darkness, I never found the greyness of the original particularly natural and this feels much more like a normal book. My old Kindle had a very good case with a built in flip out light but cannot compare to a backlight. I haven't made use of the waterproofing yet but look forward to reading in the bath! The only negative I have found is that the Special Offers are not compatible with an 'automatic' read/wake case as there is an additional step of awkwardly swiping the screen. As a result I had to pay the extra £10 to remove the ads but this is not enough to mark the product down. Lovely little piece of kit.

Name: D S Jones
Review Title: A superb kindle even for the elderly generation!...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 January 2020
Review Content: This kindle was bought as a Christmas present for my mother-in-law and she loves it!.. She is 87 years old and she loves reading and bought paperback books on a weekly basis which mounted up and obviously causes storage problems. We didn't know what to buy her for Christmas and the day before Christmas Eve asked her if she would like one.. We were pleasantly surprised when she agreed and no more trawling around shops to find suitable books!...So Amazon thank you for your superb ordering and delivery service andA for making Christmas special for our mom.

Name: indyelvis
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 May 2019
Review Content: Wow! Wow! Just wow!First, Kindle:I was one of those; Books should be paper. The feel, the smell, the whatever.(I still kind of am, though)But this is taking The Book to another level. For I love the flexibility of it all.I love reading. But I love reading two-three-four books at the same time. So I turned to iBooks on my iPad/iPhone/Mac. For years.A friend let me borrow his old Kindle and I was sold. The thing about the light is really important. Yes, you can read on an iPad. iBooks works. No problems there. But reading alot, and for a long time, the lights does matter. And nothing is better than the Kindle when it comes to that good, long reading session.Then, Kindle PaperWhite:This is my first Kindle. I bought it from amazon.co.uk (living in Norway - amazon was really helpful when it comes to tax and all; it's all in there when you buy, easy to understand).I ordered it on friday and got it tuesday. DHL, baby!It is mine! I have a Kindle!So small. One thinks; this is too small. But it is not. It is perfect. Perfect in every way. Thin, low weight. Waterproof, they say. I have not tried reading under water, but I have been reading every way possible for three days now, still 47% battery from 54% when delivered.I have big hands and it falls in place perfectly. There is nothing wrong with this. It is all good.I found my favourite J. London (John Barleycorn) and complete short stories by John Steinbeck in the amazon store for $80. I have downloaded a lot of free samples to read for later.I open it up (I bought a Omoton case https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07KG8HYCL/ref=pe_1572281_66412651_cm_rv_eml_rv0_dp ) and have problems putting it down. Hands down.Reading books on my Kindle Paperwhite as an adult is just as fun as it was sneaking into school libraries at night ;)One does not want to quit!My workplace offers free and new massage chairs to it's workers. I am now coming to work two hours early, and leaving two hours late, just to sit in one of those bad boys and read, read, read. And I love it!

Name: Menace
Review Title: The Battery will Die if not used for a couple of months
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 April 2020
Review Content: This kindle was not as easy to use as the old kindle I previously owned for some years, but it did have a good display when it worked.  Disappointed that when the screen is turned off the battery is still being drained.  The last time I used it was early January, however when I came to use it recently Early April it was completely dead, and of course out of warrenty.  Sorry not impressed.

Name: Sam
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2021
Review Content: So, I bought this recently then realised that the text doesn't fully justify, despite fiddling with all the settings. I spoke with customer services and they didn't know what I meant about the alignment of the text and so replaced the Kindle, however, I have the same problem with the new one. What I don't understand is, why to give the option of alignments when clearly Amazon hasn't added it as a viable option. It's a shame because I was upgrading from the 4th gen, which actually had this option. I detest left-justified text (and I'm not the only one! Check out some forums!) and am considering going to another type of reader if this isn't resolved. Open any real book and won't be left-justified, why should my Kindle be so?Finally, as a left-handed person, I am having to get used to swiping the pages forward and tapping for back, which isn't always successful.Apart from these complaints, I can see the Kindle as well built as the previous one, the addition of the light is great and I haven't tested the battery life yet (still may return!)Can I get a manufacturer reply regarding updating the justification to meet the spec of the 4th gen??

Name: Ollivia
Review Title: Lovely way of reading, especially when you can't sleep
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2019
Review Content: I love the way it's so easy to use, and can be held at any angle with one hand. Haven't tested reading it when I'm in the bath yet.  For novels and non-fiction that don't have lots of pictures, it's great, but it only shows pictures in black and white.  I wouldn't use it for recipe books or books that depend on pictures, but otherwise it's brilliant!One thing I do find with the text though - and it's the only downside - I find a lot of errors in the typing in some books, as well as page formatting.  However, if we all send back the issues (press on the word until a message comes up and look for the three dots on the rhs.  Press on them and then report the error) the people who set the text will eventually get the message that these things need to be proof read.

Name: Pat Stephens
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 August 2020
Review Content: I bought the paperwhite when my old kindle was about to give up the ghost (after 8 years). I was a bit hesitant after reading some reviews, I shouldn't have worried. I love it and should have bought it sooner. It is lighter than my original kindle, meaning I can hold it in one hand rather than two and I am able to read it after dark, a real plus. It charges very quickly, although having said that the battery does last so much longer. I have not tried the waterproof feature yet, so I will reserve judgement until I am in the jacuzzi and, inevitably, drop it. I would thoroughly reccommend it.

Name: Steven W.
Review Title: Almost the best thing since a real Book
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 April 2020
Review Content: Great eBook reader, was a replacement for my original Sony eBook reader.Super lightweight, clear reading screen, even in bright light.It says waterproof, but I don't intend trying this, even for a review.I take mine almost every where, it fits snuggly in to a large pocket, (Inside pocket of my outdoor coat too).Just need to find a nice case for it, (Don't buy the "OMOTON Kindle Paperwhite Case", I have had two and the corners keep breaking).I have had this since new, I bought it December 2018, and have only just remembered to do the review.

Name: Kensong
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2019
Review Content: This is very, very similar to my old Paperwhite. Does exactly the sae job in fact, but every time I open it there are adverts for other books and I ave to clear them before I can get to my books. The ad's are lined across the bottom of the screen so to get to my books there are now 3/4 actions instead of just opening the Kindle.. Yes it's light and easy to hold and I can read in bright sunlight or in the dark, it does that beautifully - as did my old one. The touch screen is quick and responsive and easy to use but please ditch the ads. I've bought the kindle obviously I'm going to buy books for it - there is no need to advertise them.

Name: I. Gibson
Review Title: Good reading experience, but a step backwards for its technology
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2021
Review Content: Bought this as a replacement for my 10-year old Kindle, which finally stopped working. Backlight and weight are an improvement. WiFi connection is extremely frustrating - it will lose connection and require me to restart my home router before reconnecting- despite everywhere wireless device I own working perfectly with the connection.Touch screen controls are a bit fiddly to use at times. The interface is definitely not as intuitive as my old-school Kindle. Responsiveness is not great either - and the amount of time it takes to reboot is painfully slow.The e-ink still works as well on the eyes, so definitely better for reading than a regular tablet. Hopefully Amazon won't abandon this format, but if they continue with it, I think they need to seriously up their game, as when I decide to replace this, I'm going to be looking at alternatives.Also worth noting that the Paperwhite really needs a cover. Not only to protect the screen, but for handling. It feels too light without a cover. With, it's absolutely fine.

Name: PJM
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 February 2020
Review Content: I've had a kindle for many years they are great. I bought this new one last year simply because I cracked the screen on my old one.The new one is a 10 gen device, fully touch screen. I've had more trouble in 6 months that I had with my old one in 10 years. What makes it worse us that you try to talk to Amazon and they make it so hard to "contact us" and when you eventually do get to talk to someone its the most frustrating of experiences.I'd never buy one of these again, I am resigned to resetting the device as new whenever it fails to start up... which is frequent.Don't buy, its an absolute piece of junk... what a shame.

Name: SARAH BATTEN
Review Title: It is a Kindle that should be survive a quick dip.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 June 2020
Review Content: Perfect for taking on holiday, on any train/plane journey as can hold more books than you could possibly pack or read.  Light and easy to read and the latest version hopefully waterproof enough to drop in the bath or splash with water, not yet tested.  Good backlight of variable intensity, great range of text size for those who otherwise need reading glasses and plenty of good books available from Amazon ranging from the serious to frivolous and many on offer for £1.00.  Plus books can be shared with family members who also have a kindly.

Name: Julia123
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 March 2021
Review Content: Such a waste of money. I bought this kindle to replace one that Had been my old faithful. After 16 months of limited use, my kindle won’t charge. Tried re-setting but nothing helps. I’ve been offered a measly 15% discount off my next kindle purchase by Amazon. This is so frustrating. It is such an expensive product.the whisper sync never worked either. Really unhappy at the amount I spent thinking I was getting top of the range! Really not worth it.

Name: FunkyFlag
Review Title: Waterproof but audio/reading link is very poor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 May 2019
Review Content: I love reading in the bath and this is perfect. BUT and a fairly big BUT I am far from impressed with the ‘swap between reading and audio’. I already own a lot of Kindle books so am a good customer. When I bought this I decided to re-read books and swap between reading and listening. Audible books are often cheaper if you have bought the Kindle book. Good in theory but not one has synced without several calls to Amazon and in each case a new version the Kindle book has had to be sent. The last time this happened it took FOUR customer service advisors to sort it. I suspect that it affects British customers more than Americans as our versions the Kindle books do not exactly match the recorded version (which tend a to use American words).It is interesting that this is not even something that they ask you to give stars to in this review. My experiences since buying this device is that Amazon do not care at all about their customers.

Name: D. K.
Review Title: Kindle for Kids is a disaster
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 November 2019
Review Content: Got this as a digital reader for a child and it's a disaster. While the hardware is rather better than of previous editions, the added software especially for children account is, in my opinion, violating the anti-monopoly law of EU, as it only allows child to read books purchased in Kindle store. If you add a book from 3rd party provider, they are imported into your library as "documents" rather than "books", and so you can't share them with children. Obviously it was done so you would purchase all your books at Amazon, and I foresee a huge fine on Amazon for doing that.

Name: T
Review Title: First Kindle and I'm loving it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 November 2018
Review Content: Purchased the new Kindle a few weeks ago and I'm really enjoying it so far. Loving the cheap deals I can get on books and I'm definitely reading more now than I ever had. The size and weight of it are absolutely perfect.  The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is because it's a bit glitchy (which is normal). Otherwise, if you're thinking of buying one, just do it.

Name: CWallis
Review Title: Greatly helped ability to read because of problems with my vision
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 August 2020
Review Content: I use my paperwhite to not only read books but also listen to audio books. I can switch between the two, so say I am listening to an audio book but when I go to bed I dont want to be noisy so I switch to my kindle and it seamlessly switches over.I have a permenent problem with my eyes due to migraine which causes a halo around black text on white backgrounds, but with my kindle I can set it to display white text on a black background which helps a great deal. I can also alter the amount of space in between rows of text and alter the size of text. I cant tell you what a difference this has made to my ability to read, I am so happy.I like to sit in my garden and read and it doesnt matter how sunny it is the text shows up perfectly. I can alter the brightness so that at night when I'm reading in bed I can turn the brightness down so as not to stimulate my brain so I can get to sleep.

Name: Rich McG
Review Title: A massive step up from 1st gen Paperwhite
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 May 2019
Review Content: I thought it was about time to upgrade from my first kindle, a 1st generation Paperwhite from 2012. It's still going strong but looking a bit tired, and I have found myself moving back to paper books. With a holiday coming up, though, I wanted the convenience of a kindle... would the new (2018, 10th gen) Paperwhite be enough of an upgrade?Yes, and then some.While I understand many of the features it boasts that are new to me are not new to kindles in general, I am blown away by how sleek this thing is compared to my stone age gadget. The screen resolution is a thing to behold - no more jagged blocky text, and the freedom to use more delicate fonts (begone, hideous Caecilia).Ah, the fonts. One of the real selling points of this device for me was that Amazon have now made it easy to add custom fonts from a computer. I love this, as I'm not a fan of the standard fonts (Bookerly, which my old kindle didn't have, is rather nice though). As soon as I got it I added 10 serif fonts I liked, to make pages look more like those of an actual book. Even better, you can tweak the boldness to make it look just right.Everything is orders of magnitude more responsive than my old kindle. Navigating the store is no longer a trial. The frontlight is totally even. And I love the bezel being flush to the screen.Any downsides? It's a dust and fingerprint magnet. I still wish it had page turn buttons, but now Amazon force you to buy an Oasis if you want those. A colour e-Ink screen would be great but they're still a ways off.As for battery life... I've had it a month, have read 3 books, and it's still on its first charge, with 42% battery left. Pretty excellent in my book!

Name: Mavis Cook
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 November 2018
Review Content: Loved the Kindle, light and easy to drop into the handbag or fit in the back pocket for whenever the opportunity arises  to dip into books on the go.Very disappoint by the audio side of it, where there is no jack for head phones, an important preference to have rather than transmitting audio through paring the Kindle with another device which takes away personalized listening on the go. Still finding my way round it.  I maybe a technophobe, but I would like to know if listening to e-books through headphones can be achieved, and that would Be very useful and practical.The HOME button is supposed to give an option where one can download or view the manual, however that's not the case. It would be useful to have this option at hand to refer to for tips on how to use the Kindle efficiently.

Name: operabuff
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 November 2019
Review Content: Over  the years I have bought 4 of these, two of which were for presents with which the recipients were delighted. Unfortunately my first one (which I have used for years) has now gone faulty. I cannot get it working again so have invested in a fourth which is at present working perfectly. I usually enjoy reading in bed at night before sleep for which this is just the job. You can just switch it off when you've had enough and them pick up where you left off. There is a massive collection of books so whatever your interests, fiction or otherwise you, are sure to find lots of them.

Name: Grimian
Review Title: A happy wife means a happy life
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 September 2019
Review Content: Bought for my wife as a surprise before a holiday abroad . She is very happy with it being a lot lighter, brighter and easier to read than her original kindle with built in keyboard which has served her well. The only thing she is missing is the ability to turn the page with  buttons as she could do this with one hand on her old one. Whether the addition of buttons would affect it’s  ability to be waterproof, I do not know, but I guess she will have to learn a new technique!We ordered the kindle with a ‘water safe’ case which compliments the kindle well and has so far withstood some intensive poolside reading without any issues. She’s happy so I highly recommended it!

Name: Denise
Review Title: Don’t bother, it breaks and amazon won’t fix it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 April 2020
Review Content: Bought this kindle and loved it although didn’t use it much due to having a lot of paper books to finish reading. The Kindle hadn’t been switched on in a while, when I did turn it on it wouldn’t load past the picture of a kid under a tree. I contacted amazon who said it was under a month out of warranty but here’s 15% off the next one. The first didn’t even last a year so why would I bother buying a second? Expensive reading for one year, so disappointed and annoyed with the customer service.

Name: Mr. Thomas Houston
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 September 2020
Review Content: First off, I really did like the buttons on the right hand of my old Kindle.But with a little trepidation I started using my Kindle Paperwhite and much to my delight I have found the touch screen easy to work.Only slight downside was that I purchased the Kindle Cover which unfortunately doesn't have an elastic band across the reverse side, which was goot for holding the Kindle.Possibly my previous cover wasn't a branded cover, and therein lies the difference.Overall, we'll pleased and extremely satisfied with my updated version of an old favorite.

Name: John Law
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2020
Review Content: Easy to use as always, bought this one to replace one I dropped in the bath!!!My main complaint is the positioning of the button to turn the device on; it is very sensitive and is placed just where your little finger rest when reading the device (mine does anyway),. you are constantly turning the device off.  A better place for this start button would be on the side or the top.I have made a slide from an A4  gripper that slides easily across and covers the on/off switch - works very well;. Perhaps I should patent it.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Perfect upgrade for long term kindle readers!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 January 2020
Review Content: Upgraded my old kindle (the one with side buttons and no keyboard) to this - love having a backlight so I can read in bed without annoying the boyfriend. Battery life is still great, it came with about 40% charge and I only needed to plug it in about 2 weeks later, having done A LOT of reading over the Christmas period.I do agree that the standby button underneath is a bit stupid. I have accidentally pressed it once so far.Love having a touch screen - I actually use the highlight function now!If you’ve had yours for 8 years too, go for this as an upgrade! I also got given a lovely new case which fits perfectly and is so much nicer than my old tatty peeling leather one I had!!

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: What year or model is it?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 September 2020
Review Content: I ordered what I thought was the latest model Kindle Paperwhite form Amazon priced £129.99 and also an Omoton case for the 2019 onwards model.  The Paperwhite did not fit into the case. I tried four times to speak to Amazon and each time I was cut off (VERY RUDE). I tried to email them to find out if I had ordered the wrong case and which one to order or had I been sent an old model Paperwhite, but just kept going round in circles! I am now going to send them both back and start again. What a waste of my time and their money on postage costs.If the order is right it is good, if it is wrong you pull your hair out, SHOCKING CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Name: Mr. M. W. Dorling
Review Title: Good for reading in low light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 September 2019
Review Content: Having resisted buying a Kindle for some years (I prefer a weighty tome to yet another device), I've found recently that reading by anything other than daylight or bright electric light (the latter of which I don't like) was becoming more difficult. Furthermore, I recently learned that Kindles do not emit blue light so are less likely to hinder sleep - something which also had concerned me for some years (I have the Kindle app on my phone but wouldn't use it for reading in bed, for that reason). Finally, all my bookshelves are now full, so I decided that maybe it was time to submit and purchase a Kindle. I am very pleased with the Paperwhite that arrived last week (and the cover that arrived at the same time) and would recommend one to anyone who is finding reading in anything less than bright light a problem, or who has run out of space for shelving books but not the wish to read them.

Name: B H SLACK
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 July 2020
Review Content: My old Kindle which i have had for many years was acting up, needing to have a "hard reboot" twice so I decided to treat myself to a new one and keep the other as back-up (should I forget to charge the new one at some stage). What a difference, no more silly buttons on the side which I used to manage to knock frequently, nice simple touch screen.  I do still have a bit of an issue finding the books that I transferred over, but I think that is me rather than the Kindle.  The back light is brilliant, means I can finally read in bed comfortably. Very pleased with it.

Name: Paula
Review Title: Multipurpose e-reader, but poor battery life
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2019
Review Content: Love this, especially as you can sync earphones for Audible audiobook listening. It’s my first e-reader with a light, which is great for evening reading. The screen is a little slow to respond to touch. However, I’m very disappointed by the battery life, but this is probably due to not being able to switch it off entirely. I’ve tried putting it in airplane mode and powering it down, but that doesn’t help. My old Kobo e-reader could be left switched off for a month and the battery percentage would still hold. It’s something I’ve just got to get used to.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 May 2020
Review Content: This is my third kindle, and my second paperwhite. I love the backlight. The new o/s is a bit over the top on trying to upsell.The main gripe though is the position and operation of the on/off button. It is all too easy to touch this while holding kindle. I would prefer that you have to slide power off, as to accidentally do this would be almost impossible.Expensive for what it is, the battery is good, I would not buy another just to get better on/off button. if you read as often as I do this issue does come up a lot.

Name: Mr Pricklepin
Review Title: This is the Kindle to buy!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 April 2019
Review Content: This 8Gb model is the one I should have bought for myself, instead of the 32Gb version. It's the same apart from the storage, and the price! You can store thousands of books on 8Gb and if you're an Audible user hundreds of audio files as well. As everything is backed up on Amazon's Servers, why would you want to scroll through thousands of books on your device? OK if you're going on holiday where there's no WiFi or internet, but for every day use?This version has the smallest storage space for this model. It is more than adequate for your day to day reading needs. My older 4Gb Kindle never ran out of space and I have hundreds of documents and books stored on it. The only reason I upgraded was that the screen was better.

Name: Lee W
Review Title: The best gadget I never knew I needed!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 June 2019
Review Content: Firstly let me start by saying I have never been one for reading very much. I was hesitant on getting a kindle but as I prefer reading either at night or when I'm outside, the screen on the kindle paperwhite seemed the best option. I was not let down! the screen is brilliant, with varying brightnesses and zero issues with reading in direct sunlight.It can be slightly awkward to hold, I bought a flip case with mine which does make it easier, It's more like holding a book this way but with less weight.The User Interface and the system as a whole are not fantastic. It can be pretty slow at times and does not respond to light touch, you definitely have to be precise and patient with it.Overall, 100% worth it! I now use it every day and can often be found in a quiet corner somewhere reading a book now!

Name: linda dunstan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 March 2019
Review Content: I have an original Kindle which is working ok but I decided a back light would be beneficial. I was bought this for Christmas but am not finding it easy to use.Several issues with customer service including them hanging up on me.All my books were added to my new kindle however all the ones I had read were mixed with the ones I hadn't and the only way of sorting this is out is to do it manually which with around 400 books is going to take some time.The back light is great and the cover I bought enables the Kindle to turn on when I open the cover which is a nice feature. Hopefully I will get used  to my new Kindle and love it like my old one at present I am a little disappointed

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 June 2020
Review Content: Very pleased with this. Designed for reading and does the job very well. I particularly like how you can adjust the font and font size to make reading even easier. Feels comfortable in your hand and not too heavy. You can even read in strong sunshine without glare. For me, the battery lasts about two weeks but keeping it on aeroplane mode extends it further. Sometimes when reading my finger accidentally presses the lock button but I found adding a cover helps, I bought the yellow fabric cover which looks great!

Name: David F
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 April 2019
Review Content: Luckily I had a gift voucher for £50, and got this in the 'sale', so, it cost me £49.99, which I think is a fair price, no way would I have bought it at £119 or even £100. The item is fine. Amazon are just so greedy, hence the low score. And the battery life is an out and out lie, I have my light on 11, read for perhaps half an hour a night, turn it off completely and the battery loses 10 to 15% .Oh and the 'special offers. Wi fi is off so I only see the one thing.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 June 2019
Review Content: It just makes me angry. I'm not throwing it to the bin just because it's a pressent from somebody I really appreciate. It's difficult to manage. Most options takes you to the amazon books shop, instead of to the library. It seems that is been designed to sell books instead of to read them. The screen is too small and the book pages don't addapt properly to the screen. If you make zoom you'll find you need to be moving the screen from side to side to be able to read each line. Name: Steve
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 December 2019
Review Content: For something that's not particularly cheap either at £100, this Paperwhite kindle is a big disappointment.The software runs very clunky in how it responds to commands and touch when swiping to move the home screen or when reading a book in how the pages turn.So seeing how this was an early christmas present for my partner, I have to say, I would not recommend buying this version of a kindle, as a friend of mine has the older version and it's a lot better in every way.My subjective opinion of this gift is...Very Disappointing!!

Name: AJ Fernandez
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 May 2019
Review Content: I don't normally write reviews but I am quite annoyed with this kindle so I'm doing it.On the positive side the screen is much better, actually now that I need glasses to read I can see better with this screen.Apart from that I prefer the old one I don't thing Amazon improved the Kindle apart from the screen.The battery runs out very quickly and doesn't even tell you is running low, it just doesn't turn off whereas in the old one the device tells you the battery is low and you can still read for a couple of days after the message if you forget to charge it.In the old one you had to slide the button to turn it on, the new one it just pressing a button and it turns on in bag all the time.Finding my books is a nightmare and the touch screen is hideous as the screen is small and it's difficult to get what you want in some cases when you touch it.And something that's not improved is the time no need to hold the button to turn off the screen.Please next time improve it but without loosing the good features.

Name: Memphis
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2019
Review Content: I bought this to replace my old kindle which I had dropped, and cracked the screen. I'm still not sure what the 'special features' are, but it is a wonderful little gadget if you read/listen to as many books as I do. Having arthritis in my wrists means I cannot hold a paperback for long, so propping this up on a flat surface means I can read to my heart's content. The only slightly off-putting feature is that it tells me how many other people have highlighted certain passages in whatever book I am reading. This irritates me; why should I need to know who else has highlighted what?  The audible function is easy to use and fantastic to have. I use it every day. And the 3-installment payment plan made it affordable.

Name: Maidmarion
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 October 2019
Review Content: Husband bought me another brand e-reader some years ago and I never took to it. Thought I liked to hold a "real" book, so was wary of taking the plunge into another e-reader. How glad I am that I did!Just the right size to hold comfortably; great if you're travelling to carry multiple books and keep the weight down; can still read it in a dim room or in sunlight; don't have to worry about bookshelf space anymore; no more trips to the library; great selection of free books with Amazon Prime reading. The icing on the cake was a good deal on the price on Amazon deal day (or whatever it's called). Really glad I made the purchase.

Name: F. Gamble
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 January 2020
Review Content: This is my 6th Kindle (Yes I keep leaving them on airplanes and the like!) So easy to download all the existing content. Especially when you link it at the time of purchase. I purchaed through Amazon, so I don't know how easy that woudl be if you bought it in a shop.  Unlike my previous ones thsi has a back light which makes reading in bed at night so much easier.  My only issue with Kindles is that they are slippwery and smooth and so difficult to holdd. So I bought an Amazon leather cover which works much better, gives more traction.

Name: Faye
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 May 2020
Review Content: I always said I would never go to electronic books but I've been converted.  I still love the smell of a book which will never change but I would not be without my kindle, it goes with me everywhere.  You can fit so many books on it, so if you are not feeling one, just try another.  You can fit it in your pocket so it can literally go with you wherever you go and if you get the chance to read there you are.  The battery life is amazing even with the light on.  I could not recommend high enough.  If you like reading, get yourself one.

Name: Jon34
Review Title: A good, solid version of the kindle
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 January 2020
Review Content: This was a replacement for my first kindle that stopped working after over 8 years. The loss of the keypad makes it shorter than its predecessor but the screen is the same size which is welcome. Changing to the touch screen took a bit of time to adjust to as to go forward a page or going back involves touching the right or left side of the screen but ,almost everything else I use has a touch screen so, now I have got used to it, it is consistent with other devices. The slight problem is that other devices have precise "keys" on the screen to touch so it takes time to get used to the new layout, e.g. to get to the main menu you touch the top of the screen.For the wifi there is a flight mode, identical to smart phones etc., but it is unclear whether this switches off the wifi which I previously used to save power.I get a bit fed up with the suggestions for further reading but I suppose you have to let Amazon to advertise so that they can make more money, but I very rarely respond to advertising as I normally search in order to fulfill a need.I appreciate the internal light but I don't make much use of it as it is very unusual for me to read my kindle when lighting is not availableThe waterproofing is basically shower proof, but this is welcome when you are sitting on a beach.Overall, this is an appropriate replacement for my previous kindle,

Name: James
Review Title: Excellent e-reader, attractive and feature-packed, but does lack library compatibility.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2018
Review Content: The Paperwhite is attractive, easy-to-use and has plenty of customisation option and note-taking ability - I use highlights a lot! Features such as wordwise and Vocabulary builder and interesting and well-thought out. Everything on the Paperwhite is easy to use.I do wish it would work with library e-books - renting e-books from my local library is something I find a lot more affordable than buying EVERY book, and other e-readers are compatible with library services whereas the Kindle is not.Also, as a more minor feature it could perhaps have an alternative highlight option for easier note categorisation - as the Paperwhite is greyscale it couldn't be another colour, but how about an outline option, or a squiggly underline? This

Name: Jean L
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 February 2020
Review Content: I have owned a kindle paperwhite for several years and decided to upgrade.  There are several new featured on my new paperwhite including returning a book straight to kindle unlimited as I remove it, and of course its waterproof so I can read by a pool without worrying.  it is also thinner & lighter, so overall i am very pleased with my new paperwhite.

Name: Adam Ogle
Review Title: Perfect travel companion for those who love to read
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 January 2019
Review Content: I've been deliberating about buying a kindle for a while as I love reading but I like the feel of an actual book but travelling more often pushed my hand! This has been the perfect travel companion, it's ideal for journeys as it fits in my pocket and weighs virtually nothing. The backlight is great for reading in pitch black and no glare at all in sunlight! I read for at least an hour every day and haven't charged it for almost a month now, the battery life is honestly incredible.My only negatives are that the screen on it doesn't feel completely flush all the way around and the power button is a little wonky - both of these haven't been picked up by any of my friends or family when they look at the device though so could be because I'm a little obsessive about that sort of thing (which is why I've still rated a 5)

Name: 27-zetec

Review Content: I dislike being conned,like I was by your telephone representatives, as they said our conversation was recorded so you a have recorded. Name: Hoolio
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2019
Review Content: I love this!I debated about an e-reader for years because I preferred real books but I'm so glad uve finally got one.it has allowed me to read and have access to a lot more books. what I love most is discovering small authors that are only on kindle.It has some great features.-light control let's me dim it down so I can read in bed withoutndisturbibg my partner-built in dictionary means I can easily and effortlessly look up words I don't understand-it's also great for reporting errors/typos etc in books you read-changing text size is super easy aswell- you can put a pin/password on it when locked to stop it from being as easily accessedconsalthough it's waterproof I find if I'm reading in the bath and the screen gets wet from condensation I can swipe easily when reading. this makes not having a button a real pain. getting a stylus helps but they are easily misplaced esp if you carry your book EVERYWHERE like meslow to load- the store is pretty slow to load. I tend to explore the store via an app on my phone and then sync my library upadverts- what I most hate about kindle and if anyone knows how to turn them off let me know . when the kindle goes into sleep mode adverts pop up. often it's books and I really dnt like that because anyone can see it and Its not always a good representation if what I'm reading.

Name: Paul Mc Carthy

Name: R. Markham
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 September 2019
Review Content: Somewhat hesitant about getting a Kindle as I have been happy reading ebooks on my iPad. However I finally relented and bought the Paperwhite to take on holiday to cut down hard book space/weight. What a good decision that was! Using the Kindle on the beach was so much better than wrestling with a book, trying to keep it dry, pages falling out, book getting wet etc. It is well constructed, very light, waterproof, compact and really easy to hold or prop up at any angle for easy reading positions on the beach. I have installed the Kindle App on my iPhone and iPad as the Kindle syncs with both of them (as well as iMac at home) so I have the best of all worlds. The front light facility is really useful in poorly lit environments. I purchased it over two weeks ago and whilst I have used it regularly every day it still has 30% charge left. To protect the Kindle, an outer cover is a worthwhile purchase. I have no regrets about purchasing the Kindle Paperwhite and am very pleased with the purchase.

Name: Irene
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 May 2019
Review Content: I have had various kindle paperwhites over the years and can only say that with each new version the performance suffers , since they keep updating (every few weeks its seems) I have problems, since the last update with the filter I can no longer download a book without having to restart the darn thing, and that's even when fully charged. Name: Chris Naish
Review Title: OK but not my favorite purchase
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 May 2020
Review Content: I guess I still like the feel of a book.  I can see that when I travel the Kindle will have its advantages.  The screen is good in a wide range of lighting conditions and the device feels itself good in the hand although I'd prefer it a little taller and narrower (more paperback book format). Personally, if you aren't going to travel much certainly do not get a case - I would agree with many of the bad reviews of the standard 'leather' (is it really - not any leather I've had before) case - I've taken my case off the device - when its on it make the device too heavy and it has quite hard edges - it doesn't feel good in the hand. I have been using the kindle app on the phone and I'm not convinced this is a significant advantage (I miss seeing the covers etc in colour when selecting books).  I may update this as I grow into it.

Review Content: This Kindle replaced one that I have had for many years - I like the size of it and the screen and operation are very good.  The only thing I miss is being able to turn the pages on either side of the Kindle - this one can only be changed by touching the right hand side of th screen -  I lie on my right hand side in bed to read and find it awkward to use - I suppose it is after years of turning the pages by clicking with my left thumb!It was straightforward to set up and all my books transferred over without problems.  I bought it when it was on offer - I am not sure I would have bought it if not - there are quite a few e readers on offer.

Name: Hants
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 March 2019
Review Content: I bought this Kindle Paper White to replace my last Kindle which I loved. I thought my last Kindle was perfect until I got this one; it really is brilliant. It does exactly what it says it does and I love reading from it. I have set it up exactly as I want it, which makes reading easy and a pleasure.My old Kindle was slightly bigger so I had to add some packing to the case (see the photo) which works just as well - it shuts off and wakes up when the lid is opened and shut. Name: MrsB
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 January 2020
Review Content: This is my second Kindle Paperwhite. I had the previous one for a long time and loved it but unfortunately I dropped it in the bath! I have now requested a refund and will buy once there is a review of the hardware, and in a different store such as John Lewis, who offer better support. Early adopters usually get punished...

Name: A. R. Cooper
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2020
Review Content: I’ll get straight to the point. If your Kindle is suffering from poor battery life and if you have downloaded a lot of books to it, it may be that it has got stuck indexing. You could try this, it worked for me:1 Search for a nonsense word such as “gyrddtf”.2 If “Text in Books” is highlighted, tap it, and it will list books that are not yet indexed.3 When I did this there was one book listed. I deleted it (removed from device).That’s it.Since doing this my kindle has drained from 100% to 85% in three days of normal use (with wifi on and the light set to 12), which seems acceptable. I have also re-downloaded the offending book and it indexed without any issue.There’s plenty on-line regarding this issue (when you realise what it is) but essentially it seems to be an issue with the Kindle trying to index a large numbers of books. This is a fairly processor intensive process and sometimes the Kindle simply gets stuck. It will keep trying to index thus draining the battery quickly. Switching to airplane mode or turning off wifi will have no effect too, as the process is internal. My Kindle initially lost 60% battery in the first day after downloading 170 books!The issue will mostly effect those who already own Kindles and therefore have built up a library of books and try to download them to their new devices. Users of earlier non-backlit versions will also be used to normally excellent battery life. All of which compounds the frustration.In my experience Kindle products are usually of very good quality. It’s a shame that the physical technology is let down by an apparent software glitch.Hope this helps.

Name: The Camera Guy

Name: Lizzi M
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2019
Review Content: Purchased the new (10th generation) kindle paperwhite to replace my 8yr old existing kindle which had served me well. This was mainly for the convenience of the light and touchscreen. I had read the excellent  reviews and bought for the reduced price whilst it was on offer. Having the adjustable light screen is so much better, I don't know how I managed without one for so long.A great purchase and would recommend to anyone considering an e-reader.

Name: Gerard Murphy
Review Title: So light and easy to use.

Review Content: I just love my new Kindle. I always thought I never wanted one. However I’m going on holiday and don’t want to take a pile of books.Kindle is sl light and compact and thin.  It tells you the page you are on and the percentage of the book you have left. Plus how many minutes until the end of the chapter.You can read easily in bright light or darkness. Touch the right of the page and the next turns. Touch the left side to go back. Thousands of books are free on Amazon to download. I’m delighted with it.

Name: Sandra Jones
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2020
Review Content: I bought my first Kindle when they first came out. My second one has over 400 books on it I decided to buy a third  and leave my 400 books on my second kindle,  it would have to be a big bookcase to store all of these. When I want a new book to read on holiday or on a train I just down load a sample to see if I like the Author and in minuets its ready to read. I would recommend the kindle to all.

Name: Mop
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 June 2019
Review Content: I use the kindle mainly for holidays when it is so much more practical, but after a 3 week holiday using my (very) old basic edition, when it was getting quite difficult to manually 'turn' the pages, I sent for this one.  What bliss !!  So much easier to use, only slight quibble is that the touch screen sometimes has a mind of its own, but the old turn it off and on again always solves the problem. Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2018
Review Content: Unfortunately, my old Kindle paperwhite developed a small crack on the screen, allowing the back-light to seep through so I reluctantly decided to replace it. I was unable to replace it with the same model as the 10th gen has been released but it promised a better display and other benefits.As promised, the 10th generation paperwhite is lighter but ever so slightly smaller (meaning my previous case is now too big). The screen also seems smoother and less 'grainy' to touch.Unfortunately though, the screen colour appears less like a book and has more of a 'fake' light. Additionally, upon turning pages, there seems to be a shadow from the previous page- especially on the home screen, library and in the store. At times, the reaction speed from touch to page turn etc seems very delayed whereas at others it is too responsive. Finally, unlike previously, I purchased the Kindle with offers as I like to see recommended books etc, but this too is very annoying. It is not as simple as 'swipe to unlock' but will often take you to the offer, whether you want to or not.In all, I am very disappointed with the 10th generation Kindle to the point where I am considering putting it back in the box and using my old one.

Name: Ms. Wk Kelsall
