Name: Wrennables
Review Title: Great, but kids can't use the audiobook feature
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 May 2019
Review Content: Generally very happy with this. I bought it for my son. I have the older paperwhite and love it, and since this one also does audiobooks (via bluetooth headset) I thought it would be perfect for my son. I was a bit disappointed though to find that the audiobook feature doesn't work if you have parental controls on. I didn't expect this as there is no problem using audiobooks alongside parental controls on a Fire Tablet. I'd rather not have my son using a tablet in bed so I've just had to leave the parental controls off. It's disappointing that this wasn't stated in the description, but I'd still have bought it if I'd known.Audiobooks drain the battery a bit, as you might expect, but it still does several evenings of audiobooks off a single charge. And if you're just using it for reading then it lasts for ages.I use it with the light set really low - around 3 or 4 on the scale. It's plenty bright enough in the dark, and the light isn't necessary when it's not dark around, so I'm not sure why they recommend the brighter settings.Kid mode (parental control) is handy if you're not bothered about the audiobooks - you can set up a child's profile and choose which books in your library they can access.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 April 2020
Review Content: Yes, ladies and gentlemen, for £130 pounds, you too can have the pleasure of bring a last century relic into your own homes.In no particular order:* Does not support Amazon Two-Step authentication.Yes, you read correctly... the brand new 10th generation Paperwhite, waterproof kindle, cannot login to an amazon account with security enabled...* Support team are behind the times. Why not waste 1 hour with a team trying to get login working.Here's a time-saver for you, you have to try to login with your amazon account+password, then restart the device, then login again with the amazon account and use the OTP code sent to your phone as the password.Really intuitive I sure you won't agree.But first you'll need to manually download firmware upgrades and apply them yourself ('m not joking...)* Doesn't support a 5GHz wifi network (feel free to name another piece of tech which doesn't, I can't...)* screen is glacially slow to respond to taps. Picture a kids toy you bought in a Dollar Store in the 80's* comes with last gen usb to micro usb cable (sigh...)Overall, it's a barely functional effort from amazon, being sold to maximise profit.Worst experience you'll have with a piece of technology I can guarantee.My advice, Look Elsewhere....

Name: Matt852
Review Title: A small step backwards on my last Kindle
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 December 2020
Review Content: I have been using kindle for years and this kindle does the job in the same way as all the others and the reading experience is great.For the first time however this kindle doesn’t feel like an improvement on my previous kindle voyager. The two issues are:1 the battery life seems to be worse than before, specifically I have resorted to turning airplane mode on most of the time and only turning on wifi when I’m expecting a book to be downloaded. If left on I’m definitely getting only days use rather than the weeks use I used to enjoy on the voyager.2: A second niggle is the power button. On the voyager it was on the back and recessed, it was impossible to accidentally power the device off. On the new device is on the bottom and when I hold the device whilst reading occasionally I knock the button and turn off the device. It doesn’t happen all the time just occasionally but it’s annoying that Amazon have taken this retrograde step.Apart from this I love  the device.

Name: Athena53
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 August 2020
Review Content: This is my third Kindle and as time goes on the improvements make the reading experience better. The first one's screen was damaged when I stood on it, and the second accidently got into the washing machine! (It did dry out and continue to work but a bit sluggishly). So I was delighted to find my new one is waterproof! Downloading into my downloads took a while as I have 400+ books on it, but we're there now. I also like the instant wake-up with the new cover.

Name: Rich
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2019
Review Content: This is my first ever kindle so I don’t really have anything to measure it against. I’d been speaking to a friend about how I liked to read etc but sometimes when going away I had to decide which books to take with me as too many took up too much weight & room. He recommended a kindle.I was unsure. I like the feel of a book & silly as it sounds, the smell! I like to hold a book and know I’m reading it.I took the plunge on prime day to follow his recommendation.First thought, crikey that’s light!Charged it up, powered on & signed into my amazon.First thing that I really noticed was the screen flicker when I swiped on the screen. It felt like I was using a really old tablet which didn’t have the memory capacity to keep up with me swiping. I now understand I was wrongly comparing it to the use of a tablet when this is what it is, a portable book reader & storage.Signed up to free trial of kindle unlimited and started reading. Since then I haven’t really put it down. I’d say I’m reading more than I was before and it’s so easy on the eyes when reading in bed without the light on.My initial reservations were guided by a false expectation after being used to swiping and reading stuff on my Samsung Tablet. This is a far better reading experience than trying to read a book through the kindle app on the tablet though.If you understand it’s use and what it’s for then you will come to enjoy using it. I am still within the period where I can send it back if I wish but I wouldn’t be without it now so it’s here to stay.

Name: Jill Dunne
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2019
Review Content: This is my third kindle and I asked my husband for the waterproof one for my birthday. On the whole it is great, a lot lighter to hold and more responsive. It said it holds a charge for longer but I seem to be charging it once a week. I think this may have something to do with the adverts they post when on screensaver. I find the adverts really annoying and it takes longer to wake up and you have to swipe the screen to read instead of it going straight to your page. So overall it is okay and other than it being waterproof not much has changed. I would really like to be able to get rid of he adverts.

Name: Karo Son
Review Title: Not worth upgrading unless you have specific reasons
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 December 2018
Review Content: --I bought it as it was advertised as slimmer and lighter; AND you can listen to audio books.Much to my surprise it certainly doesn't feel lighter or slimmer.That was annoying enough. Amazon think we're all daft, I suppose.Now, as for the audio book, oddly enough you can't read and listen to an audio book. I realise not a lot of people read and listen at same time. I do that because I'm a logophile. But also millions of people learn English around the world.How difficult was this tiny software change to make something a lot more useful?!

Name: Dante Fantinel
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 April 2020
Review Content: Never had a kindle before and it definitely changed my life!Amazing product, would definitely suggest to all those readers that take public transports or have long commutes to work.. Definitely easier to carry this than a heavy 500pages book!Light doesn't bother your eyes, even after hrs of reading, and can be regulated easily.Chose it because it was also waterproof and it didn't let me down!! When my water bottle opened in my backpack I juste wiped it up and it was ready to go!Only thing I didn't like is the on/off button on the bottom of the kindle, exactly where it tend to hold it, so it happened more than once that I mistakenly turned it off while I was reading

Name: J. Ali
Review Title: Must have for the modern reader
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 December 2019
Review Content: - I found that the light hurts my eyes so I do turn it down.- The touch screen is pretty good, again took a bit of getting used to.I haven't read the instructions but I am working it out.- Not sure that the battery life is as advertised.I read a lot for work so this has saved me so much space and time, already. All in all, despite the highlighted negative points I would recommend anyone to get a kindle. I love books but I just don't have space for the amount of reference books I read!

Name: Linda findlay
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2018
Review Content: I don't no what it's like it was bought for Christmas preasent but it must be ok

Name: cjmp.41
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 June 2019
Review Content: I have purchased 7 versions of Kindle and decided to purchase the latest version as better battery life etc.WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. Fully charged Kindle, used on and off over  3 days say for about 1 hour at a time and within 36 hours battery was down to 50%. By mid day on 3rd day battery down to zero.. What is this about battery now lasts weeks not hours.Also colour is not white, but verging on cream. The screen is not as white as on my existing version which I have had for 2 years. Not as easy to read as previous version.Still  no facility for those who like to hold in left hand. Need to use both hands to change page. Hold in right hand and only small movement of thumb changes page. Earlier versions had facility to hold in ether hand.I feel I have wasted £119.Not something I would recommend.

Name: J. Prowse
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 December 2019
Review Content: I was really looking forward to receiving my kindle paperwhite. Unfortunately, it hasn't lived up to my expectations and I wish I had spent the money on an Amazon fire tablet instead. The battery doesn't hold its charge as advertised, possibly because it keeps switching itself on. I frequently go to pick it up from where I left it switched off, to find it on and displaying one of the book advertisements. The longest I have managed without recharging is 48 hours. When it comes to switching it off 9 times out of 10 it flicks to an advert instead of giving me the option to switch off, so I have to swipe back in and try again. Simple enough but frustrating. I find the library list a bit cumbersome to use, there must be a slicker way to display the books. My biggest problem with it however, is that it doesn't display magazines properly, making them near impossible to read and enjoy. So, I end up having to take my old tablet out with me in case I want to read a magazine. Altogether a bit disappointing.

Name: K. A. Earley
Review Title: You can read this kindle without a room light on.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2019
Review Content: I love my new kindle paperwhite. I always loved my kindle keyboard but the paperwhite suits me better now. I can read with the backlight without disturbing my husband. Also, its waterproof, so I am relaxed reading around the pool on holiday. I like that you can easily alter the size of the font and the touch screen is great as I'm so used to touch screens (iPads and phones etc). Its so light and easy to turn pages. Also , I registered it to the same account as my old kindle and everything transferred over effortlessly.

Name: Edward W
Review Title: Not as good as I had hoped
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2020
Review Content: Hoped e-ink would be superior to a tablet but it's really not. It's easier on the eyes, but terrible black contrast makes mangas and comics appear faded, with blacks all just a mushy grey.Interface is slow and frustrating, and the battery life isn't that great as it drains when you are not using it so you can't just leave it sat there for a few weeks and expect it to power up.If you have a nice tablet, I really can't recommend a kindle.

Name: L. Dean
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 August 2020
Review Content: This is my third kindle and its so much better than I have had before. The touchscreen is so much more responsive and reading is much easier on the eyes. I was glad to pay the extra £10 to get no special offers which is only advertising and a months free trial of Prime. When you set it up, you cannot continue without the Prime trial, which I found annoying. I had to go onto my account to stop it from rolling over. Other than that, its a great piece if kit.

Name: PMP13
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 January 2020
Review Content: I have resisted getting a kindle as I don't think you can beat the look, smell and feel of a new book, but having been given one as a christmas present, i do kind of like it, especially for reading on the move, i don't think it will replace by book reading, but will be useful for extra reading on holiday and travelling without the bulk of carrying a number of books.  it is lightweight, no glare on the screen, which is issue i had with my iPad, and clear and easy to read, los if individual setting to customise

Name: repj
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2019
Review Content: Good for reading e-books with bigger screen and better battery life than my android phone that I used previously with the kindle app. Had hoped to read newspapers on the paperwhite as well but have to purchase these from Amazon, we already have a newspaper subscription but have found that you can't download this app or log-in online using the kindle which is a great shame, don't want to pay for papers twice! Using the internet is possible but inferior as the display is tiny and doesn't utilise the e-ink technology so isn't as sharp.

Name: Val
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2020
Review Content: I recently bought a Kindle paper white, having had a kindle fire for several years. I am really disappointed with it. I find the brightness very 'white' or dim, depending on how bright it is turned to.I haven't used it in the sunshine yet, so maybe I will change my mind on that.I thought I would be able to use the internet easily as with the kindle fire, but it's a right fight on to get onto the internet with the paper white. Not easy to use at all.Basically it is only any good for reading in the sunshine, so it has been put away for using on holiday.

Name: Jeff Granger
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 April 2019
Review Content: This is my first e-reader. It works. It's like a computer from the 1980s. The page changes aren't especially crisp. Thought it might have a page-change animation, but no. It's easy to accidentally change a page. I like the link to Wikipedia for words that need explaining. It's easy to buy books from Amazon but not so easy to work out how to get the free ones each month they advertise. First battery charge has lasted a couple of weeks now (at 50%). It works, but there's nothing about it to make you smile.

Name: kiwidude
Review Title: Great - except for the power switch placement
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2019
Review Content: Long term fan of the Kindle series - previously owned a Kindle Keyboard and Kindle Voyage (best model ever, sad it was discontinued). However while the Paperwhite has some improvements (white on black for reading is phenomenal to reduce eye strain, particularly at night but I use it all the time) there are definitely some steps backwards like slightly lower quality of readability without the glass screen of the Voyage.Whoever designed this Paperwhite model physical layout needs to be kicked. The power switch is a protruding button located at the *bottom* of the device. Which means for anyone holding the kindle in their left hand using their pinkie finger to rest the base of the kindle on, you are constantly in danger of accidentally turning it off. Or at best dealing with an uncomfortable switch against your skin. In addition if you decide to prop your kindle up vertically against something (e.g. while reading at lunch), the button will all too simply switch your Kindle off as you place it on your desk. What the hell were Amazon thinking??? Put the damn button at the top of the device out of the way where it belongs like previous Kindle models had and most phones have done...Most other features of the Paperwhite in terms of day to day use for reading are excellent. While I love the "white on black" mode, it does take 7 touches on the screen to toggle this reading mode hence I leave it on this all the time. Please sort out your firmware Amazon, make this a simple first class setting like changing fonts and sizes are! I also miss the page turn buttons of the Voyage when it comes to navigating through the list of books or moving past a hyperlinked tbale of contents page - sometimes there are not many places left on the screen where you can safely touch/swipe. Far too many times I have accidentally opened the wrong book or leaped far into a book from a contents hyperlink when just wanting to get to the next page.All that said my Paperwhite goes everywhere with me (as did all Kindles I had before now) to let me read anywhere and on the go as it fits comfortably enough in a pocket. The latest Oasis model is tempting - physical buttons would remove one of my gripes. However it is also a larger size which may no longer fit in most pockets which would be a dealbreaker alone. Obviously more expensive and is heavier to hold in the hand. Since I prefer to read holding the Kindle in my left hand I also have some fears about the power button location on the Oasis too. The way they managed to place it on the Voyage was brilliant...

Name: Rohit Gogna
Review Title: I've started reading a lot more
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 February 2020
Review Content: I have an iPad mini - so I was hesitant in making this purchase.  However, it's a different experience reading on a kindle.  It's lighter and specifically made for one job, so has no distractions.  It doesn't feel you are reading on a computer screen which it does with the iPad mini (and this is coming from an Apple fanboy).  I brought the no special offers version as I don't want adverts.I've voted it to 4 stars overall for this reason.  As it feels like a cheeky tactic from Amazon.  However the product it self is 5 star.  Don't hesitate, see it as something that will help you learn.

Name: Spot Check
Review Title: Easy on the eye and handy size.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 December 2019
Review Content: I bought this as an upgrade to my 'standard' Kindle, which was a few years old and had stopped being able to find the internet (and so was useless).  My new one is very easy to use, the touchscreen navigation is intuitive, and it is easy to hold and read.  My only surprise was that books do not automatically fully download straight away.  You get a thumbnail only initially.  You then have to download from there.  This isn't a problem once you know it, but it's important to know if you wanted to start reading when remote from the internet.  Overall, I expect to use this much more than my previous one, and Kindle will be first choice for all my reading matter in the future.

Name: Valentino
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 April 2020
Review Content: Ideal for travelling. Has adjustable background light, useful for me as I sometimes read in the dark. It’s very lightweight. I do recommend buying a leather cover for it. The big let down is the touch screen. It sometimes skips 5 or 10 pages when you try to turn the page and it’s a nightmare getting back to where you left off. Would have liked a slightly bigger screen. It is expensive for what it is but as I am an avid reader, money well spent.

Name: ga sue
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 October 2020
Review Content: Nice to hold but a lot to learn.  I had the Kindle App on my ipad for a number of years and found this easier for nstance to click in the book mark and remove the book mark.  Good that there is a book included on how to use the Kindle paperwhite but I read about keeping Collections and haven't fathomed that out yet.  Have yet to order and download a new book...that should be interesting.  Having said all that it is nice and light and easy to read.

Name: K. Gough
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 July 2020
Review Content: As my old kindle is about 10 years old and during lockdown finding it difficult to buy reasonably priced books, I dug out  the kindle,,and then thought maybe I should think about replacing it. After asking advice from other people via a book club I decided to make my purchase. I’m really impressed, and yes I love books but have to admit this is so much easier. It’s light, easy to use , love the fact no buttons on the side to turn a page just swipe.

Name: Bigbaddom
Review Title: Almost perfect but it switches itself off too easily.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 February 2020
Review Content: Everything good about the Paperwhite has already be written and I would agree with all, good lighting, good battery, etc... however one design fault prevents me for giving it five stars: when holding it with one hand in an L shape position, you can very often switch it off involuntary. Not the end of the world in the scheme of things but Amazon could and should do better.Allegedly there is new Kindle Pw coming in 2021, I hope the designers will move this button away from where it is located at the moment.  How about at the top on the right ?

Name: Family of Four
Review Title: If you are wavering, just go for it as you probably will not be disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 November 2019
Review Content: Perfect for the avid reader.  I’d avoided a kindle for years having preferred the feel of a real book.  In the end I succumbed and bought whilst on offer  to save lugging several books away on a holiday and now regret putting my purchase off for so long.Have to save the advert on the screen saver doesn’t bother me - certainly not enough to splash out £10 to remove it.Enjoying both the written word and audible books too.If you are undecided and are wavering, I would say just go for it.Incidentally I splashed out and treated myself to the twilight blue Amazon leather case too and they look beautiful together.  Saved me having to spend time finding a compatible case with that ‘perfect’ fit.

Name: K Mussell
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 July 2020
Review Content: With libraries being closed due to lockdown, I reluctantly dug out my very old Kindle.  Having downloaded a few books and started to get used to an e-reader again I spoke with a few friends who highly recommended the updated Paperwhite.  I love it!  Very quick to open from standby mode, easy to use, and a comfortable size and weight in my small hands.  I love that it is waterproof and that it has a dark mode (very handy for nights plagued by insomnia), and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone, especially with the added benefits of Audible integration (and all the features which come with a Prime account if you have one).  I will always truly love real paper books, but for convenience and ease of use the Paperwhite is hard to beat.

Name: klw
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 May 2019
Review Content: Compared to the original Kindle, which I have been using happily for several years, the new one is much lighter and more compact, easier to carry around and use and with a greatly extended battery life. The only area which is less than totally satisfactory is the touch screen, which does not always respond immediately. In some ways, the older method of changing pages by pressing a button on the side of the Kindle was easier, quicker and more intuitive. However, I have been very satisfied with the old one and I am sure I shall be equally satisfied with the new one, so I am giving it five stars.

Name: ck
Review Title: Not as intuitive as I’d hoped
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 July 2020
Review Content: Got this kindle to replace a very old one.  Wanted the built in light which works really well, however, it seems to have lost some of the features I really relied on on my old kindle such as synchronising between the kindle app on my iPad and the kindle itself so I could swap between them seamlessly.  Also seems to lose the book I’m currently on when I browse elsewhere.  When I’m reading it’s easy to manage but as yet, I’m not entirely happy with the functions

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 August 2019
Review Content: I have been putting of buying a kindle for years now. However I finally decided to take the plunge with the kindle paperwhite because A) it was amazon prime day, so it was much cheaper than usual and B) because it’s waterproof - I’ve no idea why that mattered to me but it was a cool selling point above the others types of ebook reader.When it arrived I immediately went to work adding it to Wifi and downloading a few books. I discovered I could read my kindle in daylight, direct sunlight and in a pitch black room as well as (and this part really is amazing) I could resize the txt and change the font! This meant I could read my kindle without my glasses.... because of this, I’ve managed to read several books since it arrived and In fact I’ve read more books this last month than I have in the last 10 years due to not having to struggle to read the text anymore. I’ve kindle really is one of the very best things I’ve ever purchased.

Name: Readers Together
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 October 2019
Review Content: This is by far the best Kindle I've ever had. I love the storage capacity. I love that it's waterproof so don't have to worry about it getting wet at the side of the pool, or if accidentally dropped in the bath. It's so easy to use and responses to touch well. Having the audio aspect is amazing, I love that I can listen to my audiobooks via the Kindle now, the only downside is that there isn't a headphone jack so you need to use Bluetooth headphones - which of course, is why it's waterproof - it would be nice if there was an option.

Name: shawn green
Review Title: Best invention since the light bulb......?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 July 2020
Review Content: .....ok, might be pushing it a little, however, this is immense. I had a 1st generation kindle (thats sill going) and it was awesome, but the lack of a back light and the fact i wanted something new meant an upgrade.Its amazing, and I love it. Back light is about perfect, is adjustable and is easy on the eye. Battery life is just ridiculously good, it feels amazing and comfortable in the hand. It has a good weight (as did the gen1) and feels solid. Its had a good spray from the shower when i left it on the side, a quick wipe and its good to go. As always, the kindle store is amazingly easy to use and navigate, and downloads are almost instant.Could this be improved? Nope, as a stand alone reader (which is all i want it for) its perfect. I did consider getting the Kindle fire, but didnt want the distraction of surfing the web.As a tip, grab the authentic kindle paper white waterproof case. The cheaper ones look and fit great, but even after 2 weeks looked a little worn, and aren't splash proof, as after wiping they stay damp.

Name: CatW
Review Title: A great update if you love Audible!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 July 2019
Review Content: I've had an older kindle paperwhite for years and it is still going strong, so I hadn't contemplated changing it until I saw this edition included audible.I love audible books and was previously listening on my smartphone in the app. However, having both the book and the audible copy downloaded on the new kindle means that they sync with each other whenever I need to swap to headphones and back so I never lose my position. The only issue is that the audible files take a few minutes to download to the kindle due to their size.I do miss the beveled screen as I found it easier to grip, and I find this screen seems to get more greasy finger marks more easily, but overall I'm very happy with it.

Name: Trace Smith-mcquillan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 March 2021
Review Content: I bought this as my last kindle only lasted an evening then battery ran out...looked fir best model at 159 and battery use, didn’t  read the small print which said use for thirty min a day and last weeks.  Feel ripped off as who uses reads for thirty min once a day.  I bough on initial description which says lasts for weeks.  It obviously doesn’t.  I use every day fir a few hours so lasts only a few days......on one charge so disappointed .

Name: Dara C
Review Title: Really like this product would be better with buttons instead of touchscreen
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 May 2020
Review Content: I really liked this kindle it's lightweight  The text is clear the light is good for reading in the dark The only issue I have with this product is the touchscreen but that might be a personal issue as I have a physical disability with this  in mind though if you had the same product with buttons instead of the touchscreen  I would recommend this to everyone although I think the newer models might already have some of these features unfortunately too expensive  for me

Name: Darren Hucker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 August 2020
Review Content: After lots of doubts of changing the habit of reading a good book on paper and the feel of turning the pages and where you are in the story I can’t believe the freedom the kindle offers. No heavy books to carry around. No panic of how many books I take with me on holiday and the anxiety of pacing my reading to ensure I don’t finish them too quick. Had it 2 weeks and read 2 big books already. No need to worry about lighting great to read before bed with lights out. No misplaced bookmarks and % count to know how far your through and only needed a minimal charge in 2 weeks. Plus the saving of ebooks will eventually pay for itself and no cluttering of books around your house. Wish I bought it years ago.

Name: Jemima
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2018
Review Content: I read one book very happily.  Part way through the second I am now unable to switch the Paperwhite on.  It permanently says "WAKING UP", and shows a very blurry picture which I think is about monthly deals.  Nothing I do makes anything further happen.  It does not require charging.  Any suggestions please?

Name: Mary
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 October 2020
Review Content: You basically can't beat a kindle.I tried to use another device with the Kindle app but was awkward to hold, the light was glaring and the battery drained quickly.With the Kindle it's light, ergonomic and the battery lasts for ages. I much prefer reading from the screen.I bought the Amazon Kindle case and that has not made the reading experience worse. It folds back on itself nicely and has a slightly magnetic catch when open so the Kindle remains easy to read.Cannot recommend enough.

Name: Carol
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 March 2019
Review Content: Really glad I bought it!  Small enough to take anywhere, backlight is easily adjusted, and turned off when light not required .the battery does last really well, obviously it depends how much it’s used,but it charges quickly too. I bought a cover for it whichworks well.  It was easily set up too.I’ve struggled a little with  some things particularly searching the library, I wish the books appeared a little clearer ( in colour would be even better!) as I tend to remember books by their covers.  I’m sure I’ll work out where I’m going wrong eventually! Overall I am really pleased with my choice and would recommend it.

Name: shawn green
Review Title: Best invention since the light bulb......?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 July 2020
Review Content: .....ok, might be pushing it a little, however, this is immense. I had a 1st generation kindle (thats sill going) and it was awesome, but the lack of a back light and the fact i wanted something new meant an upgrade.Its amazing, and I love it. Back light is about perfect, is adjustable and is easy on the eye. Battery life is just ridiculously good, it feels amazing and comfortable in the hand. It has a good weight (as did the gen1) and feels solid. Its had a good spray from the shower when i left it on the side, a quick wipe and its good to go. As always, the kindle store is amazingly easy to use and navigate, and downloads are almost instant.Could this be improved? Nope, as a stand alone reader (which is all i want it for) its perfect. I did consider getting the Kindle fire, but didnt want the distraction of surfing the web.As a tip, grab the authentic kindle paper white waterproof case. The cheaper ones look and fit great, but even after 2 weeks looked a little worn, and aren't splash proof, as after wiping they stay damp.

Name: CatW
Review Title: A great update if you love Audible!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 July 2019
Review Content: I've had an older kindle paperwhite for years and it is still going strong, so I hadn't contemplated changing it until I saw this edition included audible.I love audible books and was previously listening on my smartphone in the app. However, having both the book and the audible copy downloaded on the new kindle means that they sync with each other whenever I need to swap to headphones and back so I never lose my position. The only issue is that the audible files take a few minutes to download to the kindle due to their size.I do miss the beveled screen as I found it easier to grip, and I find this screen seems to get more greasy finger marks more easily, but overall I'm very happy with it.

Name: Trace Smith-mcquillan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 March 2021
Review Content: I bought this as my last kindle only lasted an evening then battery ran out...looked fir best model at 159 and battery use, didn’t  read the small print which said use for thirty min a day and last weeks.  Feel ripped off as who uses reads for thirty min once a day.  I bough on initial description which says lasts for weeks.  It obviously doesn’t.  I use every day fir a few hours so lasts only a few days......on one charge so disappointed .

Name: Dara C
Review Title: Really like this product would be better with buttons instead of touchscreen
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 May 2020
Review Content: I really liked this kindle it's lightweight  The text is clear the light is good for reading in the dark The only issue I have with this product is the touchscreen but that might be a personal issue as I have a physical disability with this  in mind though if you had the same product with buttons instead of the touchscreen  I would recommend this to everyone although I think the newer models might already have some of these features unfortunately too expensive  for me

Name: Darren Hucker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 August 2020
Review Content: After lots of doubts of changing the habit of reading a good book on paper and the feel of turning the pages and where you are in the story I can’t believe the freedom the kindle offers. No heavy books to carry around. No panic of how many books I take with me on holiday and the anxiety of pacing my reading to ensure I don’t finish them too quick. Had it 2 weeks and read 2 big books already. No need to worry about lighting great to read before bed with lights out. No misplaced bookmarks and % count to know how far your through and only needed a minimal charge in 2 weeks. Plus the saving of ebooks will eventually pay for itself and no cluttering of books around your house. Wish I bought it years ago.

Name: Jemima
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2018
Review Content: I read one book very happily.  Part way through the second I am now unable to switch the Paperwhite on.  It permanently says "WAKING UP", and shows a very blurry picture which I think is about monthly deals.  Nothing I do makes anything further happen.  It does not require charging.  Any suggestions please?

Name: Mary
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 October 2020
Review Content: You basically can't beat a kindle.I tried to use another device with the Kindle app but was awkward to hold, the light was glaring and the battery drained quickly.With the Kindle it's light, ergonomic and the battery lasts for ages. I much prefer reading from the screen.I bought the Amazon Kindle case and that has not made the reading experience worse. It folds back on itself nicely and has a slightly magnetic catch when open so the Kindle remains easy to read.Cannot recommend enough.

Name: Carol
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 March 2019
Review Content: Really glad I bought it!  Small enough to take anywhere, backlight is easily adjusted, and turned off when light not required .the battery does last really well, obviously it depends how much it’s used,but it charges quickly too. I bought a cover for it whichworks well.  It was easily set up too.I’ve struggled a little with  some things particularly searching the library, I wish the books appeared a little clearer ( in colour would be even better!) as I tend to remember books by their covers.  I’m sure I’ll work out where I’m going wrong eventually! Overall I am really pleased with my choice and would recommend it.

Name: Esam Zainal
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 November 2020
Review Content: I had several Kindle models before, and I found this one incrementally better than the previous model in all aspects: the display contrast is slightly better, it's lighter, and for the same screen size the device size is a bit smaller. It's very comfortable for holding for a long time. However, there is one irritating problem: the power button is so soft, and is sticking out, and is at the bottom!! So when I recline the device on a surface (e.g. table, counter, in airplane, etc.) to free my hands, it very easily switches off! It's so annoying! Sometimes, with a longer inadvertent press, it does a device reset and then I have to wait for a couple of minutes! So unthought of. Why couldn't they put the power button at the top? Then you wouldn't have this problem, and it's more natural too. The older models didn't have this problem (although their buttons were at the bottom too). So at the end I got myself a cutting blade and shaved off the portion of the button that is sticking out, and made it flush with the device case. Problem is now solved!

Name: Mrs. Joanna Miller
Review Title: Disappointed I didn’t research the features before purchasing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 July 2019
Review Content: I didn’t research the product when I decided to replace my old Kindle Fire which was having battery charging issues. Initially I was happy with the size and the lightweight of it. I don’t like the layout of the display of books that I have. I preferred the swipe screen on the Kindle Fire to the touch screen to turn page. Then I realised that the Paperwhite is completely monochrome. I preferred colour on  my book covers. I get frustrated with the bookmark feature, having to hit the + or - rather than just tapping the bookmark on and off.I didn’t realise it is just a book reader and that I can’t add apps or access the internet. All in all, it’s ok as a reader but not if you want other features.

Name: MadMax
Review Title: Great new generation but problem with Bluetooth connection for audible books.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2019
Review Content: Always had Paper White as my way to read. Wanted to listen to Audio books especially while on the plain or train so upgraded to the latest model. Great screen and battery life but they have introduced a software bug in one of the updates that makes the Bluetooth stop working or loose it's connection. So if you are going to buy one hold fire or if you have one that appears to be faulty it's not do not listen to their BS they know it's a known problem that they still have not fixed. Swapping out the unit or resetting it will not solve the problem.

Name: veronica lewis
Review Title: Great buy to replace my original kindle.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2019
Review Content: I got this to update my kindle as I have an original one. It's perfect after many yrs of not being able to use my old one due to my deteriorating eyesight with the help of the back light I have started reading again and it's wonderful. I have always loved to read in fact it's always been an obsession so I'm very happy with my purchase it's my Christmas present to myself and the fact that I get to only pay £19 a month for 5 months was a bonus as I'm disabled and live on a limited budget. So am exceedingly happy all round.

Name: wendy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 August 2020
Review Content: I bought this to replace my 10 year old Kindle (with keyboard) which eventually gave up on me.  This is a great choice for me, the bonus of having an adjustable backlight is great.  It is smaller than my last one and much lighter, this will fit in my handbag much easier.  I was able to log in to my account and all my books transferred onto my new kindle and the exact book i was reading - what a relief.Would definitely recommend this kindle.

Name: Lucy S
Review Title: Stopped working after only a few uses
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 February 2021
Review Content: Unfortunately, at around 18mths old and after only a handful of uses, my Kindle touchscreen no longer works.  I have contacted Amazon, but unfortunately it is out of warranty which is a real shame.  Amazon help were not able to fix it with me over the chat so I am now left with an unusable Kindle which they believe has broken due to it not being updated with the latest software.  They have offered to trade it in which will give me a % towards a new Kindle, but at the price the Kindle Paperwhite is, I'd have expected to have more than a few uses of it before it stopped working for me, regardless of it being over a year old by a few months.

Name: Sikander
Review Title: Great product but check which version of paper white you're buying!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 March 2020
Review Content: I upgraded to this kindle because I liked the sound of it being waterproof and my old paper white had got pretty bashed around over time. The first thing I noticed was that the form factor is similar to before but a little bit slimmer and easier to hold – so far so good. However, as soon as I started using the device I was getting bombarded with advertising for stuff I'm never going to buy. I realise now that this is what the “with Special Offers” tag means in the product title – every time you switch the kindle off or on you get hit with annoying adverts on the sleep screen.It's really wasn't made clear before purchasing that if you buy this version you're signing up to getting spammed for the life of the product. Amazon, you need to fix this and communicate more clearly about it! If I'd known, I would've paid a bit extra to avoid this. You've made a previously very satisfied user really unhappy. As it is, my reading experience is so compromised I'm probably going back to my faithful old kindle with it's battered screen. The irony is,  I can't rate it higher than one star and apart from the spam, it's a good product…UPDATE – Amazon customer service contacted me within hours of writing this review and have removed the Special Offers, so no more adverts! Thanks Amazon, have adjusted the number of stars to reflect the product accordingly!

Name: lubilu
Review Title: Anywhere Access to your favourite books
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 January 2021
Review Content: Having used Kindle books for a long while now....albeit on a ( PC at first , then a 7 inch and later 10 inch Tablet ) the obvious- biggest disadvantage with ALL portable screens is their reflectiveness , making reading in any sunlight virtually impossible .All that was "fixed" by the proper e-book-ink - non-reflective  screen of this KINDLE device.  Retrospectively I wish I`d opted for a Kindle Paperwhite  SOOONER.....!

Name: jenny g
Review Title: Fantastic product and service by Amazon
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 April 2019
Review Content: what a fantastic gadget and one I thought I'd never get having always enjoyed books.  It is fantastic and has a big storage facility.  I'm looking forward to taking it away on my holidays this year.  So much easier than packing lots of books!  I did have a problem with the screen freezing on the first one I bought but Amazon couldn't have been more helpful.  After following various procedures and Amazon realising it wasn't just a temporary hiccup, I was immediately sent a new one and then returned the faulty one free of charge.  This one has been perfect and is full of books waiting for me to read.

Name: Ray Woodward
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 July 2020
Review Content: I've been a long time user of Kindles from the two pre-screen keyboard, and the joystick and paddle versions through to the earliest touchscreen model which has been solid and reliable for many many years. So what makes this Kindle worth the upgrade?The first is the Bluetooth Audio connection. Listening to audiobooks as well as reading has become almost daily routines with Audible making journeys as well as sitting at home playing music through headphones and Hi-Fi simple and easy.The second is that it's finally OK to read while relaxing in the bath without the risk of dosing off and… well you can guess the rest.The nicest part though is the usability. The interface feels more accurate and responsive. Previously I found the touchscreen mildly annoying with swipes on the main screen being mistaken for book selections (and vice versa) and menus being slow to respond to inputs. The new screen is very easy on the eye especially at night and the older model's screen seems greener than the comparatively pure white. It also performs better in both brightly lit and dark environments and infinitely less tiring on the eye than a laptop screen, opted for the 32GB model to accommodate my rather ridiculous number of books and audiobooks I like to have to hand: there are so many out-of-copyright non-DRM .mobi formatted classic Victorian and 20th Century books available that are a pleasure to enjoy alongside the simply huge number of Kindle formatted books to borrow and buy.AccessoriesI recommend getting a case (I went with a grey Amazon cloth covered waterproof case - the experience in terms of size and weight is that of a small-midsize paperback - with the added advantage it switches on when the cover is opened and it's firmly held shut and turns off when you close it (the magnets in the cover also keep the front cover firmly attached to the back of the case, and therefore out of the way, after it's open.I've stuck with Kindle from the outset and even though I have checked out competitors' products I've always found  the Kindle Paper-white to have a superior feel.There are two reasons that I don't give this Kindle a full 5 star rating. Firstly is their continued closed-market approach with incompatibility with pretty much anything but the proprietary format Kindle books and .mobi formatted (non-DRM) books, making it impossible to read even the open standard .epub format books widely available, or even directly loading PDF documents which verges on the ridiculous.The second issue is not choosing a form-factor and sticking to it. My older Kindles remain in use or have been donated to charities - I don't like the increased consumer waste resulting from tweaking the size and shape of Kindles resulting in the huge increase in associated wasted materials consumed with needing to buy new cases every time I buy a new device. That said the packaging is recyclable.I hope this helps you weigh up the pros and cons of buying this waterproof Kindle PaperWhite and associated cover. Overall it's a great device having the ability to take a literal library of books anywhere in something the size of a small paperback is something I use daily.

Name: Mrs. J. S. Harrold
Review Title: Slimmer and lighter but not as easy to navigate
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 March 2019
Review Content: I like the weight and size of the new kindle, it’s excellent for carrying about with me and the back light is a very good feature, better than the one included in the cover of my old kindle and to be honest if I’d never had a kindle before I would probably have rated it 5 stars.  I haven’t though as my old kindle was so much easier, quicker and better to navigate. All my books once read were filed in collections, by author,  (which incidentally haven’t successfully transferred to this new one) so my home page listed the collections followed by the books I’d yet to read (whether they were bought, prime reading or borrowed from the library) and any samples I might have.  On my new kindle all my books are there individually and I have to trawl through several hundred to try and find what I haven’t read or want to read. This is time consuming and extremely irritating especially when scrolling up I keep opening books I don’t want to and have to keep going back. It was a much simpler and quicker system (seconds rather than several frustrating minutes) on the old kindle and far less stressful. In fact I’ve been referring back to my old kindle to identify what I’m looking for and/or checking on contents and devices to see what I’ve most recently acquired.  This does outweigh the good but I will persevere as I love my kindle reading and do want to embrace this new lighter, slimmer model but I am disappointed that some of the changes certainly take away from the customer experience unfortunately probably in favour of cutting costs.

Name: Joy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 February 2020
Review Content: I'm a convert ! I've resisted e-readers for ages, preferring physical books.While I still love the feel and experience of a book, this is so convenient.It's easy to carry around, and fits more than enough books ( I bought the 8 GB).The screen is so easy on the eye, and you can take it literally anywhere !I had the Kindle app for a few years,  but it used to hurt my eyes after using it. That was another reason I didn't buy a Kindle.Brilliant !

Name: MRS D REID
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 February 2019
Review Content: I’m not necessarily knocking this e-reader but I’ve had 4 kindles previously. The original keyboard one, the basic side buttons one, a kindle fire and the original paper white. My husband bought me this as an upgrade to the previous kindle paper white. The only part that separates this from my other paper white is the waterproof part. The battery life is actually worse. The on/off button on the bottom means you actually knock it off whilst in the middle of reading.All in all if this is your first kindle you’ll probably love it. If you’re thinking of upgrading from the old paperwhite, just buy a waterproof case from Amazon.

Name: D. Eves
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2018
Review Content: As a frequent traveller this is a great device. Light and small to hold. The backlight is activated automatically which means I can now read at nigh on a sleeper train without the need to hold a book and wear a head torch. The additional of audiobooks is logical and the connection to WiFi and Bluetooth is easy. I spent the extra £10 to remove the special offers though these weren’t that intrusive. Battery time is excellent. Furthermore, I realise my reading has increased as the Kindle offers just two options to read or listen. This avoids the iPad issue of multiple app choices which can lend itself to drifting from one option to another without finishing anything.

Name: Patrick W
Review Title: Good device, but just over a year in, battery won't charge
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 April 2020
Review Content: I'd like to add another buyer-beware review in terms of product durability. The device itself is a good one, but shortly after a year of surprisingly quick decaying battery life, the device will no longer charge at all, rendering it useless. It would be cynical to point out this has happened just after replacement warranty ran out, but the battery life has been getting shorter and shorter almost from purchase. If you're thinking about buying one, be aware you might need to buy another one a lot sooner than you'd like.

Name: val
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2018
Review Content: Slightly smaller than my last one so I had to purchase a new cover. I have had a few issues with the page changes, sometimes I need to tap more than once to go to next page, on occasion this has resulted in multiple pages being turned and I have had to search for the page I was reading. I will be monitoring this issue and contacting Amazon if it happens more often.

Name: Sooo
Review Title: Very easy to read and use any time of day - love it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 November 2019
Review Content: I'll still read paper books, but love this Kindle.. Very easy to read and use and very light.  Can read on lower light when needed so you're not disturbing anyone if you are a late night/ early morning reader.  Love the dictionary option - quick check into a thesaurus or dictionary for any more obscure words the author may have used.Has been great to be able to share books and browse new ones.  Love it!Can also recommend buying an auto switch off case - just flip the cover over to use or close your 'book'

Name: Prooro
Review Title: No headphone socket but great to read in the sun...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 July 2019
Review Content: Brilliant to sit in the sun and read with but for the money I felt the overall quality wasn’t as good as I’d expected. Very slow and interface feels old fashioned compared to a phone but it does what I bought it for well ie sit and read outdoors without any glare. Unfortunately it doesn’t have a socket for headphones so although it promotes itself on being able to access Audible it only does it through Bluetooth and I don’t have any Bluetooth headphones to pair with. It is easy to hold but I bought a cover which acts as a stand so I don’t even have to hold it.

Name: angela
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 October 2020
Review Content: It stopped working after 6 months so had to be replaced by currys shop where I purchased if from....hopefully 2and one will last longer.It wasnt used much either, the battery sign was empty and massive exclamation mark on screen... in googling it...said battery not engaging with kindle....

Name: Eddie Bates
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 October 2020
Review Content: I am very pleased with this purchase.  I have always enjoyed reading books of all sorts of genres, and with the kindle, I am now able to access any book I require almost at the touch of a button.  I am able to adjust the font, brightness, layout, etc to whatever is required at the time and, all in all, the convenience and adaptability of the kindle outweighs the feel and look of an actual book.  The kindle is a quality item and good value for money.

Name: Teresa Alliband
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 November 2018
Review Content: Having had my lovely kindle with keyboard for many years, the screen broke when abroad recently I decided to get the new paper white. It is nice and compact and lovely to be able to read anywhere as it has the light option but a big drawback is that it does not have the option to change the page colour to sepia, which is what I normally have my devices with backlights set to, which is less harsh on the eye. This is disappointing as it does state you can change the colour of the page but this only has the option to change to black with white writing.

Name: elaine page
Review Title: small screen, have to turn page to much
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 May 2020
Review Content: Bought this to replace my old kindle which I'd had for years, wish I had taken more time in choosing a replacement, this feels really flimsy and cheap, also its my own fault but wish I hadent bought a 6 inch one, seems hardly any story on the page before you have to turn over, and turning the page is a hit and miss affair, with hindsight wish as soon as I'd received this kindle I had sent it straight back, for someone having their first kindle I guess it may be fine, or for a child would probably be good because it's really light, though to me it feels cheap and plastic like, and I do not like the home page layout, not conceise like my old one even though I paid the extra for no specialsAll in all so wish I had not purchased this kindle, and bought another kindle fire

Name: Jane Doe
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 November 2018
Review Content: In the first week of using it it crashed three times - garbled nonsense.  Fortunately it righted itself after restarting it each time and hasn't had a recurrence since - touch wood!  The main menu (listing books) is much lighter than my old version which is not so good for those with glasses and I am slightly annoyed over the fact that it seems necessary to tick each book as and when I read it - I know when I've read a book oddly enough.  Frankly I couldn't care a less about it being waterproof since I don't read it in the bath but I would like the ability to adjust it to my usage and if anyone knows how to alter the above two items I'd be most grateful.

Name: Tony S
Review Title: Great device that got me reading again!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2019
Review Content: So, before I review the paperwhite, I'll share the reason I purchased it.I was on holiday & as always, dusted off my original Kindle (the original type with the keyboard at the bottom) so I had something to read whilst away.I started & finished Ant Middleton's autobiography & then reverted back to Damon Hill's autobiography on my second week.It was during the second week that I accidentally leant on my Kindle when getting up form the subbed. Instant cracked screen & worse still, stuck at 75% read when I was on track to read the remainder of the book before going home.Try as I might to read the rest using my phone, the screen was just too shiny to read in the sunlight next toileting the pool.As soon as we got home, I ordered the Paperwhite now that I was back into reading after a long break.I ordered it & the next day was the proud owner of a new Paperwhite, along with the Amazon case for it.Soon, I was reunited with Damon Hill's autobiography & before long it was completed.Now I can't put it down!Love the touch screen which is surprisingly responsive. As per my old Kindle, I love that I can read it in direct sunlight, but now also with the added peace of mind that this one is waterproof.Only reason I haven't given it 5 stars is a personal thing where I wish I had purchased the non-advert version.Small niggle, but otherwise a great device.

Name: carb
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 April 2019
Review Content: I was rather disappointed with my kindle, because it is black and white it is difficult to see the the front of the book and read its title and you cannot zoom in to look closer. I was also hoping that it would put the unread books handy to find and read without scrolling through pages of other books to find the ones you haven’t read yet. Another disappointment was the fact that I cannot get any other applications on the device apart from kindle books. I got a high GB one in order to relieve my IPad of space from all reading material but it won’t support epub or pdf. Yes very disappointed.

Name: William R. Woods
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 July 2020
Review Content: I damaged my 1st kindle so this is a replacement. I don't think for somebody like me who doesn't always go for the latest model it is any better in fact I dislike the touch screen tho' my children tell me I'll get used to it. With the old one I could turn the page on or back from both sides of the screen which I found helpful. You can't on this one. I can sum up my feelings by saying that I will try & get the old one repaired.

Name: belle23
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2020
Review Content: I cannot recommend this paperwhite enough. I had the very 1st kindle released. It served me well till last year. I damaged the central vision in one eye. I found my original kindle too dark to read. I downloaded the kindle app onto my laptop. That was worse it was too bright so couldn't concentrate on the writing. So got my husband to buy me this for Christmas. Its amazing perfect brightness. Its so good I'm back to reading a book in 2 days. My eye doesn't get tired as it did. Cannot recommend this enough.

Name: Sue Gough
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 January 2020
Review Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle Paperwhite.  It was bought as a Christmas present for me from my husband. My old one was getting a bit slow as it was quite old.  The new Kindle is  lighter than my original Kindle Paperwhite which is a bonus when carrying it around with me.  This new version is much faster to charge and holds its charge longer.  The new flat screen is great.  I also love the fact that it's waterproof so I will not have to worry about it getting splashed with water, especially whilst on holiday.  There's a few modifications to the old version but I believe these are for the better. All in all a brilliant Kindle.

Name: joaidferg
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 June 2019
Review Content: I have been using an original Kindle for many years, as in the very first type. I thought it was time for a change so went to the latest Paperwhite (2018) version.  I have to say I am very pleased with it. Touch screen is just right for sensitivity, navigation is SO MUCH EASIER. Some people bemoan the absence of actual buttons to turn the page, why? the page turning by a touch or flick is perfect. The only thing I would point out is that if, like me, you have the illumination turned up quite high, it does use up battery fairly fast. but charging is very fast. Overall a big thumbs up.

Name: Lis
Review Title: Excellent for holiday reading in the sunshine
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 April 2019
Review Content: I have been using my kindle fire for holiday reading and listening, but found I could not see the screen in sunshine, so could not even access my audible stories, my old paper white kindle had worn out and did not support audible. So fed up when returned from holiday I ordered the new paper white which support audible, with blue tooth head phones I did my ironing in double time through listening to stories with no wires attached. I could even stay listening while putting it away. I have yet to try it in sunshine, but am sure it will perform just as well. If it does not I will be sure to report . Nice light item to put in handbag for holidays

Name: Kirsty
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 May 2020
Review Content: I bought this kindle back in December as a chrismtas present for my husband after his previous kindle stopped being able to be charged. After reading the reviews I thought I would be able to trust that with this new version we would encounter no problems. Only 5 months down the line and again the kindle will not charge and won't turn on. I have followed several tutorials online on how to fix and nothing has worked. I'm devastated particularly now being in isolation and not being able to use the kindle when it's been needed most. There is no clear way on how to return it or have a refund or who to contact on my amazon account. Very dissatisfied.

Name: vanessa foulkes
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 April 2020
Review Content: Love this so much. I was wondering if to get one or not  as I love reading a book, so decided I would try  . never looked back great item .. I struggle with the brightness of natural light or sunlight so always find it hard to read in sunlight but with this there’s no need to worry or struggle.. when in the sun it’s great no glare nothing. so light so can have it with your where ever you go..  Easy to useI love it I would definitely recommend

Name: T_London
Review Title: Does not allow you to retrieve highlights made in books not purchased through Amazon.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 April 2020
Review Content: I was happy with my kindle until I could not download the notes and highlights I made to a book simply because I did not purchase it directly from Amazon.I purchased three e-books from a publisher, downloaded them as Kindle content (mobi) and sent them to myself by email. So far, so good! I read one of the books, made annotations to it, etc. Then, when I tried to send the notes to myself, there was no option to do so. I then visited the 'read' webpage on Amazon and could not find the books. After much research, I saw that Amazon categorises them as 'docs' rather than 'books' and I could only seen them in the 'device and content' webpage. The problem with this categorisation is that you don't have the same choices as you would if you had bought the books from Amazon. What a monopoly! This is infuriating! I then tried to connect the Kindle to my new PC! No success! My computer didn't even register that it was plugged. I looked online, tried in three different countries (PCs and a Mac) and with three different leads (I first tried with the one that came with the Kindle). Again, no success! I noticed, while I was looking for info on line, that lots of people are having the same issues when trying to connect their kindle to a computer. It seems that this is a problem that has been going on for a good while but nothing is being done by Amazon to fix it.

Name: Frugal Dougal
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 June 2019
Review Content: First off, my new kindle will not charge.  It arrived on 49% and having run that down to about 20% I decided to recharge it.  Unfortunately it won,t.  Consequently, I am returning this for a replacement.I have had an older model of Kindle since about 2009 and felt that it was a great piece of kit.  My wife bought me this as a present.  Unfortunately, I find that the touch screen is way too sensitive and you only need brush it with a finger and it changes page.  However, the border surrounding the screen seems to be much smaller than my older kindle which means I end up inadvertently touching the screen way too often.Lastly, due to the March of technology for things to be smaller and lighter, this newer kindle lacks any weight to it, much lighter than my older Kindle.  When holding it it’s almost as if there is nothing in your hand.  Some people may like that, I found that as a replacement for a book, an ebook, it should retain some trace of the heft of a book, even if only for the nostalgics.

Name: laura
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2018
Review Content: I am still very sad at the loss of my original kindle by accidentally putting it in the washing machine.  This new one is waterproof and possibly would have survived as it was just the first 10 mins of a handwash cycle.  Since I'm stupid enough to regularly do that sort of thing I'm hoping this one will live for longer.  It's heavier and a slightly smaller screen than the original but the light has already been handy on a dark winter train journey and reading in the dark while my baby goes to sleep.  I loved my original kindle and this one has exactly the same features.  I've not really noticed any other increases so it does seem expensive for a light, but the waterproofing will hopefully save it in the next disaster so will be worth it.

Name: Rigsby
Review Title: Good whilst it worked but it has failed within 12 months of purchase
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 October 2019
Review Content: I took delivery of the kindle paper white on 21st November 2018. Up until now it has been fine and worked well but it has now developed a battery fault. The battery will not hold charge. I charged it to 100% and disconnected the charger at 8am this morning and with wi-fi switched off and the kindle in sleep mode all day, the battery was at 11% charge by 5pm.This fault is now persistent as it is the fourth consecutive time that this has happened. An e-reader with a battery life of 9 hours is no good to me.

Name: Heather
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 March 2020
Review Content: My husband bought this for me as a Christmas  present to take on holidays. When I first got it I had trouble charging it. The problem has been constant every time I have picked it up to read it has always had a dead battery. It has now reached the point where it won't charge at all, so as you can see I won't give it any star rating. I have also not been able to get a case to fit the kindle. I want to return this item and recieve my husbands money back. I have not found a way to return this item.

Name: GuitarmanAlan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2018
Review Content: As you may expect I use my Kindle to read e-books! It is much better to use than my old one with easier settings for font size, the ability to check the time with a simple tap on the top of the screen, where other functions and settings can be found.Being an avid night time reader, the back light is perfect for myself as it allows me to read in the dark, thus not disturbing my wife, the touch screen also doesn't click as the older one does.The only problem I have, and I suspect it is because I have unusually dry skin on my hands, is that on occasion, the page fails to turn at the first attempt.Throughly recommended!

Name: Angela Dixon
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 October 2020
Review Content: This is the first Kindle ive ever bought, ive had the app on my phone for a good  few years and have enjoyed using it.  Thats why i was really surprised that everything on my new Kindle is in black and  white.  Obviously im not talking about the text, but the book covers in my library.  Im used to them being in colour, which they are im the app, makes the whole  thing look really drab.  Its like going back to my childhood when we had a black and  white TV.  Why aren’t they in colour Amazon?

Name: Mr Michael Robbins
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2018
Review Content: This is a good replacement for my original Paperwhite. It appears to have a longer battery life as it 'wakes up' when you open the cover. It is slightly thinner than the original and the screen is just as bright with what appears to be a brighter higher setting. My only 'concern' if you can call it that, is that the touch screen seems to be more sensitive and when holding the kindle it is easy to select previous or next page by inadvertently touching the screen. Overall I have given it 5 stars  as I can down load lots of books and it comes with on my journeys around the world. (it has also downloaded my entire library from my previous paperwhite.) Great device.

Name: Andrew B-Smith
Review Title: Great Product - shame about the help font size
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2018
Review Content: My wife's sight is deteriorating rapidly due to diabetic macular oedema.After using my Kindle with an enlarged font size,  we agreed that this would help her continue to read her Bible in particular.  However, as we set up her new Kindle, we realised that the various help pop-up messages are not in an enlarged font even though the font has been set for a larger size. Please can Amazon consider how they can overcome this drawback.The kindle itself was easy to set up and I had it running for her within a few minutes (shipping with a battery that has already been charged is a real plus - well done!)Finally, an irritant. Amazon sell Kindles without ads for an extra £10, so charge £10 if you upgrade a standard Kindle to a "no ads" version. However, if you switch a "no ads" Kindle to an ads version, Amazon does not refund you the extra £10. So it's heads they win, tails we lose. It would be fairer that anyone who decides that they want ads after all should have the extra £10 refunded IN THE INTERESTS OF FAIRNESS.

Name: Litcrit.
Review Title: The kindle is very useful if you travel on public transport regularly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2019
Review Content: This is my second Kindle. I like to use it when travelling as I can keep it in my bag & it doesn’t take up lots of space or when being used in public - on the train.It is an efficient way of keeping g up with books you want to read but space saving & very easy to order in new titles & samples, which is an excellent way to browse before buying books.I am hoping the battery will be more efficient than the first version which needed very regular boosting.The print sizes & fonts give plenty of options. I really am pleased to have a new one to rely on.

Name: A. Hadley
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 July 2020
Review Content: I was devastated, when my Paper white developed a hardware fault, which was, irreparable. By coincidence I had received an email about the latest version. Having had a consultation with a very helpful advisor who provided me with a 15% discount to replace my existing Kindle, I ordered the new version and am extremely pleased that I did. All my content was, available and it even picked up on the location in my current book.

Name: LD
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 September 2019
Review Content: Love it! I previously had an old model who’s battery started dying too quickly so gave in and bought a new one. It’s definitely improved, a bit smaller (so old case didn’t fit) but feels lighter and I love the smooth front. With the older model bits of dirt would get caught between the edge of screen and frame so none of that now. I have the version with ads, doesn’t bother me at all, when I’m not using it I’m not looking at it! That’s the only time they’re there, when my case is closed. And the battery is great, I read for at least an hour most days, it’s going down roughly 20% per week. That’s with backlight off as I only really read during the day. All round, definitely glad I repurchased!Update - 7 weeks exactly since received and 1st 100% charged, not charged once since, still reading pretty much every day, now often with backlight on when inside due to the weather, it’s at 15% charge. DLd several books too if that makes a diff, otherwise always on aeroplane mode. Couldn’t be more impressed with the battery and performance!! Well done Amazon! I’m going to keep going to almost zero then charge it. I’ve read batteries have a sort of ‘capacity memory’ so best to let them drain fully rather than always topping to 100.

Name: gilltotherescue
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 September 2019
Review Content: I like the lightness of the Kindle but not keen on only being able to hold it around the outside. My fingers have strayed and changed pages many times now. Preferred my old kindle for turning pages, not keen on swiping or tapping especially if I am holding it in one hand. Also on my old Kindle I was able via the menu to view my archived books, about 25 pages, but now I cannot find them. That was handy to view which authors I have read before I buy another book. The backlight is very good for reading at night without disturbing anyone else though.

Name: DeficitDora
Review Title: Excellent! Lightweight, comfy in the hand and simple to use.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 July 2019
Review Content: This was a birthday present to me, and I am completely enamoured of it! It does everything I need it to do and it is simple and intuitive to use. The built in light is great for night time reading, and it doesn't disturb the person next to you in bed. The best thing, though, is it's so light and fits in my hand without any discomfort after a long reading session. I'm a bit late to the world of kindles, although I've used the app on my iPad, and I'm certainly not ready to ditch physical books. But this is going to save a shed load of trees! Love it.

Name: Droigheann
Review Title: Ads which can't be got rid of
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 November 2020
Review Content: Bought it to replace my aging Kindle Voyage. It won't until that one dies. First, they wouldn't deliver it to a country with no Amazon store (had to use another e-commerce store as a sort of broker). I have it now and so far the only difference between this and the Voyage seems to be that on the Home screen you don't get 8 titles from your library per page but 7, because the bottom is occupied by an obtrusive advert banner that apparently can't be got rid of. Not to mention that ads also appear as screensavers. Summary: great disappointment.

Name: Paul
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 June 2019
Review Content: From my last Kindle there are significant improvements, especially around the waterproofing. This mean baths, rainy bus stops, and beside swimming pools are all places I'll not be stressing out instead of relaxing!My only real grumble is that i wonder if kindles have a built in obsolescence; this is my third Kindle over which I've read about 45 books. so at around 22 books per kindle its costing me around £4 a book for the privilege/convenience of using the kindle over a real book - not really economical even if digital copies tend to cost a little less.

Name: acquirer
Review Title: Bought this to rplace one which I bought 2 years ago.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 January 2021
Review Content: I cannot understand how different this one is.Why is it dull and dingy? It is tiring on the eyes to read it for more than a few minutes. The text is greyish and the light is dull. I am using it on the charge with which it came, and there might be an improvement when it is time for a new charge? BUT how is it possible to ask anyone at Amazon this question? With the small charge left in the previous one, the difference is so very distinct.DJH

Name: McNally
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 September 2019
Review Content: Resisted buying a Kindle as a big physical book buyer but this is great. I do a lot of business travel and books rarely survived the flights etc without creasing or scuffs. I tend to buy stuff I'd never really keep on the shelves. Airport stuff, fast food equivalent reading matter and this is perfect. I won't give up physical books but this is a great add on.
