The Kindle itself isn't perfect. I'd like colour covers and a more intuitive OS - the web search is pretty poor - but it is worth pulling the trigger on a Black Friday. No regrets and actually reading far more than previously so clear value on that score alone.

Name: Lelia
Review Title: Light to hold but fiddly sometimes
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 September 2020
Review Content: Really enjoyed this product it was light and easy at night to read which I did most nights and daytime. Its a bit fiddly getting the right font size on this and highlighting sentences but all in all it has been a great thing to read books on. But I bough this product just over a year ago now and sadly it has completely died so no chance of a refund or replacement. Also I did get this on a good promotion 79.99 so I'm gutted right now I can't afford to replace it at this moment in time due it being the pandemic and money is tight. Ah well it was nice while it lasted.

Name: Anna
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 September 2020
Review Content: Absolutely delighted with my Kindle. Wish I'd taken the plunge years ago. As an avid reader and lover of books, I can now afford to try out lots more at reasonable cost and no fear of being crowded out of my house by bookshelves! The initial outlay was worth every penny. The quality is good, the size just right, and so convenient. And I can go exploring and pop another title in whenever I see one! Wow. What's not to like?

Name: mrose
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 October 2020
Review Content: I had an old side button reader and I loved it simple straight forward. I changed as the battery was not lasting. I find this one is temperamental touch screen jumps about if you are not completely lined up and it is difficult to use left handed as it always turns back in stead of forward, it is too fussy and complicated for a reader

Name: Aron A.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 April 2020
Review Content: I have to say that my last kindle lasted for about three years before I looked at upgrading and I am really glad that I did! It’s everything that you can possibly want from a kindle but also they seem to have fixed some of the issues that plagued the previous models (slow loading times, bad touchscreen). I would highly recommend this product. We all know the benefits of having a kindle are by now so I won’t list them but this model does all of that and more.

Name: Chris Taylor
Review Title: Battery life is a problem on this product
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 October 2019
Review Content: Despite the claims of longevity the battery kept running out every week without me hardly using the product and without the back light being on very bright at all. Having visited several forums there were a lot of discussions about this problem. The discussion centred on wifi on off and airplane mode on and off. Some said it made no difference and some did. It does. I switched airplane mode off and now the battery lasts weeks. This is a ridiculous problem and completely spoils and otherwise good product.

Name: MissBlade
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 January 2020
Review Content: Great battery.Flush screen.Water resistantVery light and perfect for my handbag.Kindle store has plenty of deals.I also download books from elsewhere and install. I use the calibre app to make the format suitable - it's very easy.

Name: A Paul
Review Title: Stupid power button placement. Otherwise good.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 June 2019
Review Content: Great e reader. Questionable build quality as I've had one randomly die on me whilst at an airport when I really needed it. Thankfully Amazon have a good replacement policy. Second has been fine so far. One thing that is just stupid is the placement of the power button. It sits right where it is comfortable to hold with your right hand so you end up accidently pressing it while reading all the time causing it to lock. How did the designers not think of that? Put it on the top or make it a toggle switch like on a kobo. Other than that the device works great.

Name: Leftover Stu
Review Title: This is no miracle product but...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 August 2019
Review Content: ... it does what it is supposed to do. I'm finding pairing with Bose mini speaker or bluetooth earphones to be particularly frustrating and a bit hit and miss. I expected better. Once the minefield of purchasing books / audiobooks, and avoiding ending up with two copies of the same book, is achieved it is convenient and compact. Does it Perform any better than your iPhone and Kindle app? Not that I've found yet but it's early days. As an occasional reader, would I buy it again? Perhaps, probably not. Concentrate on the already established Ios version and save the money if you already have the iphone or ipad.

Name: Thimbletack
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 February 2020
Review Content: Perhaps I haven't learned how to use my Kindle properly, but I don't like the way it always jumps to the book I am busy reading. Sometimes I just want to browse the library to see what is available, or check out the offers.Also, sometimes, even the slightest touch on the screen turns the page, which can be momentarily confusing if you didn't see it happen. Overall though it's handy to have, offering a wide range of subjects and books that I probably wouldn't even consider if browsing in a bookshop.

Name: giftaid
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 July 2019
Review Content: I had to buy a new kindle as sadly my 2013 one had gone to the land of dead electronics. I loved my old one and wondered what "improvements" had been made to the latest version. I had no reason to be wary as the new kindle is even better than my old beloved one. All my books were on as soon as I registered all I had to do was bring down my current book and continue reading. I also bought a new cover that puts it to sleep when closed and is much smaller than my old one. Free delivery and only took three days to arrive , whats not to love !!

Name: Rhona Marshall
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 February 2020
Review Content: Pros- This is my first ever Kindle and although it isn't as nice as a physical book, the perks are so handy! It is very light which works well for me as I like to bring books with me when I travel (on holiday and the daily commute). Also means you only have to bring one and not a heavy library. I would say it is actually easier to hold in bed than a book and easier to change the page whilst you are all snuggled up. I read a lot in the bath, so being waterproof is essential! It is much easier to access the books you want to read and cheaper. I love the 99p books however the sequels are usually more expensive, clever marketing there. The battery life is very long which is good.Cons- I found it quite difficult to figure out how it worked and have had to google the instructions multiple times. Thankfully once you are told though, it is easy. Could do with a better manual included.

Name: C. Oliver
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 August 2019
Review Content: I've been contemplating buying a kindle for sometime as I love to read whilst travelling and on holiday.It's great to know that I can access so many books with my kindle.The size of the device is pretty good, slightly bigger would have been better - but the slightly bigger version was significantly more expensive.The set up instructions were clear and buying and downloading the kindle books is really easy too.  The added bonus is the availability of so many free books.If you're thinking of buying one - don't hesitate - really pleased with mine :)

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 December 2018
Review Content: I loved the new kindle paper white 4.  It was nice to listen to audio on it, without the interruption of email and phone calls.Loved:Lovely clear screenThe size was nice and I brought the official waterproof cover that felt really nice.The device felt faster than the Paperwhite 3Disliked:The Bluetooth on the device stopped working after two weeks.  It happens not a problem so I thought.  Phoned customer services, spoke to two people, the first person did the usual ereaders your device start again and see if it works.  Unfortunately all the standard checks did not work, so I was passed on to another advisor.  I spent over an hour on the phone, the advisor did not have a clue, at one stage even told me that the devices Bluetooth was not working because I don't have Bluetooth, from there it got worse.  In the end after being really stressed for over an hour she eventually agreed to send me a replacement.I take of a star for really bad customer service, which really surprises me as I have not had a problem before.Hopefully the replacement will have no problems.

Name: Mrs D H Goodman
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 November 2019
Review Content: So glad I bought this. Originally I bought an Amazon Fire thinking that it would do so much more than just being a Kindle - which it does & I love it BUT if as an avid reader I found the Fire too heavy for hours of reading and if I wanted to read in a sunny room the reflection on the screen was a problem. This Page White is a delight. It's compact and lightweight. You can easily hold it in one hand & turn the page by just tapping the screen with your thumb. It is much easier on the eyes & there is no bad light to read it in as it copes with a!l levels of light. I love it!

Name: amackem
Review Title: A great reader, day or night, wet or dry
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 October 2020
Review Content: This was bought for my wife, to replace an older model, I have the same modelIt is great especially for me when at work, I work shift work including nights and on down time the back light is great.It’s small enough to fit in my pocket, and virtually the same weight as my mobile.Worth every penny.And the water resistant feature is a god send when on holiday around the pool when it gets splashed

Name: Jamie-Leigh Roehrig
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 October 2019
Review Content: First ever Kindle!I usually love books, especially for holidays but they always add to the weight limit and it's sometimes so difficult to decide which ones to take so thought I would try a Kindle. I'm so so so happy with it! So light to hold (can easily hold it in one hand) and it's so easy to use. I love the lighting, not like the lighting on a phone or tablet that gives you a headache, it feels like a real book! It's easy to find books (I subscribed to kindle unlimited) and there's so many books to chose from, it's like a library service, you can borrow up to 10, return the read ones and borrow more.So happy with my purchase and cannot wait to take it on holiday!

Name: Al
Review Title: It was like moving from candle light to electricity!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 May 2019
Review Content: My previous kindle was a generation 4 kindle reader, which up to now had been the only kindle I'd ever had. It worked fine, and I could read on it but it started to get display problems, and after years of use I decided to upgrade.The change is incredible! as much as I love my old kindle the paperwhite is obviously leagues ahead of old faithful, the screen is responsive, tons of storage and the backlight is great too. As far as weight, I did buy the case and it does make it a little heavier, but its the lightest x-amount of hundreds of books i'll ever carry in my bag. Very happy with the paperwhite, definitely an investment.

Name: Red Andy 203
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 July 2019
Review Content: The touchscreen can be a little slow to respond but works well overall the light works well and it is very easy to read.The batty life may be weeks if you only read 1/2 hour a day but if you read a lot more you must keep your eye on it or it will run down without you knowing.A battery life signal whilst reading would be useful instead of just on the home screen

Name: Hannah Lawrence
Review Title: Disappointed and frustrated with your serviced Amazon
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 July 2020
Review Content: This Kindle is too heavy I asked for the new Oasis as a present from my son and Amazon sent paperwhite which for me is useless I am 84 and have lost most of my strength to hold things I cannot get it back to him to return to you because of the Covid Virus and shielding.  I am sure an Oasis was ordered because it was not available for several days after my birthday 3rd June and then the paperwhite was delivered on 4th June  so I suspect you are getting rid of old stock because the new Oasis has had a good review.  I feel cheated!!

Name: Elisabeth Kendall
Review Title: Great technology, but spoilt by ads
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 October 2019
Review Content: I was hugely disappointed to find nearly half the "home" screen taken up with ads. I took the time to find a workaround to remove the "recommended reading". But the banner ad at the bottom can't be removed without some fuss and the payment of £10. Amazon's justification is: Your Kindle would have been £10 more expensive if you'd said you didn't want to see ads. So if you now tick to opt out, we'll charge you £10. This sleight of hand is outrageous and totally out of character for Amazon. Amazon's credibility sinks. The screen is already small - I'd rather see more of my own library displayed on it than a messy collection of what Amazon has decided I should buy. I would have scored it lower, but want to be fair to the excellent technology.

Name: Mike Thornton
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 October 2020
Review Content: I like the built in light and the ability to change font size (im overdue my next eye test...).  I also really like the dark mode.My biggest worry was whether saving a bit of cash to get the "with offers" version was a sensible cost saving or not.  I've added photos so you can see the ad's.  Personally I don't find them intrusive or objectionable.  I do like the fact that if I ever change my mind I can pay to have them removed.  I don't think I will be doing that though.

Name: Philip Walker
Review Title: Great, but there is a design issue.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2020
Review Content: I love my kindle, and I’ve had a few. This version of the paper white is great.There is a but...I keep accidentally turning it off. I hold it in in my hand, usually with my little finger underneath, and I keep accidentally turning it off. Additionally if I use it on the train which I do a lot, if I try to balance the kindle on the tray, again it will turn off.  I wonder if the power button would be better at the top rather than the bottom?

Name: Anon
Review Title: Better Than My Old One - By A Mile!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 July 2019
Review Content: Awesome bit of kit.  I had an old one with keyboard & buttons on the side for years.  Had to have a case with a built in light to read at night.This is so light, a great built in light, excellent battery consumption, & easy to use.  The only downside, & it is very minor, in my opinion is that I have been using a Kindle fire for a few months & when turning the pages on that it looked like you were actually turning a page whereas this one just opens the next page.  But as I said very minor & purely cosmetic.Highly recommended!

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Handy device but screen often unresponsive and connection issues
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 January 2021
Review Content: Having recently converted from books I have to say it is handy, especially for reading while eating, not having to try and hold the page open and of course really handy to have all your books in one place. The negatives though are not insignificant. Mine will only connect to my main wifi but refuses to connect to the extender, dont have this problem with any other device. The bigger issue though is the touch screen is often slow and sometime completely unresponsive. Doesn't seem to happen while reading but when using menu options. For the price I'd expect it to be a lot smoother. I am writing this while waiting for mine to respond to anything at all, currently stuck on lock screen and swiping to unlock is doing nothing. So in summery a handy device but not without it's downfalls. Would I recommend, no probably not.

Name: Bookworm
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 July 2020
Review Content: I was surprised at the battery life: from the 'blurb' I was expecting better performance. I can't comment on the value aspect as I don't know what the purchaser paid.  Obviously limited functionality compared to Amazon Fire etc which I suspect may be the better purchase.  Somewhat smaller that I'd expected - I always assumed they were standard paperback size. Light enough to hold comfortably, but better with a 'stand' cover.  The menus aren't exactly user friendly in my experience though levels of technical ability vary greatly.  The process for accessing audio books appears unwieldy, not least because there doesn't appear to be a speaker facility.  All in all, as per the 'headline', a very welcome surprise present but I'm not sure I would buy one: I think the 'kindle experience' is better on my 10" tablet though the Paperwhite is much more convenient when travelling.

Name: Andy
Review Title: A great piece of equipment that I would recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 October 2020
Review Content: The kindle Paperwhite is lighter and feels more comfortable when holding for extended periods of time. Also being waterproof is another improvement for when reading by the pool, gives you peace of mind in case it gets wet. The paper white background also makes it easier on the eyes as you don’t have to worry about screen glare. All in all very happy with my new kindle and would recommend to anyone who is thinking of purchasing one.

Name: Tracey
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 August 2020
Review Content: Brilliant, I had my original Kindle for  over ten years and it suddenly stopped working.Very easy to link to my account and to access the books I had already got.Would recommend, glad I ordered without special offers too as no adverts coming up

Name: Dee
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 November 2018
Review Content: Have waited some time to upgrade from my original Paperwhite (2012), well I can say it was worth waiting for , the flush glass screen was the first upgrade I was pleased with. Further investigation of the device proved to be a step forward especially the audible Bluetooth option, a more enjoyable experience all round unable to find any "don't likes at present"Only irritation is that could have paid less due to discount on recent promotion "black Friday deal"

Name: Phoebe's Mum
Review Title: Smaller than I imagined, but I love it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2019
Review Content: I have a lot of time travelling/waiting around for sporty daughter so invariably go armed with a tablet.  I've been making do with a Kindle Fire (and an iPad app) to read books, but I tend to get distracted by emails/internet browsing.  I've looked at Kindles from time to time and was finally tempted in the Black Friday sales.  The water resistance was a big plus because I spend many hours poolside (so very humid).  This device is a lot smaller than I imagined, but it didn't take long to get used to the smaller pages.  I get ample charge for a long weekend (so no battery packs needed) and it is very light to hold.  The screen adapts well to reading in the dark too.

Name: It's not hoarding when it's books
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2018
Review Content: I had an issue when I got it because it came with the wrong USB cable.  The customer Service was not brilliant which was a surprise as they are usually fine.  Instead of them just sending me a new one I had to order a new one and get a credit.  It's the £9.99 Amazon Basics one in case you need to order one.  The whole thing took 2 phone calls and 3 people to sort out.I have an old Kindle and this one is different!  No keyboard at the bottom!  No buttons at the sides!  An awful lot of books to download and put into collections!!!  It does seem to be as slow as my old one which was disappointing.  Apart from all that it seems to be fine and I will grow to know and love it.  (I'm keeping my old one just in case...)

Name: Catherine McCallum
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 November 2019
Review Content: Enjoy the back-light feature.  I am what younger ones would call a "silver surfer" and a complete techno phobic. I find it very complicated to use and wish there was a booklet with this kindle that explained all the ways to manage . I struggle to find my earliest purchased books and I am not sure what I have pressed while trying to figure things out but now my books are starting at around 30% read and I have to remember how to manage "start from beginning" instruction. I so miss my original kindle which was lovely and simple to follow.

Name: helen north
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 August 2019
Review Content: I dropped my previous kindle in the hot tub, along with my iPhone XR, the iPhone survived as it’s waterproof sadly my kindle didn’t. I was gutted about my kindle as I loved it and spend hours using it, especially in the hot tub and when in holiday by the pool. Seeing my iPhone survive a dunking prompted me to purchase the waterproof kindle and although it’s not had a dip yet every other aspect of it is brilliant. I also read at night and like to read in the dark so I don’t disturb my husband so the backlight is brilliant, it also dims which is great. The new flush screen is better too. I love it and would recommend it.

Name: mr m
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 June 2020
Review Content: Old paperwhite died after about 7 years of daily use, bought this new one over the standard new kindle just for bigger memory and more dpi.  Lot quicker to load store and change pages than the old one. The old one had started to struggle to find the next page when reading a large book,  this is quick.  I like the display and just get on with reading without considering the kindle itself which shows how good it is.

Name: vicky peplow
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 September 2019
Review Content: So disappointed with this kindle, I bought this last November after upgrading from previous models.  The battery life is a joke, I’m lucky if I can read 1 book, previous kindles would only need charging once a month, this needs charging daily and getting worse.  The switch on button is at the bottom of the kindle, just where you hold it when reading, a really bad design fault.  Kindle have had so many good e readers, how have they now managed to get it so wrong.  I am really disappointed with this and feel massively let down.

Name: B. Ellis
Review Title: Terrible battery life & horrendous transferring books from my old kindle
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 April 2019
Review Content: I am very disappointed in this item the battery runs down so quickly it's awful.  Transferring books from my old kindle is HORRENDOUS. I find the screen very hard to follow the first kindle I had was wonderful, when you turned on it went back to the last page you were reading. I don't know where I am with this one. I haven't had it long so hopefully things will improve but at the moment I don't like it.

Name: Jinny B
Review Title: A really light weight e reader
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2020
Review Content: This is a replacement for my 4th generation Kindle. It is certainly light and easy to read. It's screen is slightly leass responsive than my old Kindle but the real problem I have is that it takes much longer to charge and holds its charge for a shorter time than the old one. I could go for weeks with the old one not needing to be recharged but this one needs recharging in 10 days. This is not a real problem over all but it is really noticeable when compared with the old one. I haven't tested its resistance to water and don't intend to deliberately submerge it but accidents can happen!

Name: Kerrina
Review Title: Extremely light to hold and brilliant for night reading
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 August 2020
Review Content: It was a bit smaller than I expected but once you’re into a good book that quickly becomes irrelevant.  I’m new to kindles. I’ve never had one before and this certainly doesn’t disappoint.  I absolutely love it and for reading in bed it a perfect for me with its backlight which means I can read for ages and it’s never tiring on the eyes.  I worried the battery was going down too quickly but actually thinking about how many hours I spend glued to it, it’s battery life is brilliant.  No forgetting it’s so easy and light to hold, no more hand ache from holding a book.I’m a convert!  How did I ever live without it?

Name: JRS
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 August 2020
Review Content: Basically good but I find accessing the menu difficult on occasions (it sometimes turns to the next page instead and it does not work from the review page). In addition, you have to go to the very last page in order for the book to be marked "Read".  I usually skip the previews of the next book for example but you have to go right to the review page at the very end before it gets marked as read. surely if you finish the "main" story (or stories)  the book should be considered as Read?

Name: Maire Masterson
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 October 2019
Review Content: Really disappointed with this kindle. My old one was perfect but on/of button stopped working. Advised it couldn't be repaired . However after 3days it started working but I'd already returned the kindle paper white as disliked it so much. Couldn't change text into audio. Couldn't access chapters.Delighted my old one started working again .

Name: Brenda Richardson
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 November 2019
Review Content: So far I am happy with my Paper-white Kindle. It will take time to get used to the touch screen which I find extremely sensitive after the old kindle.However I also purchased a Kindle Fabric cover. This was shown on your web  site as being compatible with 10th generation products.It was therefore disappointing to find that it didn’t fit the  Paper-white. The cover measures 162x112 cm and the paper-white measures 167x116cm. I spoke to someone who advised they would send me out the correct one. The second one I received was exactly the same as the first one. No one I have spoken to seems to understand what I am saying to them perhaps you can let me know why the advertised cover does not fit and what covers are available to fit my new Kindle.

Name: Teejay
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 February 2019
Review Content: Bought Kindle after my old mini iPad began to show signs of battery fatigue. For the first time ever right away I had buyer’s regret. The first surprise was that the usable storage space on the Kindle  was 6GB, not 8 GB. The operating system of what is arguably a unifunctiona device is a whole 2GB. Again, compared to the Apple Books reading experience, the Kindle is disappointing. Page turning doesn’t always work and unlike the iPad the screen doesn’t automatically switch to white on black when reading in bed. However, to be fair, the type is clearly legible and you can change it if desired to a “friendlier” font. The third disappointment was that the Kindle can’t be used as an eReader for ebooks from my local library even if they are in the ePub format.

Name: j
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2020
Review Content: I originally had a voyage till it died. Tried  the oasis but I found it heavy to hold (I have nerve damage), it wouldn’t fit my pocket, & ate battery if using light etc.  Defeats the point of having all the bells & whistles if Continuously charging it. Finally got this one & am happy with it. Lightweight & compact, straightforward to use. My only grouch so far is it is slower to wake up but I can live with that.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 June 2020
Review Content: Previously I owned a kindle keyboard and still have a kindle fire. The keyboard broke and it's really hard to read on the fire, whilst sitting in the sun so I decided to invest in a new paperwhite.It's a great item. Perfect size, very light weight. Battery lasts longer if kept in aeroplane mode. I read for hours daily so battery doesn't last weeks like advertised but not an issue for me.I would give it 5 stars except I had a bad experience purchasing this from amazon and had to cancel my order to buy elsewhere.

Name: Andrew Webb
Review Title: Kindle downloaded library and collections deleted themselves. Customer support can't help
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 September 2019
Review Content: I've used a Kindle Paperwhite for a few months now. This afternoon my device wiped itself of all downloaded eBooks and the collections that I'd organised them into. Customer support says the only option is to download and re-organise them again. That would probably take several hours, but I'm not keen to put that effort in as it might wipe itself again tomorrow. I now have extremely low confidence in this device, and am looking into alternatives.I'm also disturbed that customer support don't seem to be very interested in finding out exactly what caused this to happen on my device. You'd think this constitutes a fairly major bug, that presumably affects other users and will continue to do so in the future.

Name: Bill Winward
Review Title: My 3rd Kindle, this one’s the best
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 September 2020
Review Content: I have now had three Kindles, absolutely nothing wrong with any of them but I broke the screen of my second one. (dropped my Swiss Army  Knife on it!). I can’t remember what happened to the first. This one is the best. Very slightly narrower so fits in my hand better and the touchscreen is now smooth, the previous one felt rough. I don’t intend testing the waterproofing but I’m sure it will be OK if I were to have a read in the bath.

Name: SarahFey
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 January 2019
Review Content: Previously I had said I would never have a kindle because I love real books. However not enough shelf space made me start to wonder if a Kindle would be a good idea as I am always buying more books. I looked at the Kobo Aura H20 and was very tempted to get that as I liked the sound of the comfort light pro, a feature which is supposed to make it easier on your eyes and you can change the brightness and colour of the screen manually or the Kobo changes gradually to the time of day. I also liked that the back of the Kobo had a textured surface to provide better grip. I was slightly bothered by reviews of the Kindle which said the power button on the bottom was an issue and was easy to turn off accidently. In the end I decided to go with the Kindle as some of the books I want were only available on Kindle and I was told by several people that changing Kindle books to other formats is a pain. I received the Kindle as a gift for Christmas and I have to say I love it. I had an issue at first of the charging cable not seeming to fit, it took several attempts and I was about to give up when it eventually went in, perhaps some of them are just a bit tight when new, it has been fine since then. I have used it every day and the power button is no problem. The light is great for reading at night. I have the version with adverts but paid today to remove them, the adverts weren't a big issue for me but better without. The battery charge won't last me weeks as I have been using it more than the time Kindle/Amazon base their best battery life on, that doesn't bother me as so far it seems to last about a week which is fine by me. The Kindle won't replace physical books for me but it does make an excellent edition. The only thing I would change would be to add the same comfort light pro feature as the Kobo Aura H20, overall I am very happy and would recommend.

Name: Sally A
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 January 2021
Review Content: I love it!! It's perfect for on the go, or on the beach or carrying around in your bag. It's nice and light for one handed reading and I like the back light but I do wish you could change the tone to a warmer light like on the Oasis. I had the Oasis but I really didn't like it so got this instead and I'm much happier with it. I got a simple gel case with a popsocket on the back which works very well.  I do wish they did a bigger version as well but we can't have everything!

Name: Krista
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2019
Review Content: I've only ever had the very first edition of the Kindle and I literally cried when it stopped working (I eventually found out that my mum stepped on it, by accident she says, but can I trust her anymore?) so it took me a while to go out and buy a new Kindle without feeling like I'm betraying the old one, and I must say, it is delightful. Size and weight are comfortable, navigating is pretty easy, the battery lasts for weeks and I'm glad I got the 4G version as I can access the store wherever I am and run put of reading material :) so yeah, love it, will look after it and hope my mum gets nowhere near it.

Name: Mrs. J. Dunne
Review Title: Built in light so useful,especially if you like reading in bed!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 August 2019
Review Content: I’ve had one of the original Kindles, with the keyboard at the bottom, and was reluctant to change it. However, it started to go on  the blink so I persuaded my other half to buy me a new Kindle for my birthday and decided to go for the paper-white army two granddaughters have both got one. I’m absolutely delighted with it, it’s so light, easy to hold and change page. I’ve managed to organise my library which I didn’t think would be as easy as the old version but proved to be pretty simple. Would recommend it to anyone.

Name: Leif
Review Title: Probably would have bought the basic if it wasn’t on offer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2020
Review Content: This replaced my old Paperwhite as after many years good service started to die. As a replacement it is pretty much the same, lightweight and easy to hold. The light again good for night time reading. The added Audible is a great addition. Would I buy it full price probably not I’d go for the other Paperwhite as to be honest comparing this with my sons new one they seem very similar. But as it was on offer I thought I’d treat myself. Let’s hope this lasts as many years as my other one did.

Name: Maddie Walkden
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2019
Review Content: I am an addict. I devour books and have been a (begrudging) kindle convert since I first held one. I received the latest model (my third kindle) as a gift and have been disappointed. I enjoy the speed of the system compared to older models, however, I find the screen even at its lowest setting too bright at night (which is when all my reading is done) and I struggle with the book download system. For some reason I now have to "deliver" my purchases from a completely separate menu in account settings whereas previously they downloaded automatically... (and yes I have been through all menu settings).I prefer the new layout for settings and light adjustment and airplane mode but find it a little pointless when the books won't sync. Beware the battery too when you forget to turn off airplane mode- depletes far quicker than in older models, and have actually found that I need to charge this model far more often than the older one...

Name: Luke
Review Title: Its a great device but amazon is censoring the kindle platform
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 July 2020
Review Content: I love my kindle a lot and have bought 2 more additional devices for family members.recently Amazon started to censor the content that was available, so books I have previously purchased have been removed from the kindle platform without any notice.the books that are being removed are still available on the Rakuten kobo platform so I will be switching.Its a great device, but you haveto be willing to buy into a platform that may one day remove the books that you enjoyed without notice and be prepared to live with censorship.

Name: George
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 December 2019
Review Content: This was my first Kindle having used a tablet and mobile phone with the Kindle app extensively. I like the long battery life and simplicity of opening the Kindle cover and going straight to your reading place. The device is also light and compact making it easy to carry. The screen is easy to read but slightly less responsive than my tablet when calling up the menu, although turning pages is easy. Book capacity seems fine for my needs and setting up wi-fi easy.

Name: Mr. Graham Kerr
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 September 2019
Review Content: replaced an earlier generation kindle (non-paperwhite) whose screen had been damaged while in a bag.The new one - well it has a sharper screen and it obviously has a backlight so you can read when the lights are out - this is good. The integration of Audible is good too. My own preference, and this might change, was for the buttons at the side of my old one to change pages with rather than the touchscreen, but as i say this could change.The most annoying thing is the power button on the bottom. I think it is less "recessed" than the last one -  but i seem to catch it with my little finger when i am holding the kindle in my right hand. this results in me turning the kindle off a few times a chapter - which is as annoying as it sounds!

Name: StarrySkies
Review Title: Total waste of money as it won't download any books.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 January 2019
Review Content: I dislocated me this new kindle, my old one was better. It stopped downloading any books that I bought, amazon said upgrade the firmware which I did and it download two books which the support team sent to my kindle earlier today but now it won't download a book I bought and the book doesn't show in my cloud library so I can't download it without asking amazon kindle support to do it. I've only had it three weeks.

Name: Georgina
Review Title: Great gift idea and perfect for travellers and quick readers
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 June 2020
Review Content: This was bought as a gift for my grandma who hated packing multiple books because she travels a lot and reads quickly! This allowed her to free up space in her luggage and is very lightweight too! She loved this gift idea and has no complaints over the display and brightness, and thinks this is an ideal product for reading lovers! She even tried to convince me to buy one for myself (but I love real pages too much or I would!)

Name: M. Way
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 January 2021
Review Content: like the back light and ability to change to a dark background with white writing.  Touch screen much easier to change page etc.  Had some initial problems registering the device so had to go to Amazon support chat to get it sorted (they deregistered it then re-registered it) so I could then sync my library.  They resolved this quite quickly for me which I was grateful for as it had taken me round and round in circles.

Name: John Brewer
Review Title: Needs to be a cheaper price!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 April 2019
Review Content: Needed as my last Kindle paperwhite was dying.  Not much difference, but can have black background for night viewing which doesn't disturb partners, which is a plus.  Transferred my library, but I still had to download from library to new kindle downloads individually - or maybe I'm not clever or young enough (70!) to understand a quicker route.  Kindle is a great product which I've used since they came out, but it's time they updated them and reduced the prices.  Seems easier to navigate Kindle app and books on my iPad, but not as lightweight.  This Kindle bought as a present for 70th birthday - would have been an Oasis, if they were £100 cheaper!

Name: Big Bri
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 January 2021
Review Content: I've had my original Kindle for many years, but it was starting to ghost so time for an upgrade.This paperwhite is brilliant. So much clearer, easier to read (don't need the glasses now) and makes me think I should have swapped long ago.Can not recommend this enough.Pair it with a fake leather cover and it's even better, and easier to hold and offers protection when away from home.

Name: David Gurney
Review Title: Great product - very pleased with it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 August 2019
Review Content: Wanted to reduce the bulk in my home and take reading material with me more easily. This product has knocked the nail on the head. It's small and light, the display is high quality. Besides that, books are generally cheaper in Kindle format, plus there's plenty of sales on for Kindle books.I'm also dyslexic but the open dyslexic font is fantastic and helps me to read a bit faster. I'm not sure on battery life yet, as I've charged it once since I've had it but it's still floating around 60% with the backlight on 4 at all times. I'm really pleased with the product and it's come a long way since I bought a Kindle for my mum many years ago.

Name: Chris L
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 October 2020
Review Content: I’m sure Kindle Paperwhite is good for those that read regular books, however my purpose was more for technical and language books.  A couple of books I wanted to use Kindle for automatically gave an error advising it was not in the correct format for Kindle.  It is good to handle and to read novels etc.  I was expecting it to be better than using the Kindle App on other devices, but I found out that I prefer the app over the Kindle.  Not a bad product but I expected more for the large price tag.  It is kind of slow to respond to touch but again, it serves its purpose as a book reader.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: You may need more than one.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2019
Review Content: I bought it for my daughter who's doing her A levels, as the amount of books she needs is ridiculous, she's going to put her back out her bag is that heavy. The thing is she's never used it, and that because my young son won't put it down. He's only 9 but he hasn't stopped reading since Christmas. I'm made up he's taking up reading but it looks like I'll have to buy him one. I think I'll wait until they have another deal on.I love the feel of books, and a Kindle never interested me. I have good eyes and I was worried that looking at a screen would damage them, but the print in the kindle looks like a book, I was well impressed.

Name: k H
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 July 2020
Review Content: This was my first kindle so I was both excited and a little nervous. The blue colour was a hit with both myself and my son. It turned up with charge ready to go so I was able to download a book and start getting to grips with reading.The ability to adjust the text size is a great help as it's given me the joy of reading back that failing eyesight has taken the last few years. The back light also aids in making text a lot clearer.The kindle itself is a good solid weight to hold so it doesn't feel flimsy but it is not heavy. I was not keen on the idea of an ereader originally as I'm an old fashioned reader, preferring the feel of a book but this is approximately book sized and the scroll to turn page all helps you  feel like are still getting the authentic feel.Overall I recommend this kindle. I have thoroughly enjoyed it so far and I'm already planning my next read!!

Name: AH
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 April 2020
Review Content: Dint work outside away from WiFi, also wouldn't switch on or off, thought it was a  con to have to pay for prime to get free books, and the  Audio book subscription and on top of both of those you have to pay for the Audio book... No its okay thanks.... Im not that in love with Kindle to pay all that money out.

Name: TamaraV88
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 April 2020
Review Content: I really wish I had bought one sooner! I have read so many books since purchasing this, a new book instantly at your fingertips any time of day or night, it's lightweight, easy to read in any lighting, the battery lasts well. It's easy to set up and use, and very practical. Not to mention how much money and space I've saved on books! I do slightly miss physical books, but this is the way forward.

Name: Hailey Adams
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 November 2018
Review Content: I would have never thought of buying one of these until i starting reading more books on my phone. My mom the other night suggested that I look a getting one of these as it could help with my eyes.I love my new paper white. It arrived really quick and to my surprise when I first loaded my device up it didn't take long to start up. Also when I first connected to the internet, the kindle was already logged in to my account. It was great as I could then start reading right away. I later found out that it was already logged in because I purchased it from the amazon app. Don't know how it worked out straight away that it was me, but I was just really happy to have it.My favourite series so far is A SHADE OF VAMPIRE. OMG I'm on book 2 already and I'm loving it.HAPPY READING IF YOU GET ONE!!HAILS XOXO

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Title: Slightly irritating, but still a very functional e-book reader.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 November 2019
Review Content: Nice and light, although the official kindle case has a rather sharp edge to the lid. I don't like the compulsory adverts for books that I have absolutely no interest in, which appear every time I open it, and am aggrieved that it would cost me £10 to get this irritating feature removed. The touch screen seems slightly less sensitive than my previous Kindle which is not ideal, but only a marginal flaw. It is a shame that you can not add memory with an SD card like you can on a phone, but it is still a very neat e-book Reader, and probably the best around.

Name: Betty Bealey
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 July 2020
Review Content: When my 2nd Kindle died I decided to go for the Paperwhite and now I rather wish I had not. I resent having to pay £10 to remove the adverts but actually the navigation system is poor. The reading experience is OK but trying to find a book is not simple. With the old Kindle I could turn a page with either hand, and easily find the next book to read,  so now I wish I had saved my money and bought the basic Kindle. (Screensaver just reverted to elegant print photo and I do like the reading experience - 0h well)

Name: seekingsue
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 September 2020
Review Content: This was a replacement for my previous Kindle Paperwhite, which recently gave up the ghost. Registering and transferring my library was very easy, and I chose a model with more storage, as I am an avid reader. The new model is thinner, charges faster and has a longer battery life. As yet, I haven’t explored all the features! Pleased with my purchase, and look forward to taking it with me when we’re finally allowed to travel again!

Name: TonyF
Review Title: Solutions to some of the problems with the new Kindle Paperwhite.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 February 2019
Review Content: Like many others I also noted the same problems with the new Kindle. I came up with some solutions you might like to try solve the identified issues.1. When reading and holding the Kindle it is too easy to touch the protruding On/Off button  and switch it off- Solution:  is to change the orientation from portrait to landscape. The button is not easily accidentally pressed when reading in this format.2. Getting rid of the adverts - Solution: when you finish reading and want to switch off, hold the On/Off button down until a sub screen of options appears, go to ‘SCREEN OFF’ the bottom option and press that until the screen does go off. Close your case, if you have one, if not just leave it showing the blank screen. Then when you want to read again open the lid of your case and the Kindle will go direct to the page you left without the advert popping up.3. Battery Life. I also think when using actions in 2 above there is some improvement in the battery performance.Good LuckTony

Name: A
Review Title: Kindle is good, customer service is disgusting
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 June 2020
Review Content: Well where to start, the kindle took an extra week to arrive and I was not even notified of any delays. After multiple discussions with customer service (who are utterly awful) I was told “you will get the product soon”. No specification of what soon entailed. When the kindle finally arrived, the ads on it wouldn’t work. They displayed correctly but upon clicking them it would say the offer is unavailable. After contacting customer service once again I was told to reset my device, which didn’t work. I was then told I had to pay £10 for the ads to be removed, which would’ve been fine if I wanted them removed. I just wanted them to work properly but apparently paying to remove them was the “only way”. The customer service was just infuriating and horrid. The kindle is good though, highly recommend getting the without ads version as the screensaver looks really nice without ads.

Name: Dylan Thomas
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 January 2021
Review Content: I like the Kindle, and it's great when travelling, also in lockdown when you know you can upload a book anytime.I bought one for my daughter December 2019 as a Christmas present. Unfortunately it broke early January 2021 and as it's just outside the 12 months, there is no recompense. So if you only expect your e-reader to last 12 months, that is fine, but personally I think it should last longer, and if it is faulty, an alternative offered.Poor service. Faulty item

Name: C Haines
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 October 2020
Review Content: Love this new Kindle. After breaking the screen on my Kindle 4 I initially bought a basic model as a replacement. Hated it and have now exchanged for Paperwhite. The backlight is great for my failing eyesight, it is lightweight and comfortable to hold. Could not get on with the touchscreen on basic but this one seems much better and I am no longer craving the buttons.

Name: Owen  & Diana
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 October 2020
Review Content: Very pleased with the Kindle Paperwhite .Being an avid reader over the years I was very sceptical about using something to read with rather than a book itself  .I was  completely wrong .The kindle is so versatile and easy to use the screen is very clear and totally adjustable,  fonts, brightness ect. It has even introduce me to audiobooks and my Bluetooth headphones connect seamlessly thus stopping others having to listen. I would recommend it heartily and the adjustable font would also make it useful to anyone who's eyesight might not be 100% .

Name: L. Richardson
Review Title: A must have for avid readers
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 April 2019
Review Content: I had been using the kindle app on my tablet but l could only read it indoors but with my paperwhite l can now read anywhere. I have set the font style and size that suites me, also the brightness. Along with the case it is small, light and very convenient to use much lighter than a book I would highly recommend this product and it will be one of the first items l pack for holiday.

Name: RoMO
Review Title: Some good new features but the added front cover adverts are annoying.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 August 2020
Review Content: This Kindle is much like my old Paperwhite.  I like the added waterproofing and the change of body colour....but don't like the adverts on the front nor the need to switch on then wait for the device to warm up before swiping to enter. I am surprised that a battery charge does not last as long as my old Paperwhite's did before it began to get old. I suspect that the adverts are the cause of this!

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 February 2020
Review Content: Bought on Black Friday 2019 for under £90.Really impressed with the battery life. I read during my commute 1.5 hours in total and the kindle easily lasts a week.The back light is great and doesn't hurt my eyes when reading for long (a couple of hours) periods of time.Although it's small and easy to hold it doesn't feel like you're straining to read, even on the smallest font setting.The only negative is the touch screen. It's responsive enough but sometimes doesn't know when you're trying to go back a page instead of forward or when you're trying to exit the book and not turn the page. This really isn't a big deal though as it does work fine most of the time.

Name: Denise
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 October 2019
Review Content: I have just upgraded from the original Kindle and the new version is lovely. Much smaller and lighter and the back light is fantastic.I like to read with my Kindle in my left hand and struggled to find out to turn the page with my left hand - the user guide was impossible to decipher so I looked it up online to learn that you can swipe and tap to turn the pages back & forth!The other issue is that its really easy to turn pages accidentally as the 'frame' is so thin. I don't have big hands so I imagine other people will have this issueBrilliant though and I'm able to take loads of books on holiday with me without sacrificing my shoes!!

Name: elgordo
Review Title: Not as good as my previous paperwhite.  Not happy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 April 2019
Review Content: Stand alone this is probably a fine eBook reader.  But I can't help but compare it unfavourably to my previous model.To start with it has a somehow glossier and slippery finish and I have dropped it more in a month than the old one in a year.  The new screen is all very flash - going very close to the edge with out a ledge, but if you read one handed it is tricky to grip it and not turn pages accidentally.And as for switching on after a break.  Very slow.  Only a few seconds I know, but when you are used to it taking no time at all it soon becomes a complete pain.  As does the cheery wake up message.  Grrrr.

Name: Veronica
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 December 2018
Review Content: Bought it from JohnLewis because Amazon werw going to make me wait until Feb 2019 for it! I bought it without audible as don't use that. On the whole I love it compared to old 2012 big and clunky one I was using with the side buttons. It's lighter and easier to hold for hands with arthritis and being able to gently swipe to turn the page is easy. The only gripe I have, is that you claim.the battery lasts for weeks not hours.  Lie! Not so. My old one lasted for a month on one charge. This one only lasted a week on a charge so you have grossly mis-sold and over estimated the battery life capacity. If it doesn't do it, then don't say it does.

Name: Mrs. V. E. Hunt
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 April 2019
Review Content: I am really pleased with this 10th generation kindle.  My old 5th generation one was filling up and not connecting to the internet.  Once I had registered this new one and connected to the wifi the transition of the old books to the new one went smoothly.  I also bought a Moko cover which wakes the kindle as you open it.  This kindle has lots more storage space.  I was alarmed that the kindle package was posted through the letterbox!  especially as we were in.  No one tried to ring the doorbell.  Luckily the package fell onto a mat.

Name: Mr C. Walton.
Review Title: Brilliant, a notable upgrade over the basic Kindle
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2019
Review Content: This is a significant improvement over the basic Kindle.  The biggest change is the built in light, it adds light without fatiguing your eyes, and even a low brightness can make a huge difference when reading.  The next big selling point was the built in Audible support, now I can have it all on one device rather than switching between my phone for Audible and Kindle for reading.The Kindle Paperwhite is lightweight, easy to hold and just works.

Name: mrs maggie
Review Title: Needs a cover to protect it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 November 2018
Review Content: It's great  very clear  just finding my way round  it

Name: Aj
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 February 2021
Review Content: I love my kindle, the first one I purchased 5 years ago was dropped in the bath and stopped working, I purchased a replacement, move forward to the present time, I retrieved the old broken one from a drawer, Amazon paid me £40 for it and give me discount off my new kindle, a great buy for the pleasure it gives

Name: English Dave
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 December 2019
Review Content: This is the 3rd kindle I have bought over the years and is the best so far. The previous kindles were all good until they started to age and battery charge duration reduced and the stability of the device started to reduce, needing resetting every few days. This new device down loads quicker and a great feature, I can listen to my audible library as well althoughprolonged blue tooth use does reduce battery life. all in all happy with the purchase.

Name: Penny T.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 August 2020
Review Content: you'll be sorry you asked ! - I have been literally driven to tears trying to get this working- I read the instruction book over and over, phoned my Library about loading their books, emailed the Council for help,and asked my Brother-in-law who can usually help with tech. No joy at all. How  I havn't thrown it out of the window I don't know. I bought it for my Birthday and as I can't get to my Library and have bitterly regretted the stress it has given me. My only options seem to be selling it, or paying  a computer expert . It seems only capable of buying books from Amazon- which I can not afford.Very disillusioned and very upset

Name: Anthony D
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 September 2020
Review Content: Product failed after 9 months. Amazon replaced it but with a refurbished (i.e. used, second-hand) and not a new one. I didn’t find this acceptable and challenged Amazon about this and the terms of my guarantee. After some discussion with their representative Amazon’s attitude can be summarised as “tough, just be glad you’ve got another year’s guarantee”. Nice. To my mind if a product cannot be repaired under warranty it should be replaced on the same basis as it was originally bought. If I’d wanted a refurbished (secondhand) Kindle I would have bought one in the first place.Would I buy another Paperwhite? Definitely not. It’s not worth the money. I'll stick to the basic model whose screen resolution is the same as the first Kindle I owned and which gave me good service for many years, and which to my mind is perfectly fine. Also if that fails and you are treated like this by Amazon you’ve not spent more than you need to.My failed Paperwhite is now back with Amazon, 9 months use but not a mark on it. Based on my experience be aware that if your new Paperwhite fails after 1 month and they can get mine going again it could be yours...I have been a customer of Amazon for many years with no problems, but this experience makes me much more wary about what and whether I buy from them.

Name: Fvanterp
Review Title: Easy to Use and nice buy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 January 2020
Review Content: This was my first experience with an e-reader so did not know whta to expect. One I cgot used to the black and white screen and page refreshes it is quite a good tool for reading books. This definitely makes it easier to carry and read books in a compact digital form. Reading at any time of the day and even at night is great with the lighting settings.Slightly more expensive than I expected for an e-reader but it you love reading it is worth it.

Name: Bruce Weir
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 July 2020
Review Content: Very disappointed in 2020 Kindle Paperlight. The battery is very short lived. This is the second I've had (sent the 1st one back) with the same battery problem. It has nothing to do with the backlight because I don't read at night. It is not the indexing - none of the reasons Amazon suggests.I bought the 2020 version because I wanted to have Audible, but I can't read any Audible book before the battery needs charging! While I listen I am worrying at the same time that the battery is about to conk out!Another thing. It is advertised as having 4G connectivity - it says so on the box it arrived in. But open up Settings/Device Info. on the device itself and what do I see - 3G!!!I've still got the 2013 Kindle Paperwhite which works wonderfully, even now. What has happened with the 2020 Paperlight - more complicated menu, paper thinness and lightness is preferable to a long lasting battery?

Name: Daniel
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 February 2019
Review Content: A bit slow at times but works great and the waterproof quality not to mention the 4G makes it a must if you're looking for an e-reader. Battery life isn't as good as on some of the other kindles considering most of the people won't be using 0 brightness and constantly turning on the airplane mode, but really impressive none the less.

Name: Ann
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 January 2020
Review Content: This was bought for me for Christmas and I am over the moon with it!.  Having previously had a kindle fire, which was great, as it was colour and you could access other games etc on it but it was very heavy to hold.The kindle paperwhite is definitely worth every penny as it is light to hold, easy to use and waterproof should you take it on your hols.  This was bought for me without the special offers and I would say this was definitely worth the extra money as you do not get any pop ups etc.Would highly recommend

Name: Peter
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 December 2018
Review Content: Got this after my old kindle passed away earlier this year. The form quite nice, with the light and text being of the usual standard I've come to expect from Amazon's devices. Build quality is good, water resistance (let's not lie and say this is "waterproof" now Amazon - it's splashproof) seems to be up to scratch and response times are great.Niggles:Lack of buttons. I don't like that this is touchscreen. Getting to the home screen is a little fiddly, requiring you to press in just the right place on the screen. Page turns can be a bit of a faff if you're holding the item with your left hand. Maybe I'm just old school but I'm a firm believer that buttons beat touchscreen hands down for usability with EBooks. I'm not paying another £100 for them though - that's just ridiculous. Admittedly, the touchscreen does make it easier to type, but as I don't tend to buy through the Kindle or search very often, and tend to use the same wifi networks, this is a feature I very rarely use.Cases - realistically you're looking at laying out at least £30. Which is a shame - Had it been £10-20 I'dve not hesitated.--Don't get me wrong, this is a fantastic product, but the lack of buttons annoys me enough for me to give it only 4 stars.

Name: Beano
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 February 2020
Review Content: My previous Kindle's was great but the battery died so I bought this one based on reviews and price but I have to say you probably do get what you pay for. This Kindle Paper White has a really irritating habit of shutting itself down while your reading - when it manages to sort itself out, usually after 10 - 15 minutes it takes you back to where you were in the book the last time you manually closed it down - as a result you have to spend a further 10 minutes trying to find where are up too - it just wastes so much reading time.

Name: Willlm
Review Title: How do I return a faulty product?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 October 2019
Review Content: Am a big fan of kindle normally and recently bought another but it seems to have a mind of its own and turns the page occasionally randomly when fingers are on the frame - definitely not touching the screen!!Have tried to see where I can contact someone about it but can't find it anywhere hence this review - just want someone to contact me and arrange a replacement please.the 1 star will be chaged to 5 stars as soon as I can get the problem rectified

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 January 2019
Review Content: It's an OK product but that's it.The free app is much better than this £100+ product, as you can do colour highlighting, constant internet connection, the page turns are smoother, it's easier to type (when searching), and so on.The page turning can be frustrating if there's text highlighted (when I try and click next page, it will just re-select what's highlighted). The same goes with bringing down the menu at the top - buttons would've been better than a touch screen that only works when nearby words aren't highlighted.Then there are the ads. I know there is a 'without special offers' Kindle (but I had no idea what that was until I bought this - they should be accurate and call it 'without ads'), but why on Earth should I pay MORE MONEY on a £110 product to remove their stupid advertisements?The audacity of Amazon to force advertisements on a product that costs £110, and offer to remove them for a further £10!The book reader does what it says. Apart from the above gripes I'd say it's OK. Apart from the larger screen, this is worse than the Kindle App.

Name: Heidi Shepherd
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 July 2019
Review Content: I bought the Kindle Paperwhite after my first generation Kindle which I've had for over 10 years stopped working. I absolutely love my new Kindle, it's lightweight but robust, it's really easy to use but has a range of great features, it's got excellent storage capabilities and the battery lasts for ages before you have to recharge. It's well worth spending the extra money to buy the free 4G version. I also love that I can download journals and save them on my Kindle as pdf's. Brilliant product!

Name: Jane
Review Title: I have become addicted to reading again, well worth every penny!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 September 2019
Review Content: I absolutely love this kindle.  I had no idea what a difference it would make to my life (honestly) and I was a real lover of the physical book.  The main advantages for me are (1) the anti glare light is brilliant for reading in bed (doesn't disturb my partner), and outside on a sunny day.  It's easy to hold and move pages with one hand, so reading in bed is just great.  (2) The kindle with it's recommendations, kindle unlimited and audiobook facilities is encouraging me to read much more, and this is what I'd set out to do, having unfortunately got out of the habit of reading.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: A brilliant, efficient service - Thank you!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 November 2019
Review Content: My 2nd Kindle was stolen in Porto - panic because I was halfway through a book and I din'd.t want anyone to be able to access my Amazon/Kindle accounts.  The problem was rapidly resolved by my son-in-law and I received a new Kindle shortly after getting home.  Excellent instructions on how to use the device, all my library there - amazing.  And my accounts were not hacked!The device is excellent simple to use, good back-lighting etc.  Just one point - NOT easy to find the reading progress thing, which I like to use.Many thanks for such a brilliant service.

Name: Mark P
Review Title: Buy one. You won't regret it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2018
Review Content: After much soul searching I decided to replace my aged kindle touch with this supurb new kindle. I admit getting it on offer at the reduced price for £89.99 certainly helped!I'm glad I did, it's brilliant. It's compact slim design is light weight and easy to handle, and the new back lite screen is simply a joy. It's easy to read both daylight and in the dark, as well as in the bath!The user interface is easy to navigate around and much faster than my older kindle. It's not hard to get used to.I'm glad I upgraded, if your thinking about getting your first kindle or upgrading your old one, you won't regret it!

Name: Mrs K L Wraith
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 March 2021
Review Content: I was unsure as to whether to bother replacing my still working 10 year old kindle, the main benefits were a back light, more capacity and the ability to once again read in the bath which I’ve really missed with the non- waterproof version. I’m really glad I did. Same immense battery power, love the waterproof version and the backlight makes reading so much easier and more pleasant on an evening. Definitely a great purchase.

Name: Tish smith
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 December 2019
Review Content: Bought to replace my trusty kindle six that sadly gave up working after many years hard labour. I wanted a kindle just for reading this time because previous if the children have had an issue trusty kindle six was given as a stop gap.It took a little adjusting too as they layout it different not much really but enough it threw me off for a few hours. I love the fact I can bathe and read without fear. It’s supper light weight and so far no issues. :) very happy with my Christmas gift from my children ❤️

Name: SMcC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 August 2019
Review Content: My older Kindle paperweight started to not hold power, so a replacement was required! Love the smooth screen and brightness/fonts/touchscreen and comfort for holding, as before are all good. I bought a lovely cover for it too. Like the ability to read whilst floating in a pool or sat by the waters edge on holiday without worrying if it fell in. Had to download my books from the cloud again - No great hassle and I could then continue reading the book I was desperate to get back into!

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2018
Review Content: Love my new Kindle.My only complaint is why does it not come with a proper plug for charging???USB is ok but means you have to have computer on to charge :-(  I bought new Kindle so don't spend so much time on  internet, my last Kindle came with plug so maybe Amazon should rethink & include plug

Name: Chris Shaw
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 January 2020
Review Content: Great product, swapped over from a very old Kobo, so very refreshing to use. No issues at all with functionality of the product, quick and accurate. Only 4 stars as when starting it shows Kindle book adverts every time, which is not clear in the description. Got in touch with customer services who are able to remove this, but it should be made clearer in the advert. There is a cost to remove,£10 one off payment, but this was done for free for me.

Name: Patricia
Review Title: Now I can read anywhere, any time!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 February 2020
Review Content: Bought for my birthday to replace original. Now can read at night when I have difficulty sleeping. Relatively light and touch screen works well. Recently bought Bluetooth headphones so that I can listen to audio books if my eyes are too tired for reading. Simple to connect. The light can be adjusted which is great also. Another great feature for me is that it is waterproof as I do like to read in the bath and no longer have to worry about dropping it. A little pricy, considering the price of tablets, but I love it.

Name: mark
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 September 2020
Review Content: I love my Kindle paperwhite I forgot how much I needed the e-ink feature, I had the previous generation and unfortunately it fell foul of a water bottle leak and I was very upset. And while waiting to be able to replace it I got less than half of my normal reading done because of using a tablet, Thankfully this wonderful upgrade is waterproof too so I should never have the same thing happen again.

Name: Isobel Pinsent
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 January 2020
Review Content: Generally I am very pleased with it - it is small portable and I can read the display outside BUT I have been a very long term subscriber to the Times and Sunday Times and I should be able to read the papers on this unit. I have tried a sample of the newspapers and it works well. However Amazon are quite prepared to sell me a new additional subscription but are very unhelpful when it comes to how I can make use of my current subscription. I have been very busy so have not had a chance to follow this up but, disappointingly, Amazon said they would get back to me and have not. I will either have to accept that I can read it on my phone or tablet only or spend time pressing Amazon and the Times to find a cure.

Name: stellasstar
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2018
Review Content: It’s light and easy to use. Clear to read and quick

Name: Mrs Rose
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2018
Review Content: I have had 2 previous Kindles over the years, including the previous Paperwhite. I love this new device, it's light and easy to use. It is easier to use than previous models for a left handed person - the touch screen is divided differently making turning the page easier with your left hand. I've not tried the waterproof feature yet....Other than this to be honest I saw very little difference between my old and new paperwhites. If this is your first paperwhite then go for it - if you already have an older one and are hoping for lots of new features I'd leave it for now.

Name: Kindler
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 December 2019
Review Content: I’ve had my first paper white for seven years and although it is still working it is getting slow so thought I would replace it in the Black Friday sale. I’m very happy with my new one. Although it’s slightly different I soon became accustomed to it. All my collections were transferred so I didn’t have to sort anything out. I’m more than happy with my purchase being a fan of kindle right from the first one I bought in 2010. Highly recommended.

Name: silvester555
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 January 2020
Review Content: As a replacement for a first gen Kindle, this is a great improvement in many ways. The automatic dictionary, the backlight, etc.  I'm still learning how to use the touchscreen to avoid selecting menus etc. The quality of the text is also better, and with the backlight, easier to read. Not tested for waterproofness or battery life yet!  I'm also trying out if I can use the device one handed, but that, I guess will take a little time...

Name: M. James
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 July 2019
Review Content: Had to buy a new kindle after my wonderful Keyboard finally died. If I had a choice I wouldn't have given it up for a couple of good reasons. For one I don't want a cover so the slide on off button was a winner, just pulled my replacement out of my bag to find the battery is flat and I am guessing its because the on button which is very easy to engage has been pressed keeping the kindle on. Another is I am left handed, so having to hold with my right hand so I can turn the page is disappointing. The push buttons on either side of the keyboard meant it didn't matter what hand you held the reader with you could go forward or backwards as you wished without swapping hands. The good points is the display is crisp. Struggling to get used to the new layout and why it returns back to main screen instead of the book list, and why you have to guess which part of the screen to press to return. However it is smaller and it is lighter and I clearly still missing my keyboard.  So if I was to change this,I  would be to bring the side buttons back and a home button which stays visible. Would also make the power button a bit more travel friendly.

Name: Cornishcruiser
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 May 2019
Review Content: For the past few years, I’d thought ‘No, can’t see me getting one of them..........’ , the main reason being that I like books, real books. But, after searching for books to buy on Amazon, I’d constantly see the huge difference in price between real books and kindle books. Some are even free. I nearly made the mistake of using my iPad to view kindle books - don’t ! I got the Kindle paper white and it’s brilliant. Small, light in weight, got a good cover for it, easy to use, battery lasts weeks. Very pleased with it.

Name: Jack Cutting
Review Title: Understand what 'With Special Offers' and 'Without Special Offers' mean before you buy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 August 2020
Review Content: The Kindle itself is great! Books are small enough that 8GB of storage is plenty if you're not a full on bookworm with a massive library.The downfall is, the default option when purchasing the Kindle is to get it 'With Special Offers', but I couldn't see where it actually explained what this means, apart from a £10 discount. I assumed it meant that there was a special offer on at the time of purchase which gave me £10 off, and I could also choose to not get this discount (for some bizarre reasons). That is, sadly, not what this means at all! 'With Special Offers' means that Amazon will send advertisements to your Kindle, sometime when you are actually reading your book at the bottom. This can be very distracting, and certainly not worth the £10 discount which is applied. The advertisements are also shown on the lock screen.I wish I could go back and decide to select the option to not have ads on my Kindle, but alas I am after the returns window and have only just realised why there have been ads on there this whole time.

Name: Constance
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 August 2019
