Review Content: I really like the Kindle now that I have found out how to use it.  But why on earth can't Amazon include some simple instructions with it.  There is a tiny publication that comes with it which is printed in many languages, needs a magnifying glass to read it, and tells me nothing the I really need to know.  Ok, I have now found some instructions online, but I still think a leaflet with the basics could, and should be included.  So sorry to have to drop one star for this omission.

Name: jane markham
Review Title: Packed full of features, a readers delight!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 May 2019
Review Content: Love my new Paperwhite Kindle. Lightweight, easy to use [though I am still a novice], great choice of books to read from fiction/non fiction, fantasy, thriller.... Had a problem with some book purchases not showing in my 'library', but this was sorted out with me sending my number to the helpline and getting an immediate telephone call back. Everything was rectified by a professional, friendly and very competent customer service person within a few minutes or so. Great product and fantastic customer service.

Name: toyota
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 August 2020
Review Content: Had this a few weeks now , went for the option “with ads” this one was 10pounds cheaper was a bit apprehensive reading some of the previous comments as thought it may affect the reading , it is not a problem one ad comes up when you initially start it up just swipe it away and the book is ready for reading. Easy to read in the sunshine and at night in bed . Would highly recommend

Name: DC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 October 2020
Review Content: Bought to replace my current Kindle which has given good service for a few years but battery now getting tired.Touch screen on this one failed after a couple of weeks use.Kindle started changing page randomly - which is very annoying.Also, would not react to touch - e.g. going to home screen, accessing dictionary etc.Restarted the Kindle twice to see if that would solve the problem. It didn't - and it is being returned for a refund.Glad I kept the old Kindle!

Name: RT
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 August 2019
Review Content: Too a long time to bite the bullet and get a kindle.  In hindsight I’m not sure what the hesitancy was - did I really prefer a real book?  Now think the kindle is actually BETTER thank a real book.  Light. Easy to take several books everywhere. Battery is great. Screen quality superb. And with water resistance there is no nervousness reading around the pool etc. Comfortable to hold. Good range of options from font size, typeface, brightness etc that you can adjust.  Very very good

Name: Mike 85
Review Title: First time kindle buyer - lightimg and font choices available on your selected kindle.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2020
Review Content: kindle paperwhite 32 gb was my choice.  It was a good buy!.  You do need to persevere with logging on to an existing Amazon account or starting a new account. Connecting to WIFI is  straight-forward.  On the frame an on/off button and USB cable port. Everything else is menu driven by touch selection. For myself I found the variable lighting and font  sizes a real benefit as due to poor eyesight I have difficulty in reading the average printed page. Two criticisms for Amazon: Whilst the delivery was well on time the actual packaging was appalling!. It was  a minimal wrap round cardboard  box, both ends open with no seal.  Fortunately the Kimdle was well packaged and survived delivery/ Also  I so not want the Amazon adverts draining the battery. Take these off and I will consider buying a case, screen protector and bluetooth libraary.  As I started - a good buy. Over to ypu Amazon

Name: George Kaplan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 January 2020
Review Content: The paperwhite is constantly improving. Reading in the dark now better than ever, the letters are pinning clear and sharp, access to a white range of books and long lasting battery to read without the need of recharging for much longer time.However, the screen is to small for those who need reading glasses and want enough words on one page. 8" would be perfect and I was missing the headphone jack. Im not a big fan of Bluetooth.

Name: Toomas Ormisson
Review Title: Mixed feelings: solid hardware, poor software
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 May 2020
Review Content: My experience:Started off with the device defaulting me to US locale and showing me no Audible content, since all my purchases are through Amazon UK. I imagine if I had any digital book purchases those would have been unavailable as well.The support request initiated from the Kindle got no response, or if it did it was lost somewhere.Although the device doesn't have "advertisements", it's trying to sell me everyting on every step I take on it. I'm not getting anything I didn't go looking for. Please stop that intrusive behaviour on your devices - I am not a product.The Goodreads integration is a nice feature! Though, getting external content to the device; like books purchased through Humble Bundle or other sites, is a hassle. I guess it's OK if Amazon is your only content provider.The customer support was really good once someone reached out to help!

Name: Mrs. C. M. Rogers
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 August 2020
Review Content: Touch and feel are really nice, display is very good and it has a quality finish.  Only had it a few days and I'm  finding navigation and organising my library really perplexing and still haven't found my way round it particularly well.  Having to keep referring to the user guide but going in and out of that is quite annoying at times but I suspect it could be an 'age' thing or maybe its just me !Reasonably happy so far but I'm sure with time i'll be completely satisfied.

Name: Terry a
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 May 2020
Review Content: Delivered on time. Good price. I bought it to replace my 0ld and much "Kindle Keyboard".Absolutely no complaints about this reader at all.  SPECIAL OFFERS: I believe that this clever bit of free advertising was to be "targeted" base on my purchase record.. I have never bought a romance in my life, and yet most of the featured titles are just  that romance titles.  What a waste of a great marketing opportunity

Name: Jamie T
Review Title: Poor quality control. Not worth hassle. Avoid.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 July 2020
Review Content: Had two within space of two weeks. First had a load of dead pixels and was sent back straight away. The next seemed okay - but then began freezing on every other unlock and battery life died within a day. Factory reset didn’t help. Reverted back to using my 2014 Kindle. Avoid.

Name: madlizzie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 April 2020
Review Content: I ordered a new kindle during a lockdown as my last one was getting slower. I love this one as not only is it smaller but it has everything at your fingertips. With a couple of taps in the bottom left corner I can see how long left in the chapter, book etc. It changes page quicker, the quality of light is really good for reading at night and I wish I had upgraded sooner if I’m honest. Definitely worth the money.

Name: cadi
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 September 2019
Review Content: This is a great improvement on the early Kindle I once had.  For reading text in any lighting condition it is lovely (better and easier on the eyes than a "real" book in bright light outside).  It doesn't handle illustrations and photographs very well - and although magazines can be downloaded it's not ideal for them.  In short - if it's just text and plain reading then I don't think there is anything better - I looked at all the other Kindles and am sure I made the right decision.  While the waterproof element was not a consideration for me at the time it is well worthwhile - I'm sure many of us have forgetfully left a paperback book we're in the middle of reading outside when it starts to drizzle - so it's a comfort to know that THIS Kindle can cope with it!

Name: stacey
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 October 2020
Review Content: I love this paperwhite i really struggled to spend the extra as I've got 2 x kindle fires plus the first one with the buttons, well I went ahead and I'm so pleased it is very easy to use compared with my others.although I had used them for years, this is progress  and because it hasn't got all the games etc. i can really  concentrate on my reading. This will be invaluable if we have lockdown again .

Name: Keith
Review Title: Adverts on this £120 device means it gets 1 star only 😠
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 January 2020
Review Content: Update: Amazon have been in touch and explained that the Special Offers refers to having a £10 discount in exchange for adverts. I was under the impression it was 'a' special offer with £10 off. It does say this on the webpage (I went back and checked) but by calling it Special Offers I think they're leaving it open to easy misinterpretation. CS have removed the ads from my device which was my biggest bug bear so I've upgraded my score to 4 stars as it's now as I expected but not quite as good as my old Kindle Voyage.Bought this Kindle as a replacement for my Voyage which I had for 5 years until it stopped working. Didn't want to be spending on a new one as I really liked the Voyage but needs must. The main annoyance with this Kindle is the ads on the lock screen, have never had these on my previous 2 kindles and find them quite annoying. What's the point of a power button if I then need to swipe the screen to open it due to adverts? Disappointed with this one, wish my Voyage still worked.

Name: Faith
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2019
Review Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle Paperwhite! I'd been using my Kindle Fire for reading the last couple of months since I broke my Kindle e-reader and I could not get used to it, it was just too different. So my wonderful hubby gave me a new Paperwhite for Christmas. It is so wonderful! It's small, easy to hold but a good page size to read. I'm used to swiping to turn a page due to using my Fire for reading so that's ok. I just love it.

Name: Daniel
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 May 2019
Review Content: I've had an on and off relationship with kindle devices since the 4th Gen pre-touch devices which while revolutionary could be a bit of a clunky experience overall, a slightly lagged OS experience and other gripes meant I was often fluctuating between print books and the e-reader.Since deciding to punt for the new generation Kindle Paperwhite I'm no longer flitting between traditional and digital books. I'm now fully reading on the Kindle alone as it's just such a wonderful experience. The OS is far more responsive and with touch screen capability now, but the real revolution is the backlight. Finally night-time reading without the aid of a lamp or the 'big light' is a possibility and I'm surprised at just how much of a game changer it's been. The back of the device has a lovely tactile rubbery-texture which I think will aid with the grippiness of the device (however I've opted to pop it into the lovely fabric cover)Overall an excellent device, nice and compact and sturdy feeling and most importantly a real pleasure to look at.

Name: sugarloafjulie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 August 2019
Review Content: My old kindle(the one with the keyboard) that I bought, at least 10 years ago, finally gave up. I loved it and was sad when it died of old age, so I bought the new kindle paperwhite.. Took me a while to get used to it but I love it...I bought it WITHOUT the special offers. In my opinion, it’s the best. Plus I was lucky with the price..when I bought it, it was on special offer.Thank you Amazon, and thank you for all your help, when I contacted you thru the chat line for advising me..xx

Name: FangedFreak
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 September 2020
Review Content: My partner is an avid reader and was starting to get annoyed with cramming untild number of books into his suitcase or work bag whenever he travelled and he started looking into eReaders.Enter the Kindle, it was his birthday earlier this year and so I bought him one and he has loved using it ever since. The unit is extremely light and thin which I really wasn't expecting at all! Now I'm tempted to get one myself...

Name: Marie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 August 2019
Review Content: This is my second Kindle, my old one must be a first edition it is so old!This Kindle is quite different and I am still finding my way around it. I like how lightweight it is and it certainly seems to be easy to navigate.  I like the idea of a touchscreen, but seem to somehow jump 2 or 3 pages forward or backwards sometimes - not sure if this is me or a fault with the Kindle.Kindles are great in that you can be browsing for a good book to read and just seconds later you can be reading it.  Would highly recommend.

Name: MG
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 July 2019
Review Content: Bought for my wife. She likes it very much. Said she’d never have one cos she likes ‘books’...but I want3d her to try it... she won’t give it back !!!!I’ve found the touch screen a bit iffy, not too responsive especially along the bottom edge, this worries me w bit but well we'll see.I was miffed this find that had I bought it a few weeks later, I could have saved 40 quid... very miffed !!! But other than that, the product itself is very good and would recommend to anyone.

Name: petshopper
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 September 2020
Review Content: A little difficult to hold in the sun as you sometimes it an area that changes the font or switches on another feature. When a book ends it could be easier to find the books you have already purchased. Says when the battery is low but then you need to recharge it. Needs to tell an hour before you need to recharge or tell you how much battery is left when you turn it on or off.

Name: Dougall
Review Title: Check before you buy if you have any near-sight problems.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 March 2019
Review Content: I bought my Kindle paper white to replace my very old one.  Everything from my old one down-loaded into my new one easily, but it was difficult to find everything compared with my old one.  I use a Kindle because of near-sight problems and need larger than normal print size.  The pages other than the actual books, which you can enlarge easily, are difficult for me to read. It would be better to have fewer illustrations and larger print. The swipe page turner is not as smooth as my iPad and I have to check that the page has actually turned or not turned two.

Name: Jennifer margaret smith
Review Title: That it works when I switch on
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 December 2019
Review Content: This is my third kindle, my second kindle was amazing but after a few years and a lot of use the screen froze , after 2 weeks the same thing happened to my kindle3 fortunately after 30 minutes I was able to reboot it . I am now quite nervous about switching it on . I live in Tenerife and don’t have a television so my kindle is important , returns are difficult and lengthy and as I’m flying to the uk for Christmas it’s important that it behaves on the flight , fingers crossed h

Name: Mp4
Review Title: Very good makes reading a pleasure
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 April 2020
Review Content: Well I’m not much of a book person, I  downloaded the kindle app on my phone to read the Harry Potter series. And fell in love with the app and how easy it was to keep reading so decided to buy a dedicated Kindle device without the distractions (Facebook) and other media. 48 hours in now and find the kindle amazing to use its light weight, simple, and no distractions. Only gripe as others have said is the power button on the bottom of the unit.

Name: Melinda
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 February 2020
Review Content: My Kindle was a Christmas gift from my son and his family and I can only say that it is one of the best gifts I have received.  I enjoy reading and although I love the actual feel of paperback books and being able to hold them and refer back as and when I feel I would like to.  I cannot fault this item.  It is lightweight, easy to travel with and has a number of books awaiting reading all compacted into it.  I love it.

Name: liblob
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 February 2019
Review Content: I bought the paperwhite to replace my old kindle because it is back lit and has a touch screen. However, despite those very welcome additions, I find many other features unnecessary and very irritating and not in the slightest intuitive. I paid the additional amount so as not to have advertising but find that the recommendations are, in effect, advertisements and an annoyance. I am perfectly capable of searching on line for authors I might like. My old kindle has a much better arrangement and works logically and I wish my paperwhite was the same.I love the  Kindle, especially when I am travelling, for its convenience, size and the ability to buy and download books anywhere but remain somewhat disappointed with this latest version.

Name: Carlos De Sousa
Review Title: Better in many aspects and worst in some others
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 January 2020
Review Content: I've been a kindle user for many years, this is my fourth Kindle (I often leave them behind in airplanes), the screen is certainly much improved from the previous generation, it's also lighter overall and the ability to connect headphones to listen to audible books is appreciated (although not really necessary). Unfortunately, it seems like the processor has been downgraded as it takes much longer to start up and wake up from standby, it also crashes often when one is reading a large PDF file with charts.

Name: JAG
Review Title: Great but has some annoying new features or loss of features
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 December 2018
Review Content: I struggle hard when having to review his type of product.  It is everything my last paperwhite was but as usual the developers and testers do not pay attention to detail.When you have collections selected you can no longer see any books not added to a collection and when adding books to collections you used to have a screen hat allowed you to add or remove from the same screen, this has now been made into two separate options which is in my opinion is a backward step.  My other observation is that Amazon will receive this feedback but never do anything with it, which does make feedback rather pointless and hey I have only scored. 3*

Name: EMH
Review Title: Perfect for outdoor reading in the sunshine
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 July 2020
Review Content: Love it I bought it when I thought my kindle fire had given up the ghost after constant use for 9 years. However it burst back into life the day my new kindle paper white arrived., but because I couldn’t read my Kindle fire outdoors which I found very disappointing, I’m over the moon with my new one.  Still love my kindle fire though for all the other things I can do with it.

Name: WelshLeigh
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 August 2019
Review Content: I always said i never buy a Kindle but my book collection was overtaking my bedroom lol,my Mum has a paperwhite & knew she loved it so i treated myselfThis is great,the size of the print is great for my failing eyesight (you can change the size) & the light is handy for when im reading at night,its so easy to hold & fits in my bag with no weight to itAlso bought a funking cover to protect it so im over the moon with it...Best pressie i bought myself in a long time <big smiles>

Name: Mrs Purple Everything
Review Title: Love it, love it, love it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 December 2018
Review Content: Love it, love it, love it!From someone who bought the very first edition Kindle when it came out and has used that one ever since, this is just fantastic!!! The back light is so subtle and great for reading in the dark in the wee small hours! Haven't tried out the 'waterproofness' of it yet - thank goodness! It's so slimline and light and perfect for reading one handed. It;s hard to see how this could be improved upon, but I'm sure as technology progresses, something will be added to future models....

Name: J. Ingerfield
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 July 2019
Review Content: I have had a Kindle for years now...the same one. I had always promised myself that, when it finally died, I would treat myself to a Paperwhite. But the thing just would give up so it took a recommendation from my Optician to force the issue. And I am so glad I did as I find the tired eyes complaint I had been experiencing has greatly  diminished. And it is lighter making it easier to hold. Reading with it is pure joy!

Name: Pauliew
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 August 2019
Review Content: My last kindle paper white gave up after just two years the micro charger on kindle was loose so no longer charged,after speaking to Amazon to check it they could repair,no can do so was given 20%off new one and it was a prime day sale,just when I needed it so I managed to get for around £55,this new one is really good,feels lighter and I am enjoying it so far all good and I’m happy with purchase,though I think my old one should have lasted more than two years and Amazon should offer some kind of repair service.instead of adding more to landfill

Name: Mrs_Schofield
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 June 2019
Review Content: I really can't fault this Kindle! I have read physical books my whole life and was put off from buying an e-reader thanks to a crappy one I bought several years ago. But this one makes reading ebooks easy and enjoyable...and I like that's it's waterproof so I can read in the bath without crinkling pages! The device is easy to use and you can sort your books into collections, link your Goodreads account, and all the options around font size and screen colour are great.An excellent e-reader

Name: LMR, Dumbarton
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 July 2020
Review Content: As an avid reader I go through books like wildfire.  I normally borrow from the library, but with that option out the window - I decided to get a good Kindle.Money well spent - easy to use and adjust to suit your taste.  Not quite the same feel as a "real book", but I will get used to it!Easy to download free books or very cheap ones from Amazon.Would certainly recommend purchasing one.

Name: Charlie May
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 June 2020
Review Content: After being a book lover for so many years, I wasn’t sure whether I would like reading from a screen but it is great! So much easier to hold than a book, the screen has no glare and it’s really not like looking at a screen at all! Easy to see in the sun so perfect to take a library on holiday as well as reading inside! You can adjust so many settings to suit you including the brightness so no lights are needed to read in bed but no headache from bright screens! Downloading books is easy and also relatively cheap! Wish I had made the jump years ago!

Name: SJCP
Review Title: why can't amazon make the size and version obvious to buy a case?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 January 2021
Review Content: I love kindles  - but seems like amazon makes it extra hard to figure out what version and generation the kindle is to buy  a case. googling the serial number to figure out seems ridiculous. a simple feature that says you need to buy a case that fits X would suffice. Does amazon read their own reviews as I see this issue everywhere, and in the Q&A. It is not rocket science!

Name: Latenighter
Review Title: Screen slightly less responsive than older versions?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 December 2018
Review Content: Looks pretty much like all the other Paperwhites but this one's screen seems  less responsive than my others have been.  Page-turning is fine, but sometimes on a dialogue box I've had to press several times to get a reaction.  My previous two Paperwhites developed a fault - most of the book titles disappeared  As it was such a particular fault I wondered if the second one caught it from the first through being synchronized, so I haven't synced this one with them or loaded any of my collections.  Hope it will last well, I can't imagine being without a kindle now.

Name: Chloé Grunenwald
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2020
Review Content: This e-reader has changed my life! I will admit that prior to having the Kindle, I was not much of an avid reader. I would read 1-2 books per year, usually while on holiday. I got this in October 2019 and have already 14 books! I have gotten it as a gift for two other people and recommended it to many more. Here are some of the features I love:- The screen looks like paper. If the backlight is on 0, there is absolutely no light and it really feels like looking at paper, not a screen.- The backlight has a scale of 0-24, so you can really adjust it to the level you'd like.- The battery life is really long. It usually lasts me more than one book.- It is lightweight and small, so you can take it anywhere (unlike some thick, hard copy books)- I live in Ukraine, so having access to English books can be tricky. With the Kindle, you can instantly download any book from the Amazon store.- You can highlight text and all your highlights are stored under the "Notes" tab. So, you can easily refer back to any highlighted text.- You can look up words in the dictionary (even without WiFi connection) and the Kindle automatically compiles a list of words you looked up. A great way to learn new vocabulary.- You can choose the font type, size, and spacing to whatever suits you best. There is even a "dyslexia friendly" font.Overall, a really great way to experience reading. I have nothing bad to say about it. I would highly recommend this Kindle, especially to anyone living abroad or anyone who is a reluctant reader.

Name: Celia Higgs
Review Title: As good as the old one
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 April 2019
Review Content: My old one had broken ... the charging point had been pushed in. My new kindle is great... I fall asleep reading and when I can’t sleep the light is great to read from. You need a new cover as my old one didn’t fit... additional cost.  Putting it on charge I was slightly concerned that the connection is a tight fit . I hope I don’t end up pushing that in too.Only negative is that there are no longer the pictures on the screen... the pencils etc.  Now it just advertises books. This is disappointing.... I miss the pictures!

Name: W. Cassidy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 January 2021
Review Content: Absolute Rubbish! I'm no whiz-kid but they're too slow and get confused very easily and therefore freeze up and trying to get back to normalcy is a bit of a nightmare. I notice that none of the kindle books do pictures and that's really boring. Over the top advertising from Amazon as well. Books are good, try them, they've got pictures.For me it was a total waste of money, it's only now I can get to sleep!

Name: Shauna
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 June 2020
Review Content: I recently ordered a kindle paperwhite and it came faulty, so I returned it. Ordered another, same problem again. Finally ordered a third and once again the same problem. The screen was all scrambled and frozen making it unusable. When I asked if it was possible that there was a faulty batch as all 3 had the exact same issue I was told to reorder another one again, not very helpful. This time I will not be reordering.

Name: Kelly Tav
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 June 2020
Review Content: Home experience was a disaster. I bought the kindle for my partner and I knew I would have the page home experience to select my type of reading to have a nice experience with my own kindle. I was expecting this page to have a kindle with my style as I was using his kindle for a while. So when I was going through the steps after selecting the language English from uk , it showed my home experience in Japanese. So all the options of books was in Japanese and I couldn't read a single thing. I have to skip the step. Looking to my whole thing is in Japanese. Than I reset the kindle to start it again and guess what my home experience disappeared. Now I can't select the type of books I read and my kindle is not pared with what a like. I am extremely Disappointed because I was waiting for this step. Not joking. I need to have this set up for my style of reading and now I am so upset and I want to return the kindle. There is no point not having a kindle with my personality. I can use my Fiancé one that I use sometimes.

Name: Ballards
Review Title: DONT BUY IF YOU THINK YOU ARE GETTING AUDIBLE BOOKS.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2020
Review Content: If you want audible then you have to subscribe £7.99 per month. Or purchase a book for say £9.99 and pay an extra. £9.99 for audible  so you could be paying double the cost of a book for audible! if you chose the single purchase option. I feel that this should be mentioned in the initial advert instead of being hidden in the ads attached.  I am keeping this as my old kindle has died on me. But not paying exorbitant price of the audible.  Disappointing amazon.

Name: Mark Bramley
Review Title: Headphones and Kindle Unlimited issues have spoilt the experience
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 October 2020
Review Content: I was delighted to be buying a Kindle that would allow me to read, and listen to, books.  I mainly listen to audiobooks nowadays, but tend to fall asleep at night, so the prospect of being able to read the same book at night seamlessly was very appealing.The reality is somewhat difference.  The first audiobook I wanted to read as well isn't even available as a text book!  So, I thought I would use Kindle Unlimited (3 months free with the Kindle purchase) to find a new text / audio combo.  I gave up as searching by genre and by audio was not easy, and then when I finally chose some books, it turned out they were all chargeable.  So Kindle Limited actually!Then my earbuds won't pair easily with the Kindle.  Occasionally they do, but most times not.  Even if they do, if I then pause, it loses the connection again - and repeat.  Very frustrating.The same earbuds pair with other devices seamlessly.So, I am just debating whether to keep the Kindle for read only, or send back

Name: ASH
Review Title: way too bright in pitch black room!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 March 2021
Review Content: In a pitch black room the lowest brightness setting just keeps me awake!  They need to take down the lowest brightness setting back to the last generation where I could actually fall asleep whilst reading this!  if they do that mixed with the new dark mode feature - this would be PERFECT!  Please listen to this request amazon - lot's of forums complain about this feature!

Name: Karen Howard
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2020
Review Content: This was a Christmas present to replace my aged paperwhite which would no longer automatically connect to wifi and which wouldn't remember my default device. This is is smaller and lighter with all the good features of a paperwhite.  Had a moment's scare when the battery seemed to drain almost overnight without being used and my screen froze but once I charged it up again it seemed to right itself and is now working fine.

Name: Jill
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 September 2020
Review Content: This is my 2nd kindle & I love it BUT this new one is smaller than my first, exactly the same thing but does NOT fit snuggly into the proper leather holder I bought first time round. BEWARE IF YOU READ IN THE BATH, HOT TUB OR DON'T HAVE IT FIRMLY IN YOUR GRASP, IT WILL AND DOES DROP OUT OF THE CASE. I do not understand why and would appreciate if Amazon could explain this.

Name: ami
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 December 2019
Review Content: I love the simplicity of buying and downloading books . I wish there is a special place to store titles of books read ,even if not bought from Amazon. Being able to alter the print and background is brilliant.I do find holding it difficult with arthritis the amazon case doesn't  really help much on that front and my fingers touch the screen and pages go haywire, some cases have a surround but I found that out afterwards. Maybe I need to invest in a flexible holder.

Name: Old&Not in my PRIME init
Review Title: The Wife says "Don't waste your life reading a bad book".
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 July 2019
Review Content: Bought it as needed to read on holiday in the sun, which I can't do with my Kindle Fire. And in that respect it was excellent.But its a book library, so why is your library not easily accessible, it's NOT and it's ANNOYING.Touch screen, yes frequently resulting in a myriad of options, changes you had NOT wanted.Easy to hold, to be fare I had it in a cover, but it was as slippery as an eel.Overall it was as GOOD as it was ANNOYING, but I enjoyed my holiday.

Name: GRG Cambridge
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 April 2020
Review Content: *DO NOT BUY*Worked great for a year, but then left it uncharged for 5-weeks. Result, dead battery. Apparently a common problem with Kindle Paperwhites. Just out of warranty, typical. Amazon's response is simply to offer a discount on a new purchase. What a waste of £120. Lobo will be my next e-reader.

Name: Sharon Emery
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 July 2020
Review Content: I was adamant I would never read a book electronically but lack of library access has reduced me to the kindle. I am pleasantly surprised by it's lightness, (much easier than lugging a paperback which often means a bigger bag to carry it in), easier to read when eating as I can stand it up with the cover angled, my eyes don't get so tired so quickly. All in all am very impressed, although you have to be careful when selecting a book to read that it is actually free.

Name: Kindle Customer Patricia shepherd
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2018
Review Content: Son got me this for Xmas I’ve listened to a 10 hour audiobook and read a book and the battery was still full highly impressive bit of e-reader got to say I’m over the moon with it buy it you won’t be sorry .

Name: Peter
Review Title: Be careful when buying case as different kindles vary in size
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 October 2020
Review Content: Bought it to replace Kindle that I purchased many year ago which continues to work very well with excellent battery life, but not backlit and is larger (with keyboard). Paperwhite is more compact and better to use in low lighting. Be careful when buying a case as there seem to be a good number of different models of kindles with different case sizes - the first one I bought was the wrong size.

Name: Bill Robley
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 June 2019
Review Content: This is my first Kindle so have nothing to compare it against but, being on my second book, I'd have to say it does what it does very well.There's no unnecessary bells and whistles so it doesn't double as a torch or a toaster or an automatic dog walker.It's an E book, plain and simple.The battery life is quoted as weeks rather than days and, so it may be, IF you turn off the wi-fi and bluetooth.Am I pleased with it?Yup. It's perfectly good.Should you buy one?Well. That depends.If you want an E book with 8GB of memory. Go for it.If you want something to cut the grass... then no. No you shouldn't buy this.

Name: peter coombes
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 April 2019
Review Content: It’s a very nice kindle but I did find it a bit slow and sometimes buggy on turning pages and getting into menus for books that sometimes did not work then jumped a lot of pages after it caught up but if this is sorted out with an update I think it’s a very good kindle it has a nice screen but a bit too small for me so I returned and got the oasis not from amazon but another shop that’s is very nice and seems to work faster but is it worth the extra for me the bigger screen is but maybe not for everyone

Name: Jmax
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 March 2019
Review Content: Got this for my partner and she loves it. Upgraded from the paper white 3 years ago to this one and it’s faster, lighter and looks much better, it’s also nice the screen is flush with the bezel (boarder) as it feels so much better swiping the screen and not hitting your finger on the bezel. Nice to be water resistant too. Battery life is just as good too. Great upgrade.

Name: Isobel Henry-Rufus
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 December 2019
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: T Rowley
Review Title: A great replacement for reading on a smartphone!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 September 2020
Review Content: I had been reading on an iPhone using the Kindle app for many years. The Kindle Paperwhite is so much better; I wish I had bought one sooner. The screen is easy to read without tiring your eyes and the battery lasts for ages.Compared to reading on an iPhone, the light from the screen is much softer, so it disturbs my partner less than a smartphone on night mode.If I could find one fault, it’s that the screen looks delicate, so a case is a must if you plan on putting it in your backpack or luggage.Also, if you upload a large number of books when you get your kindle home then be prepared for it to freeze up for a night while it gets its act together. Keep it plugged in to a wall socket and try and be patient and all will be well. It’ll also be heavy on the battery while it indexes over the first day or two.

Name: Gill Rice
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 October 2019
Review Content: I didn't want to order another Paperwhite (this is my 3rd). I sat on my first one (oops) but was very annoyed with Amazon when the charging port on my 2nd one stopped working.  I would have thought it could have been repaired but they said no I would have to replace it.  So reluctantly had to buy my 3rd Paperwhite.  All very well but yippee I can bluetooth my headphones and listen to my audiobooks on my Paperwhite - NO - it will not recognize my headphone (£250 worth).  So as you can imagine I am not in awe of my new Paperwhite which I think Amazon fooled me into buying

Name: Jill Wales
Review Title: Great. can read without a light
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 September 2019
Review Content: I love this kindle. I have had my other one for many years and didn't really want to change it but, decided that the light would be a big advantage for camping or just reading outside in the evening and reading in bed in the middle of the night and don't want to put the light on to wake your partner.  I was not disappointed - it does exactly what it says, the light is enough to read by and it is lighter than my other one.  Really pleased with this kindle.

Name: Louise M.
Review Title: Beware of the AD version which is TEN pound cheaper.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 February 2020
Review Content: I like my Kindle. This order did not go well. I was offered a discount as a valued customer to replace my old one which had died. I did so but had not realised I had ticked the one with adverts. The lady and I were still "chatting" when I did so, so I probably did not pay as much attention as I usually do. When I got the new kindle adverts were appearing. I then contacted the chat line and they kindly agreed to remove this app. Two days later the adverts reappeared. I contacted the chat again. They offered to remove the adverts again and offered to repay the £10 pound fee. I explained that I had not paid £10 in the first place so did not want it refunding. I was then debited £10 for the removal of the ads. I thought ok....that's fair but really feel a bit put out especially when the paper white appeared a couple of days later at a much reduced rate.

Name: Mrs. L. M. Oliver
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 January 2019
Review Content: I bought the paperwhite as an update to my previous basic kindle and was very pleased with the backlight, the ease of transfer of my existing kindle books and the way it sorts them for you.  It made my old kindle look so basic I wished I had upgraded years ago!  It isnt too heavy and the print is very clear as the font can be changed, the text enlarged etc to suit which is a boon for people with poor eyesight.  I am still learning about it but so far, am happy.  I havent tried its waterproof qualities but its good to know that it is waterproof should the need arise!  All in all, I am delighted with my purchase.

Name: Deborah Monaghan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 September 2020
Review Content: I love it. However I don’t think the battery life is as states it would only apply if used very sparingly as I don’t it needs to be charged a lot more than weekly and I’m sure it advertised as even monthly. Nah not if you are avid reader as I am.However that said I lobe my new paper white it’s c my fourth and I’m not sure my last. Everything else about it is 5 🌟

Name: Mr. J. Ian Press
Review Title: Very good, but a couple of cons
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 November 2018
Review Content: It is very good and compact, I welcome the extra memory I chose, and I got used to it quite quickly. I do find the contrast somewhat unsatisfactory, though manageable. Most disappointing, though I did suspect this before purchase, is that the Teach Yourself audio (touch and listen) enhanced language textbooks, advertised on Amazon for Kindle, only have the audio on an iPad (and presumably iPhone, Apple laptop and Apple desktop). I use my iPad. Ok, I knew, but that doesn’t stop this being unsatisfactory.

Name: Noonerz
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 April 2019
Review Content: Great to use in all light conditions, handy and convenient size. Great for those with fading eyesight; with adjustable fonts, sizes, light levels, and massive storage capacity. I bought as my eyes are getting worse with age and I can now read far easier. The only problems I have with the Kindle is a clunky, terribly designed interface, designed for adults with children's hands or of course children - if this was made more intuitive, it could massively improve it. Though this shouldn't put you off a purchase - I am just being picky!

Name: B D Rogers
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 October 2019
Review Content: This is my second Paperwhite, after I dropped the first it ended up with a blank area on the screen. I miss the raised face of my old one as my fingers often inadvertently touch the screen and I loose the page I'm reading. The most annoying thing is the on/off button its location at the bottom of the kindle is where I place the fingers of my right hand as I hold it to read. Without a doubt  I will have accidentally turned of my Kindle three times for every hour of use. This button location also causes a problem if I try to stand it upright when I use it travelling on a train or aeroplane fold down table. I don't use a cover and my well travelled Kindle has scuff marks on the black surround but I've yet to scratch the face. My kindle is my favourite possession and would love to have a better version of my Paperwhite.

Name: Dr S P Deacon
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 January 2020
Review Content: I had to replace my previous Kindle due to a screen fault just outside warranty.This replacement opens slower than my previous KindleAlthough only a few weeks old it has already frozen once and required rebootingI am having trouble saving downloaded books to existing collectionsAlso I had anticipated this model to have 3 and 4G capability but this is not installedHaving been a Kindle user for several years I am somewhat disappointed

Name: dawn
Review Title: Could not transport books from old kindle in their collection format
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 December 2019
Review Content: Call me naive, but I had imagined that I would be able to port all my book collections across from my trusty eight year old kindle to this paper white. Not only are the enclosed instructions brief to the point of useless, it wasn’t easy to access any google guidance which really helped with this. Accordingly I had to completely re file all the collections which had been assigned in one general pile onto this new one. It took me about ten hours.....yes, I have a lot of books but isn’t that the whole point of having a kindle and creating libraries of samples, classics, unread, cookery and so on?

Name: Fiona
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 July 2020
Review Content: This is great , upgraded from my old Paperwhite that was getting a bit slow after quite a few years of daily use. I have the one with ads which is really no problem which I thought would be reading some reviews. It’s literally around 5 seconds and you swipe it away, not worth paying the extra £10 to have without.Would definitely recommend and wouldn’t be without it.

Name: JFDIT
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 April 2019
Review Content: I have had most of the Kindle readers and am delighted to say this version is the best so far.  It is lighter, thinner and the case is so much better. Less bulky and just slicker.The screen light is better diffused than before, no bright spots at the bottom of the screen.  For me this is a very worthwhile upgrade.Only comment, which is in respect of the software, please bring the screen brightness control slider forward rather than having to navigate to it via settings.

Name: K9 crazy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 September 2020
Review Content: My husband is a prolific reader and during lockdown books have cost us a fortune! I finally persuaded him to try a kindle - and he loves it!! It would not replace 'real' books for all reading, but for one read paperbacks it is brilliant. We have also chosen Kindle Unlimited and the combination is brilliant and superb value.  Would recommend for all bookworms everywhere.

Name: Mrs Livingstone
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 March 2019
Review Content: I loved my 6th generation Kindle PaperWhite which I bought in 2013 and I was told that the latest edition was much better and so I decided to purchase a brand new one.  It's great, but I'm disappointed because I can't detect any improvement. It's much slower 'waking up' than my old one and I honestly don't think the charge lasts any longer - in fact without doing a check I'd guess that it's not quite as good.  I'm giving it four stars because it's a Kindle and I love using one to read my favourite books but I don't think it's any better than my six year old one.

Name: Wendy Woo
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 August 2020
Review Content: Had to buy a new Kindle when I'd reached the maximum capacity of my original Kindle (with a keyboard format), this new 10th Generation style is so much smaller and lighter, although I do miss the side buttons to move back and forth through the book I'm reading, I'm still getting the hang of not hitting the screen whilst reading and finding myself on a totally new page!!  But in all honesty, I did have my original Kindle for almost 9yrs, so that might take a while, but I'm loving the fact I can read comics and magazines, read 'normal' books and listen to audio books all on a device the size of a smallish birthday card and it doesn't actually weigh a lot more than the card tbh, a very worthwhile purchase.

Name: fen
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 November 2018
Review Content: I have never used a Kindle before and I just love it.  It is sleek in its gorgeous red leather case, it is really slim to carry around in a handbag.  Plus, I have paired it with my iPhone, so if you are out and about and, for example, waiting for an appointment, you can access it on your iPhone via the Kindle app.  And for someone who is a bit of a technological dinosaur, it was relatively easy to set everything up.  The service was quick and efficient.  Really impressed all round.  My only slight bug bear was that not long after I bought it, it was £30 cheaper in the Black Friday deal!!

Name: English Roses
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 August 2019
Review Content: I had been toying with the idea of getting a Kindle for months but, because I hadn’t been reading much, I thought it was a waste of time. I also love to touch hard copy books and see them sitting neatly in my bookshelves. Recently, I have had more time on m hands so I thought I would find something to read. I most wanted to read books I had read years ago but many were no longer in print. I bought some used paperbacks which were classed as “very good” condition but all three I ordered were badly yellowed which put me off. And so I bought a Kindle. I thought for sure I wouldn’t use it much and wouldn’t warm to it. Was I wrong! I have had it about three weeks now and I have been able to read many books that were out of print.Things I love:- instant purchase, instant read. No waiting for books to arrive even though it is usually only a day as a Prime member.- can read out of print books easily- easy to carry to read on the train- lovely adjustable brightness that can be altered any time- syncs with goodreads.com- great battery time between charges- I have gone from not reading fiction at all to being excited about what I shall find to read nextThings I don’t like:- the leather cover I purchased can be tiring on the hands if you read a lot as I now do.- do check that the charger fits securely. I had to return the first Kindle because the USB cable kept falling out

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 September 2020
Review Content: This is my first Kindle and I bought it to have access to foreign literature which I cannot buy in my town. I am a book lover and I knew a Kindle could not entirely replace books for me, however, I was happy with an adequate result.These are my thoughts:The print colour isn't dark enough, unless you increase the screen brightness, in which case you'll be dazzled by it;The screen is slightly too small, so for a fast reader this means turning page every few seconds, or having a tiny font size (not very comfortable);The touch screen is quite slow to respond, I was expecting it to be like an Ipad but it feels more like an old one.Overall, for my personal reading experience, Kindle isn't suitable. But if you enjoy to read a few lines here and there and technology encourages you, then go for it.

Name: T-Barr
Review Title: The upgrade you didn't even know you needed
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 January 2019
Review Content: I love my  old Kindle. I had the original model (without a keyboard) and I never considered upgrading to the paperwhite, until my wife bought me one for Christmas. The difference is fantastic. No more struggling to find the best light source, and yet it never feels like a bright screen or tablet. The simple tap of the screen on either side turns the page, which is just perfect. The new home screen and navigation UI is a huge improvement as well!Go on...treat yourself!

Name: J. Barry
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 September 2020
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: Dr C.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 August 2020
Review Content: My previous paperwhite lasted 6+ years and would still be going strong had the electrical connection been more robust. The screen is so much better for sitting outdoors reading, than using a Fire or a computer to read documents. You can read books but also send work docs to your kindle address and take those with you to read anywhere too. This new kindle has an earphone port too, so I must try that sometime! These are more expensive than the Fire, and you can't watch movies... but buy a Fire for that, and use the Kindle for reading anywhere. It holds a very lot of books!

Name: sarah
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 August 2019
Review Content: Absolutely love my 2nd Kindle . It is really light even in the case I bought . Screen was fab on holiday in bright sunshine and also for reading in bed when other half was sleeping, didnt need bedside lamp on. I bought the Special Offers one unwittingly,  didn't realise the reason it was such a bargain was because of this but I think its fab as it advertises books you may like and is not a bad idea at all. Very happy with my purchase . Downloads so quickly too .

Name: M. S.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2020
Review Content: Active adverts on the device, which you can't switch off if you don't pay, is a scam. This program prevent device to wake up immediately to continue reading and is forcing reader to do extra swipe and wait to load ads and then to load your book. Bought as a Christmas gift for teenager, really disappointed. Now paid £10 RANSOM to Amazon to unlock device. It is a shame that you have to pay extra to unlock full potential of the device. Bought Kobo Clara HD for another boy for similar price and had all features on start without paying for releasing the device. From a ethical point of view shame on you Amazon.  WILL NOT BUY AGAIN AND WILL DO EVERYTHING TO AVOID SHOPPING ON AMAZON JUST BECAUSE YOU ARE NOT FAIR. I wash shopping on amazon over a decade but It is not about this £10 scam, it is personal now. You do bad things and you are bad guys.

Name: Kotryna
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 October 2020
Review Content: I had my Kindle for 1 year and a half, it was working well and I did enjoy using it.Unfortunately, one morning I found it with depleted batter and it never charged again.I've tried numerous times to revive it as I was shocked it can break from just sitting on my bedside table.I've contacted customer service, and the representative guided me through the same steps of reviving Kindle as I did before, with no luck.The audacity to offer me a 15% discount to buy a new Kindle after this one broke OUT OF BLUE?After 1.5 years of using it with proper care? Representative said it's usually unbreakable (hence my did?) and unrepairable.If only Amazon wouldn't make billions I would take this one neatly, but offering only 1-year device guarantee, ridiculous 15% for a new kindle that should replace UNBREAKABLE one?NO thanks, Jeff.

Name: Charlotte Main
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 March 2020
Review Content: I’ve found my love of reading again now that I have a new kindle! Had one years ago which the battery gave up on and then decided to read using the kindle app instead. Transitioned back to a physical kindle 2 months ago and although it took some time to get used to it (holding a larger item and the page not turning as quickly) I know love it and use it all the time.I have also bought the amazon cover in yellow for it which is amazing as the kindle auto turns on and off when you open and close the cover.

Name: Cymru am Byth
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 July 2019
Review Content: Having had a more expensive kindle Voyager for a few year. It broke. So I replaced it with this e reader. I must say for a fraction of the price of the voyager this e reader is no different when using than the more expensive one. The only difference is that it does not have adaptive lighting, and buttons on the side for page turning. But for a significant difference in price I don’t mind adjusting the light myself and I always swiped to change pages anyway. Great value

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: A bit pricey for what it is, returned for the basic model!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 July 2019
Review Content: Altough it is waterproof and had more storage, I don't feel you get a lot more for your money with the kindle paperwhite compared the new basic kindle. It may be that you feel you need it to be waterproof (say you like to read in the bath), but for me I felt I was paying a premium for features that I wouldn't really need. I replaced it with the basic kindle and it is perfect!Nice ereader though, but I feel you get a similar experience with the other kindle.

Name: Lartoe
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 February 2019
Review Content: I  have had various kindles in the past and loved them all, but after purchasing a Kindle Oasis last November which then lost 30% of its charge in 3 hours when not being used, I decided to get another Paperwhite (2018) instead. WOW!, glad I did that, it is lighter cheaper and more comfortable than the older Paperwhites,and I liked them, it is slightly smaller, AND came with a screen protector which I applied with no problems. I also bought a cover for it, you need to check that the covers fit the 2018 version (10th generation). Have had this for a couple of days now and enjoying it . It also fits in the rear pocket of my jeans even with the cover on...........unlike the Oasis!!overall , the best kindle out there..............trust me

Name: Tessa
Review Title: Probably my Best Buy this year
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 October 2020
Review Content: Absolutely love this kindle. My old 3rd generation sadly packed up and I really didn’t want to change it but my new one is brilliant. So easy to setup and use. Night time black background is perfect for my middle of the night reading habit. Can’t find a fault with it and got a brilliant deal on Prime special day. Would highly recommend my ‘twilight blue’ kindle to everyone.

Name: bayboy
Review Title: Only 2 days and appears to the worst Kindle so far
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 July 2019
Review Content: Wanted to like this my fourth Kindle. Waterproof and with audible. Replacing working 7th generation.ConsIt is so slow.Loading old content ok forever.Magnetic cover waste of time as have to swipe to unlock every time.Annoying banner at the bottom of library screens.Leaving WiFi on overnight results in zero battery by morning.Pros.  It was cheap on Prime DayBut still considering returning as the previous Kindle was easier to use.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 September 2020
Review Content: This was a replacement for my 5 year old kindle paper white which was struggling to recharge. Very similar to the original, I like the fact that it is waterproof as I like to read in the hot tub (hopefully this won’t be tested) downloading my existing library was very easy thanks to Amazons system. After reading other reviews I paid extra to have no special offers. I don’t know if this was worthwhile as I don’t know how intrusive the advertisements would be. However not having special offers meant having to wait considerably longer for delivery and the device was only available in black. Not sure why this should be. Perhaps a better description of what “ special offers “ entails would be helpful.

Name: Roger Snook
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 June 2020
Review Content: I bought this to replace my old manual keyboard Kindle, more to benefit from the backlighting than any of its other features.Is it an improvement? Yes and no.I like the backlighting and the fact that it is a bit lighter than my old kindle.I dislike the touchscreen, but then I find all touchscreens a nuisance as my fingers are too big to operate them with any success. Hence I also regret the loss of the keyboard.I miss the page advance and return buttons, which allowed one to read the Kindle one handed.I am aggravated that Amazon now insist that the Kindle has to be registered via Wifi, which I cannot access with any convenience.However, overall the one function which motivated my purchase, the backlighting, works well and the other inconveniences I can put up with. Just a pity the old keyboard version could not be supplied with backlighting.

Name: W. Sutherland
Review Title: Great reader let down slightly by interface.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 January 2020
Review Content: Like my new Kindle. Had the original keyboard version and was sad to see it go once it packed up. I like the way the new Kindle fits into my hand, I also like the lighting. Not 100% on the interface and I feel strangely that the kindle app on other devices is more intuitive and is more flexible and why this version should have less features feels odd.However as a reader it is great.

Name: Gabriel
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 March 2021
Review Content: This is was my third kindle. I bought it in Feb 2019 as a replacement for the one that I've lost. Light, touch and connectivity to WIFI is find, nothing to complain.The main problem is with its battery. It doesn't last as much as its predecessors and it if you're NOT using it it keeps discharging until it's completely dead.  I've managed to power it up for several times, but the last time after 2 years and 1 months since I bought it, it doesn't power up.Since warranty lasts only 1 year, Amazon gave me 15% off for a new kindle. There's no option to repair it or trade it back for a new or refurbished one. It feels such a waste .I'm not really satisfied with a 2 years lifetime for a product that I haven't used that much.Overall rating : 1 start

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 June 2020
Review Content: This is now the 3rd kindle i've owned in total, from an original, to a paperwhite 2e, to now the paperwhite 4e. You know exactly what you're getting, they all work pretty much the same; However, the new edition has added a high (300) dpi screen and bluetooth audio for audible books or read as text-to-speech. Bear in mind slightly smaller than paperwhite 1e-3e so old cases will not fit.

Name: The Engineer
Review Title: Should Have Got One Years Ago
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 April 2019
Review Content: Wow, love the kindle. I don't think I will go back to reading real books again. No awkward holding of the book, bending the spine and turning pages. Oh, and best of all you can check what any word means at the touch of the screen.The only downside is the books cost more now on kindle than they do in hardback. Absolute joke, but all down to the greedy publishers.

Name: Hedgemonkey
Review Title: Good screen, great in sunlight and the dark
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 June 2019
Review Content: So overall pretty good. I had the old Kindle touch which felt antiquated and slow and whilst this one is better it still lacks the responsive touch so many are used to on smart devices. Sometimes I’m not sure I’ve even pressed true screen properly it takes so long to react. I appreciate these are designed to a single purpose but the leap in technology hasn’t teakky been what I expected based on my experiences of Kindle. Great device overall, just don’t expect lightening performance. It is what it is.

Name: Mrs H
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2020
Review Content: When my old paper-white decided to take a bath in washing machine I was devastated, had to replace ASAP as reading hardback book in bed was danger to health ( hit me in face each time I nodded off).Love these as easy to hold can read in bed without disturbing other half by keeping light on and handy to fit in handbag. This one is supposedly waterproof but the washing machine is definitely a no no.Update - decided i would bin washing machine damaged kindle only to find it now works perfectly, how amazing !

Name: R O'B
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 April 2019
Review Content: Disapointed that the battery life does not live up to expectatios, though i'm not sure what level of use it was calculated on, i got the fast charge plug and that works really well.  Strugling with the fact that when i select for collections on the home page it seems to open the contents of the collection as well, which is not at all what i want.  i often re read books and don't like that i have to scroll through 115 pages etc etc.  love the slimness and light weight though. Added later, i've sorted out how to find collections, so thats ok

Name: Raymond Morrison
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 September 2019
Review Content: The device is OK, but the software, when compared to phone, PC, iPad, etc, is poor. It is clunky and not in the least intuitive.When I bought the device, transferring my collections and books was a nightmare. I thought it would happen automatically when I registered the device, but NO. I then spent half a day talking to Amazon support staff getting nowhere. Eventually I transferred everything manually. It took ages, probably half a day.Since then I discovered that the device I bought was the cheaper version with recommendations. Every time I switched on it showed book recomebdations and there was a recommendation banner across the bottom of my home page. All very annoying. Amazon were again unable to help me and I eventually found instruction on the internet and removed the rubbish myself. If you have the same problem, do a search on the internet. You will find easy to follow instructions.The bottom line is, the device is OK, but Amazon support is hopeless; worse than hopeless, because they waste your time when you could either figure it out yourself or get help elsewhere.

Name: Sean B.
Review Title: A great premium e-reader. Makes reading a joy!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 December 2018
Review Content: Things I love:- Invert colours to white on black while reading, though I wish this was easier to enable/disable rather than it being buried deep in accessibility settings.- The new simplified design is MUCH nicer than previous generations, and the flush screen gets a big thumbs up from me. It's nice and comfortable to hold for extended periods.Things that could be improved:- Ability to change sleep screen wallpaper, or just update with some new ones Amazon! Getting bored of seeing fountain pens and pencils all the time. I'm sure this could be easily done with minor regular updates!- Minimum brightness still seems too bright when trying to discreetly read in complete darkness, i.e. in bed next to a sleeping partner.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2020
Review Content: I love my kindle, I’ve been funny about getting a kindle as I love the feel of a book, picking out a new book, turning the page, But after talking to my friend who has a kindle said how good they are, so I went for it and I wasn’t disappointed.  I can actually read quicker as it’s much clearer, reading at night whilst the other half is asleep great too as there isn’t a bright light, books are generally cheaper too. Can’t wait to take it away and not have to carry the books and no struggling to read in the bright sun! It’s a win all round !

Name: Sugar
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 July 2020
Review Content: I had bought one of the original kindles years ago.  This was to replace it. It is as good as and even better than before. Pricey yes, quality and up to the job yes definitely. So easy to use and read anywhere, whether it be in the dark or in the sunlight, holding it is easier as well. No more fiddly keyboard.  It has proved to be a real bonus during lockdown.

Name: Joe Bloggs22
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 May 2020
Review Content: Happy to have my new  kindle, however a little unhappy as the charger lead doesn’t work, wasted a whole day yesterday trying to charge kindle.I’ve had the kindle less than a month, and this would have been my 2nd charge, it did work the 1st time. Have tried online help to get a replacement unsuccessfully, can’t phone Amazon because of the current crisis.

Name: jmiw
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 January 2019
Review Content: This was a present to upgrade from my old version, which was still good. The difference is fairly significant. To read with the previous one I had a case with a light but, the visibility towards the bottom of the screen was only semi lit. The new one with a backlight makes it effortless to read at night and the whole page is evenly visible.The other big difference I notice is the clarity of the print, all the edges are crisp and very easy to read.Really pleased with it and would definitely recommend

Name: Alison
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 January 2020
Review Content: I have been very reluctant to change from proper books to a Kindle - however this was bought for me as a present and I love it.  Perfect for reading  in bed without disturbing the other half by having to put the light on.It's very light, small and easy to hold and use.  The touch screen isn't as sensitive as a phone screen but still absolutely fine.  The waterproof nature means that it's safe to read in the bath! I bought a cover for it as I'm prone to scratching screens and it does the job nicely.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Unusable after only 18 months. Otherwise fine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2020
Review Content: 18 months in (so out of warranty) and the touch starts going haywire. Flipping pages and making it impossible to use. Contacted support who after running through a reset offered me a 15% discount on a new kindle. Not good enough. Putting aside the cost the electrical waste of having a device like this last only 18 months is disgraceful. My first non touch kindle lasted 7 years and was still usable barring its screen degradation.

Name: Reader
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2020
Review Content: This is an amended review following the impressive response by customer service in addressing my grievance regarding ads.The device is basically a delight to use, and the screen no longer has that dry granite feel of earlier models, which - depending on whom you asked - ranged from unpleasant to downright unbearable to the touch. No such issues here, though. It’s smooth as glass and ergonomically beautiful.There’s a serious issue, though. The decision to place the on/off button on the bottom of the device is utterly baffling. Forget about leaning the device against something so that you can free your hands and go on reading. On a hard surface at least, the button will be activated and the kindle will reboot.Perhaps this issue would be solved by using a case/ cover, but I expressly don’t want one. This device is compact and light, and a pleasure to handle as is. My older paperwhite sits in a case which adds weight and bulk, and this would greatly detract from the sleek simplicity of this iteration.Please rethink the button placement, designers. It’s in the worst possible place!

Name: Sue Parks
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 April 2020
Review Content: I can’t use this, it is either not charging or has another fault.Can I return this?  My last kindle lasted for years, this one has barely been used as it has problems right from the start.I have reported these problems but never been able to get through to get them fixed.If you look at this you will see I have never been able to read any of the books I bought.

Name: Robert Archer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 May 2019
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: Mrs Tys
Review Title: Brilliant as Expected with All Kindles
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2019
Review Content: Kindle paper-white tops all the e-readers and has headed the market for many years. This is my 3rd Kindle and they have improved with each generation. This one being waterproof/splash proof is a bonus and even though I do not take it near water it will be great for around the pool on holiday.  Also this is much smaller than the previous kindles and as such much lighter and easier to hold for prolonged time. I have no hesitation recommending this Kindle.

Name: Jcloth
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 December 2019
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: William R. Adams
Review Title: Be aware there are two versions £10 in price difference. The cheaper one has advertisements.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 June 2019
Review Content: This is the first Kindle that I’ve owned and I’m very happy with it. Until now I’d only used an iPad for reading e-books which was way to heavy after using it for elongated periods. Delivery time was super fast and the set up was really easy. The only thing I would point out is that, for those people used to using iOS or Android touch devices, the touch screen and OS is not as smooth and intuitive as either Android/iOS. This is of course a somewhat unfair comparison since the purpose of these devices is different to that of a dedicated e-reader. Overall I would highly recommend the Kindle. It’s light, simple to use and very good value. It has brought me back to reading on a regular basis after a ‘digital hiatus’.

Name: Gill E
Review Title: Lovely item.  Feels as good in your hand as a book does.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2020
Review Content: This is my third Kindle, second Paperwhite.  This is slightly smaller than my previous one, but that doesn’t affect the reading quality and it’s much lighter to hold.  Battery life is excellent and it’s indispensable for travelling.  The only downsides are that you still can’t turn off the dictionaries - annoying when you are tired and leave a finger too long on the screen - and the addition of advertising every time you open the Kindle, which again can’t be turned off.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 November 2018
Review Content: i never wanted a kindle cos i love the feel and smell of a true paper book...however, i purchased one and i am so thrilled with it....lovely weight and size and my favourite thing is that i can invert the text so i now read white writing on black background which stops the tired eye syndrome i get with my eye condition...abso wonderful...and order books is so easy and quick..ty amazon...good product

Name: Capt Wilkie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2018
Review Content: *********************EDITED********************************The replacement after a lot of messing about is now working fine the current Mrs W, i quite happy with itAs below why it decided to make me the user, I don't know, all this is what drives me insane with these products, after resetting the device completely,  got it set up with Mrs Ws details, the delivery driver need a telling off fancy dropping through the door, It landed with such a bang Im surprised it worked, so although a faff all good (eventually)

Name: Shan
Review Title: Very poor replacement for older generation kindles
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 September 2019
Review Content: This is Kindle number 4 for me and I have to say, I'm disappointed. Battery life is terrible. Transition between pages is clumsy. Magnetic wake-up and switch off doesn't work at all. The lighting is quite glaring and makes my eyes hurt. The power button is far too easily knocked, which then switches the kindle off. I have not had these issues with any of my other kindles. I really would not recommend it. Buy an older generation if you can.

Name: Mr. S. Burnett
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 November 2019
Review Content: Probably one of the best gadgets I have ever purchased - I travel a lot and carrying books is no fun and therefore often avoided - I wish I’d purchased one years ago when studying.The two areas I would like to see improved:- touch screen is a little slow when used to mobile phones and iPads etc- would like to see colour images in the future modelsEdited to 4 stars as not all Kindle Books are compatible with the Paperwhite version, frustrating!!

Name: J C
Review Title: Great reading device - ticks all the boxes
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 September 2020
Review Content: I like the lightness and easy handling of this Kindle.Perfect to read in bed comfortably.The adjustable light and white on black option is also useful.Looks nice with the different colour option.Would prefer if  options are numbered in an easier way as difficult to match up screen protectors and cases.Great free subscription of three months Kindle unlimited included with Kindle.

Name: Chamanthi Powell
Review Title: small, good backlight, reads like a book
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 February 2019
Review Content: I've had one of the 1st Kindle's that came out for the past 9 years but unfortunately finally died so I bought this one.  Love the fact that it is smaller, reads very well, has a good backlight so I don't need an extra light to read in the dark.  The only reason I didn't give it a five was because if the Wi-Fi is kept on the battery doesn't last long so I put it in aeroplane mode - this means that it takes longer to download any new items once Wi-Fi switched back on - I had to restart the kindle twice.Hope it lasst as long as my old Kindle!

Name: Booklover
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 November 2018
Review Content: Yet again a brilliant product from Amazon. Yes there isn't too much difference between this one and the old paperwhite. But the waterproof aspect and the extra memory is a great bonus. It also feels a lot lighter than previous models. Battery lasts about 9 days for me who spends a lot of time reading. The only disappointing thing is the fact that Amazon reduced the price 2 weeks later by £30. Not a very loyal thing to do to those who pre ordered for the release date. Amazon very naughty of you

Name: Ethan Brewerton
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 February 2021
Review Content: The Kindle Paperwhite is extremely slow and unresponsive:- Pressing or holding the on/off button never turns it off standby- The 40-second reset only occasionally works- The touchscreen has a lag time of a few seconds when navigating between screens (not on pages)- After moving on from the home page, the images of the book covers are still faintly visibleConsidering the price & reviews I was expecting the Kindle to be useful, but the technology seems outdated and unresponsive. Its as though I'm trying to read a novel on an early 2000 Nokia.I was hoping it'd be a simply switch from books to a Kindle but I'm forever trying to reset this just to read a few extra pages.I'm not sure whether I have a faulty Kindle or they all have these issues, but, as I don't have to reset a physical book to read the next page, I think I'll stick with paperbacks for now.

Name: Kitchenbound
