Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 March 2020
Review Content: Love my Kindle paperwhite - the battery life has not had long enough for me to comment but the back light is very useful. I am still getting to grips with the way my library is displayed - I'm too busy reading to have spent much time learning the differences between my old Kindle and this new edition. i can confirm that the up grade has been worthwhile and I am very happy to recommend it.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 April 2019
Review Content: So I’ve resisted converting to kindle for years...I like a book, that is unless it’s a hefty hardback I need to carry or try and read in bed, or I’m packing 3 or 4 books for a holiday.Benefits- You can highlight text and mark pages to go back to- Read at night without needing a light on- Tones of books in a small device that slots in a bag or airplane seat pocket- Download new books on WiFi- Try samples firstNiggles- navigation needs practice- couldn’t find any punctuation beyond a full stop when leaving a review- prompts you to write a reviewer the end but if not on WiFi tricky to find this prompt again

Name: RJ
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 March 2020
Review Content: I have been wanting to read more books but I found that I quite disliked physical books. They're thick, heavy and prone to damage when in my bag. I am a student so my bag is often heavy. This kindle is perfect. It's lightweight and easy to use. the touch screen is quite delayed but i assume that it's because of the mechanics etc, however, works perfectly fine and only use it often when turning pages. I love the built in light, you can adjust it as well. I have read so many books in the space of one month compared to if I were to read physical books. love it and recommend it.

Name: DannyBoy
Review Title: A great product - just be aware that the slightly cheaper version displays adverts.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 September 2019
Review Content: I’m a late-comer to the e-reader market so I have nothing to compare this to other than Kindle for iPhone, but I’m very impressed so far! It’s very well thought-out, with great features and functionality, and I love having my entire library in my pocket, wherever I happen to be. My one criticism is that Amazon could have made it clearer that the standard version displays adverts, and that for around £10 more, an ad-free version is available.

Name: Fiona
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 July 2020
Review Content: I was dubious about moving to an e reader. I need not have worried, this Kindle paperwhite is fantastic, very easy on my eyes, no glare, waterproof, and the battery life is incredible. I bought an amazon cover for mine with a cloth material feel and this makes holding it while reading a plesent experience. I would highly recommend this kindle, don't hesitate!

Name: MoDancer
Review Title: A good reader with a major flaw
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 August 2019
Review Content: The Paper white is easy to read and has many features which I have still to use.The power button is in the most awkward place. The tendancy is to turn off whilst trying to read. It would have been so much better to place it at the top where there is no chance of accidentally pressing it whilst supporting the weight .While not a heavy item, it is heavy enough to activate the switch.Overall I like the reader and with a little thought during design could have been an excellent reader

Name: Mr A P Beech
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 March 2019
Review Content: This is my first e-reader, so I wasn't sure if I was going to take to it over paper. But... as with any good book as soon as you start to read you forget about the packaging and just enjoy the content.As a device, it's great - the display is excellent, being super-clear in all conditions I've used it in so far. It's easy to use and you don't need to be a tech guru to find your way around. For those who want to, there's good features such as the dictionary, comments and community groups.I'm a Prime user, so the content I've downloaded and read so far hasn't cost me anything extra.It's light, and after 3 weeks of constant use and over 1,000 pages read I've still got over 25% battery life remaining.I was hoping to reduce the number of paperbacks I have to free up some shelf space - the Kindle Paperwhite is going to allow me to do that.Recommended.

Name: Rob Kennedy Photography
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 October 2020
Review Content: I bought this in the Prime Day sale for a great price and I’m delighted I got it.It seems a lot smaller than my old Kindle Touch, but apparently it’s the bezel that has shrunk.Mine is supposed to be the “with Special Offers” version, but if it is they are the most subtle adverts ever as i haven’t seen one yet.The led lighting is great for night time reading, or even daytime in a dull room.Well happy.

Name: Elisha
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2020
Review Content: I have never been a fan of e books and up until recently I would have stood by those words, although there is nothing better than holding a REAL fresh book in your hands.. the smell of the pages.. the excitement and anticipation of being able to lose your self whilst flicking through those pages ,,to find your self in other worlds,,.. Until you have read every single book that you can find by your favourite author to find out that the last remaining ones that you haven't read are no longer being published and are only available in digital format..... I couldn't bare the thought of having to read books by my favourite authors on my mobile phone or my clunky iPad SO I bit the bullet,, yes ..yes I did,, and as the title states I was rather surprised,, the backlit screen was very easy on the eyes and once I adjusted the brightness to a slightly lower setting it was no different to looking at real pages from a real book. Although I will ALWAYS favour a real book over a digital one, I can honestly say that this really is the next best thing. I now carry it with me every where I go and it saves my beloved books getting scuffed up in my bag because I am one of those women whose bag is always full of a load of unnesscersary shhhh###

Name: Eliz M
Review Title: Disappointing purchase for sight impaired person :(
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 October 2020
Review Content: I am Partially Sighted & had high hopes that with this Kindle I would find reading easier & more books accessible. Unfortunately the menu font is tiny & cannot be increased in size. The font is not black, as it appears in all the pictures, but dark grey. This did not give me enough contrast between the font & screen  to be able to read comfortably. Some of the books I downloaded are not compatible with this Kindle. For example coloured print was shown as pale grey which was difficult even to people with good eye sight.

Name: Shon
Review Title: Lightweight, needs very little charge! Fab product
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 August 2019
Review Content: Love using a kindle! I love books so I wasn’t sure I’d be a convert - but it’s lightweight, perfect to travel with and gets easier to use once you’ve played about for a few hours with it. The light feature is great - no eye strain or brightness, you can also change the font and size to suit which I love! I also like not having to charge it, I can use it for days on end without needing to recharge which is a great feature. My only criticism is the lock button on the bottom of the screen, I tend to accidentally turn it off a lot when I’m using due to holding it with one hand.

Name: Lorie Boylin
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 June 2020
Review Content: I have only given it 4 stars as had to send the first one back as the pages flipped forward a few pages without me touching the screen and would go on to dictionary without me touching the screen. I bought another one as was not able to take first one back to shop being shut due to COVID-19 and the next one was amazing as expected. If it was not for this one off fault, i would have certainly given it a 5. Otherwise absolutely love the paperwhite.

Name: Tomas
Review Title: Why oh why is the power button there?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 July 2019
Review Content: Fantastic kindle. I love it. My only gripe is the fact that the power button has been placed on the bottom edge of the Kindle, so fairly frequently whilst I hold the device (supported by a finger) I accidentally turn it off. Next design, please move the button to the top where the kindle never gets held. Quite how the position of that button got signed off is a mystery. Such a simple mistake ruins what would otherwise be a 5 star bit of kit.

Name: Lorraine Williams
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 October 2020
Review Content: Good product, the built in light is much better than my last Kindle. Love the dark feature. Touch screen moves a bit faster than last kindle. Down side is battery doesn't last as long, I've had it now just over a week and have had to charge it twice already. Battery on my last kindle lasted a hell of a lot longer. Have turned down the brightness on both normal and dark will see if that makes a difference.

Name: Mrs. L. Dunn
Review Title: How to begin to using a Kindle, to enjoy reading the written word in a world of books.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2020
Review Content: First time use. Had to have a lot of help to get starting up, but once on my own, I have managed to sort out the basics. Enjoying picking it up to continue reading, stopping when I want to. Will be a test when needing a new book, but should be able to sort that out, as instructions are fairly simple to do. Trial and error. More so as confidence builds up. Good size to hold. Firm ‘holder’. Going to enjoy using the machine.

Name: Roger Lowe
Review Title: It is a portable library in your pocket.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 February 2019
Review Content: The 32gb 10th edition can hold my current library but with ample space to add much more books in the future.Being waterproof is a bonus as I used to worry about my old Kindle getting wet on holiday especially by the pool.It is also quicker to download books with the 4g lite option. I would recommend the new version to anyone with an older Kindle or to some one thinking about buying a Kindle for the first time.It is easier to carry my library in a Kindle than to take paperbacks on holiday which take up valuable weight allowances.It is also handy  to take it on trains,buses,planes and long car journeys. You cannot go wrong if you purchase a kindle.

Name: Ronnie Keir
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 August 2020
Review Content: This is a superb little device. I wanted a dedicated reading device rather than reading on a phone or tablet containing additional apps / distractions. I was not disappointed in the purchase of this 10th generation Kindle. Back-light is great, enables me to read in any light conditions, both indoor and outdoor. Small size is perfect for one-handed reading, very light too. Battery life totally fine for me, I read every day and find the device needs charged around once every 7-10 days. Charging via standard cable supplied with device is quick, around an hour from low to full charge. I operate the device mostly in flight mode as once I have downloaded the books I’m reading why would I need to have it connected to WiFi? I believe this helps maintain longer battery life in between charge cycles too. Overall I think it’s a cracking piece of kit :)

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 December 2018
Review Content: I bought this as a replacement for an older kindle paperwhite, mostly for the ability to listen to audio books. However I was dismayed when trying to connect to my pair of over ear headphones that it couldn't find my device. It turns out that only selective headphones/ earphones that do not have a microphone and a number of other requirements are usable on this device. This was not indicated anywhere beforehand and seems like a MAJOR issue that was over looked.Without this feature I can't justify using this over my new device, the device runs at the same speed and although the screen is better it just isn't enough to justify spending on a new device.

Name: Valerie R.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 August 2020
Review Content: Love this kindle I love to read so when my Daughter and Husband bought me this for my Birthday I was over the moon. I must admit because I’m of the older generation I had to have help on using it as no instructions with it then I also needed help on how to access the actual books now I know how to use it I’m thrilled with it wish I’d got one years ago.

Name: Rea66
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 June 2020
Review Content: I have had an older version since 2011 and it was still working until I leant on it under my pillow and did the damage, I can't not read every day so had to order a new one this is so great wish I had done it sooner love everything about it, been in the garden with sunshine and read during the night all the same, able to read wherever can't fault it personally x

Name: caroline neville
Review Title: Small neat kindle with back light easy viewing you books
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 December 2020
Review Content: The kindle is small neat compact  and i could fit in to my bag to read on the bus.I found i did not have to charge to many times it depended on how much i readI liked that the kindle is waterproof so you can read it where there may be the odd splash of water.Easy to use  as i found ,as there is a users guide on the home screen.Good value for the money

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 December 2019
Review Content: Still a bit slippy without a case. Bezel still a little large, bookmarking a little hit and miss and slows noticably during reading a large book or multiple series book, but still a great little reader. Be nice if you could listen to music on btooth headphones with it while reading, rather than having to use a second device. Plenty big enough for a little more storage for music, without having to buy a kindle fire!!
